original: gang kun du sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: gang kun du sbyor zhe na /
translated: What does it bind to?

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal kun du mngon par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal kun du mngon par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: It binds to the manifestation of suffering in the future.

original: de bzhin du khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the fetters of anger, etc.

original: khong khro'i kun du sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: khong khro'i kun du sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the fetter of anger?

original: sems can dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyi chos rnams la sems kyi kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: It is the malevolence of mind towards sentient beings, suffering and the causes of suffering.

original: khong khro'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: khong khro'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni /
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of anger

original: khong khro'i rgyu las sems yal bar mi 'dor te /
analyzed: khong khro'i rgyu las sems yal bar mi 'dor te /
translated: does not abandon the cause of anger.

original: gang gis mi dge ba spyod dge pa mi spyod do //
analyzed: gang gis mi dge ba spyod dge pa mi spyod do //
translated: Because of that, he does not practice virtue and practices much that is not virtuous.

original: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because of that, he is bound to suffering in the future.

original: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the fetter of pride?

original: nga rgyal bdun te /
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun te /
translated: There are seven kinds of pride:

original: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and false pride.

original: nga rgyal gang /üîΩchung du bas bdag che ba'am /
analyzed: nga rgyal gang / chung du bas bdag che ba'am /
translated: What is pride?

original: mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks I am superior or I am equal in relation to an inferior or an equal.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal gang /üîΩmtshungs pa bas bdag che ba'am /
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal gang / mtshungs pa bas bdag che ba'am /
translated: What is excessive pride?

original: che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: che ba dang mtshungs so snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks I am superior or I am equal in relation to an equal or to a superior.

original: nga rgyal las nga rgyal gang /
analyzed: nga rgyal las nga rgyal gang /
translated: What is pride of pride?

original: che ba bas kyang bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o /
analyzed: che ba bas kyang bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o /
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks I am superior in relation to a superior.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang /üîΩnye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la bdag gam /
translated: What is the pride of thinking I am?

original: bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir yang dag par rjes su lta ba'i sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which considers the five aggregates of attachment as I or mine.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩcung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gang gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par bdag gis thob bo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal gang /
translated: Arrogance of thinking I am is the inflation of the mind which thinks I am without having obtained the special attainment of a higher stage.

original: khyad ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩlog pa'i nga rgyal gang /üîΩyon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: khyad ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung ngo snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o // log pa'i nga rgyal gang / yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la /
translated: Arrogance of thinking I am a little bit is the inflation of the mind which thinks I am a little bit inferior to those who are very superior.

original: bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Arrogance of perversion is the inflation of the mind which thinks I have good qualities when one does not have good qualities.

original: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / ngar yir 'dzin pa yongs su mi shes so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang / ngar yir 'dzin pa yongs su mi shes so //
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of arrogance does not understand the non-apprehension of I and mine.

original: yongs shes na dar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhes nas /
analyzed: yongs shes na dar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa la mngon par zhes nas /
translated: When one understands that, one does not apprehend I and mine, and

original: mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: one does not practice virtue, but practices non-virtue.

original: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon bar 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //üîΩma rig pa'i kun @190a * //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon bar 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro // ma rig pa'i kun @190a * //
translated: It is called the fetter of suffering because it causes the manifestation of suffering in the future.

original: du sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: du sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the fetter of ignorance?

original: khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the non-understanding of the three realms.

original: ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams dang / kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams la lhag par chags so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni sdug bsngal gyi chos rnams dang / kun 'byung ba'i chos rnams la lhag par chags so //
translated: The person who is fettered by ignorance is attached to the things which are the cause of suffering and the things which are the cause of origination.

original: 'bras bu dang / rgyur gyur pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / de'i nyes dmigs yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / rgyur gyur pa'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams dang / de'i nyes dmigs yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not understand the defilement of the conditioned which is the cause and the effect, and the danger inherent in it.

original: de dag la lhag par chags pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: de dag la lhag par chags pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Because of this attachment, he does not practice the good and practices the bad.

original: gang gis phyi ma'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is called the fetter of suffering because it causes the manifestation of suffering in the future.

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the fetter of views?

original: lta ba gsum ste /
analyzed: lta ba gsum ste /
translated: It is the three views,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o /
translated: namely, the view of individuality, the view of grasping extremes, and false view.

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log par nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol lo //üîΩmngon par zhen to //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log par nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol lo // mngon par zhen to //
translated: One who is endowed with the fetter of views clings to a false liberation.

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log par nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol zhes pa ni bdag grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni log par nges par 'byung ba yongs su tshol zhes pa ni bdag grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is endowed with the fetter of views seeks a false liberation means that one thinks, ‚ÄúI will be liberated,‚Äù

original: bdag grol lo //üîΩbdag grol nas kyang rtag par 'gyur ro snyam pa'am /
analyzed: bdag grol lo // bdag grol nas kyang rtag par 'gyur ro snyam pa'am /
translated: ‚ÄúI am liberated,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHaving been liberated, I will be permanent,‚Äù

original: chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chad par 'gyur te /
translated: or ‚ÄúI will be annihilated.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas pa la thar pa med do snyam du rtag tu sbyor bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la thar pa med do snyam du rtag tu sbyor bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: One who is endowed with the fetter of views clings to a false liberation means that one always applies oneself, thinking, ‚ÄúThere is no liberation in Buddhism.‚Äù

original: log par nges par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: log par nges par 'byung ba la mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Because of clinging to a false liberation, one engages in nonvirtue and does not engage in virtue.

original: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because of that, one is joined with suffering, since one will manifestly achieve suffering in the future.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the fetter of holding to be paramount?

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o /
translated: It is holding views to be paramount and holding morality and asceticism to be paramount.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ba dang ldan pa ni log par nges par 'byung ba'i thabs la rtog cing /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ba dang ldan pa ni log par nges par 'byung ba'i thabs la rtog cing /
translated: Those who possess the fetter of holding to be paramount investigate the means of false deliverance.

original: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad po bor nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyis dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad po bor nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs kyis dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They reject the eightfold noble path and believe that purity comes from the view of the transitory collection and so on and from the morality and asceticism that precede it.

original: mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: They engage in nonvirtue through their strong attachment and do not engage in virtue.

original: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: They are bound to suffering because they create the causes for future suffering.

original: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the fetter of doubt?

original: gang bden ba rnams la yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: gang bden ba rnams la yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: It is doubt about the truths.

original: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni /üîΩsangs rgyas dkon mchog la som nyi za zhing /
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni / sangs rgyas dkon mchog la som nyi za zhing /
translated: Those who possess the fetter of doubtüîΩdoubt the jewel of the Buddha,

original: chis dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog la som nyi za'o //
analyzed: chis dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog la som nyi za'o //
translated: doubt the jewel of the Dharma, and doubt the jewel of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: dkon mchog rnams la som nyi za bas legs par sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog rnams la som nyi za bas legs par sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of doubt about the Jewels, one does not practice well.

original: dkon mchog rnams legs par mi sgrub pas mi dge ba @190b spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
analyzed: dkon mchog rnams legs par mi sgrub pas mi dge ba @190b spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
translated: Because of not practicing well with regard to the Jewels, one does not practice virtue and one practices vice.

original: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
translated: Because of that, one is joined with suffering, since one will experience suffering in the future.

original: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba gang /
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba gang /
translated: What is the fetter of envy?

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas pha rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod par byas pa'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas pha rol gyi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod par byas pa'i sems khong nas 'khrug pa'o //
translated: It is an inner disturbance of mind, caused by excessive attachment to gain and honor, by intolerance of another's success.

original: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi chos gces su 'dzin ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi chos gces su 'dzin ba ma yin no //
translated: The person who is bound by envy values gain and honor, but does not value the Dharma.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod de /
translated: Because of valuing gain and honor, he practices vice and does not practice virtue.

original: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is associated with suffering because it produces suffering in the future.

original: ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba gang rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas yo byad rnams la sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba gang rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pas yo byad rnams la sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The fetter of avarice is the mind's grasping at objects due to excessive attachment to gain and honor.

original: ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa ni /
translated: One who is bound by the fetter of avarice

original: sog pa gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sog pa gces su 'dzin pa yin gyi /
translated: holds on to wealth as dear,

original: yo byad bsnyungs pa gces su 'dzi pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yo byad bsnyungs pa gces su 'dzi pa ma yin te /
translated: not to the practice of austerity as dear.

original: sog pa gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
analyzed: sog pa gces su 'dzin pas mi dge ba spyod cing dge ba mi spyod do //
translated: Because of holding on to wealth as dear, one engages in non-virtue and does not engage in virtue.

original: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon bar 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: gang gis phyi ma la sdug bsngal mngon bar 'grub par byed pas sdug bsngal dang sbyor ro //
translated: It is associated with suffering because it produces suffering in the future.

original: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'ching ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three bonds:

original: 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba dang / zhe sdang gi 'ching ba dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba dang / zhe sdang gi 'ching ba dang / gti mug gi 'ching ba'o //
translated: the bond of desire, the bond of hatred, and the bond of delusion.

original: 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The bond of desire binds one to the suffering of change.

original: zhe sdang gi 'ching bas ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi 'ching bas ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The fetter of hatred binds to the suffering of suffering.

original: gti mug gi 'ching bas ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gti mug gi 'ching bas ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid la 'ching bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The fetter of delusion binds to the suffering of formations.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching bas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pas 'ching bar bstan pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la phra rgyas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching bas 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid la sogs pas 'ching bar bstan pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la phra rgyas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The fetter of attachment, etc., binds to the suffering of change, because attachment, etc., increase in pleasant feeling, etc.

original: yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la brten nas dge ba la sbyor ba na 'dod ba bzhin du byed pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: yang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la brten nas dge ba la sbyor ba na 'dod ba bzhin du byed pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: Moreover, when one is engaged in virtue in dependence on attachment, hatred, and delusion, one does not obtain the desired activity.

original: de'i phyir yang de dag ni 'ching ba rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang de dag ni 'ching ba rnams so //
translated: Therefore, they are also fetters.

original: phyi rol gyi 'ching bas bcings pa ni gnyis mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'ching bas bcings pa ni gnyis mi 'thob ste /
translated: One who is bound by external fetters does not obtain the two.

original: 'gro ba mi 'thob pa dang / 'dug kyang ji ltar 'dod pa dang / bsams pa dang spyod pa la 'dod bzhin du byed pa mi 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba mi 'thob pa dang / 'dug kyang ji ltar 'dod pa dang / bsams pa dang spyod pa la 'dod bzhin du byed pa mi 'thob pa'o //
translated: One does not obtain the human condition, nor does one obtain to sit as one wishes, to act as one wishes, to do what one intends and what one is accustomed to do.

original: nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the fetters of internal attachment, etc., are similar to that.

original: bag la nyal ni bdun te /üîΩ'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / khong khro'i bag la nyal dang / srid pa'i @191a * //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni bdun te / 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / khong khro'i bag la nyal dang / srid pa'i @191a * //
translated: There are seven latent proclivities:

original: 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / the tshom gyi bag la nyal lo //üîΩ'dod pas 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang / nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / the tshom gyi bag la nyal lo // 'dod pas 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: latent proclivity of attachment to pleasure, latent proclivity of hostility, latent proclivity of attachment to existence, latent proclivity of pride, latent proclivity of ignorance, latent proclivity of views, and latent proclivity of doubt.üîΩThe latent proclivity of attachment to pleasure is the negative reflex that is favorable to attachment to pleasure.

original: khong khro'i ngag la nyal ni khong khro'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: khong khro'i ngag la nyal ni khong khro'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The latent proclivity of hostility is the negative reflex that is favorable to hostility.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //üîΩnga rgyal gyi bag la nyal ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no // nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal ni /
translated: The latent tendency of attachment to existence is the negative reflex that is in conformity with attachment to the form and formless realms.

original: nga rgyal gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
translated: The latent tendency of pride is the negative reflex that is in conformity with pride.

original: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ni ma rig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag la nyal ni ma rig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //

original: lta ba'i bag la nyal ni lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: lta ba'i bag la nyal ni lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //

original: the tshom gyi bag la nyal ni the tshom gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no //üîΩ'dod pa tshol ba ma spangs pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang // khong khro'i bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom gyi bag la nyal ni the tshom gyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len no // 'dod pa tshol ba ma spangs pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dang // khong khro'i bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The latent tendency of doubt is the negative reflex that is in conformity with doubt.üîΩThe latent tendencies of attachment to sense objects and aversion increase due to not abandoning the search for sense objects.

original: 'dod pa 'tshol bam spangs pa'i 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang / khong khro'i bag la nyal phra rgyas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'tshol bam spangs pa'i 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang / khong khro'i bag la nyal phra rgyas su 'gyur te /

original: de'i sgo nas de gnyis rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de gnyis rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: srid pa tshol ba ma spangs pas srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba ma spangs pas srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The latent proclivity of the desire for existence increases because the search for existence is not abandoned.

analyzed: log par tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba ma spangs pas nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal dang / ma rig pa'i bag la nyal dang / lta ba'i bag la nyal dang / the tshom gyi bag la nyal rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: The latent proclivity of pride, the latent proclivity of ignorance, the latent proclivity of views, and the latent proclivity of doubt increase because the search for a false purity is not abandoned.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po chung ngu tsam gyis kyang khengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i gnyen po chung ngu tsam gyis kyang khengs par 'gyur ro //

original: bden pa rnams la'ang rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la'ang rmongs par 'gyur ro //

original: log pa'i thar pa dang / thar pa'i thabs la'ang rtog par byed do //
analyzed: log pa'i thar pa dang / thar pa'i thabs la'ang rtog par byed do //

original: the tshom za'o //
analyzed: the tshom za'o //

original: log pa'i thar pa dang thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: log pa'i thar pa dang thar pa'i thabs la rtog par byed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They imagine a false liberation and the means to liberation.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i nang du lta ba gsum dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis ji skad bshad pa dang go rims bzhin no //üîΩnye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang dag yin pa de dag nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang yin no // nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yin la /

original: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There are subsidiary defilements that are not defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i sems @191b las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po nyon mongs pa can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ma gtogs par de las gzhan pa'i sems @191b las byung ba'i 'du byed kyi phung po nyon mongs pa can no //
translated: They are the defiled factors of the aggregate of formations dissociated from thought, with the exception of the defilements.

original: khro ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khro ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are anger, etc.

original: yang 'dod chags ni sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dod chags ni sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Attachment is a subsidiary defilement of thought.

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug gi sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug gi sems las byung ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Anger and delusion are subsidiary defilements of thought.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des sems nyon mongs pa can du gyur na chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa des sems nyon mongs pa can du gyur na chags pa dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: When the mind is defiled by these subsidiary defilements, one does not become free from attachment.

original: grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: One is not liberated,

original: sgrib pa de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa de ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that obscuration has not been abandoned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: The Bhagav√•n has said,

original: sems de ni yun ring po nas 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems de ni yun ring po nas 'dod chags kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The mind has been afflicted for a long time by attachment, aversion, and delusion.

original: kun nas dkris pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa ni brgyad de /
translated: There are eight entanglements:

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
translated: sloth, sleep, excitation, regret, envy, avarice, lack of conscience, and lack of shame.

original: zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma bsgom pa'i dus dang / de dag gi gzhi dang po rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khri bar byed pa kun nas dkris pa dag go //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma bsgom pa'i dus dang / de dag gi gzhi dang po rnam par dag pa'i dus dang / yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khri bar byed pa kun nas dkris pa dag go //
translated: They are entanglements because they are the basis of the first three faults, because they are the basis of the four faults of agitation and so on, because they are the basis of the fault of not being ashamed of oneself and others, and because they are the basis of the fault of not being able to cultivate the signs of serenity, insight, and equanimity.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad bya ba'i phyir /

original: yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khri bar byed pas kun du dkris pa dag go //
analyzed: yang dang yang shas cher sems la kun nas 'khri bar byed pas kun du dkris pa dag go //
translated: They are called entanglements because they repeatedly and strongly entangle the mind in the various kinds of suffering.

original: dge ba'i phyogs ni zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu bsgoms pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs ni zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi rgyu bsgoms pa ste /

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin no //

original: de dag gi gzhi ni tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa dag las bsdus pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de dag gi gzhi ni tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa dag las bsdus pa'i tshul khrims so //

original: de la zhi gnas kyi dus na ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis bar chad byed de /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi dus na ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis bar chad byed de /

original: nang du zhum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang du zhum par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cause the mind to become internally withdrawn.

original: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus na ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ste /

original: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they cause the mind to become externally distracted.

original: btang snyoms kyi dus na ni phrag dog dang ser sna ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi dus na ni phrag dog dang ser sna ste /
translated: Jealousy and stinginess hinder equanimity,üîΩbecause they cause the mind to become internally and externally distracted.

original: de dang ldan na gzhan dag gi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa yin /
analyzed: de dang ldan na gzhan dag gi phun sum tshogs pa la mi bzod pa yin /

original: kun du 'dzin pa'i sgo nas yang dang yang sems g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa'i sgo nas yang dang yang sems g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is agitated again and again through the grasping of the self.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dus na ni /
translated: At the time of the purity of morality,

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa ste /
translated: shamelessness and lack of abashment.

original: de gnyi ga dang ldan na rnam pa thams cad du ltung ba'i gnas kyis mi 'dzem pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga dang ldan na rnam pa thams cad du ltung ba'i gnas kyis mi 'dzem pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one possesses these two, one does not avoid the occasion of falling away in every way.

original: chu bo ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: chu bo ni bzhi ste /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / srid pa'i chu bo dang / lta ba'i chu bo dang / ma rig pa'i chu @192a * //
translated: the flood of sensuality, the flood of existence, the flood of views, and the flood of ignorance.

original: bo'o // rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir chu bo dag go //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bo'o // rgyun phyogs su khyer bar byed pa'i phyir chu bo dag go // kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rjes su mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: They are floods because they carry one away in the direction of the stream.

analyzed: chu bo dang sbyor ba go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The floods and the yokes are respectively established as favorable and unfavorable to the afflicted and the purified.

analyzed: 'dod pa tshol ba la zhugs pa ni dang po'o //

analyzed: ji ltar mthun par sbyar ro //

analyzed: nye bar len pa ni bzhi ste /
