translated: There are four knots:

original: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa dang / 'di bden no zhes mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa lus kyi mdud pa'o //
analyzed: brnab sems lus kyi mdud pa dang gnod sems lus kyi mdud pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lus kyi mdud pa dang / 'di bden no zhes mchog tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa lus kyi mdud pa'o //
translated: the knot of covetousness, the knot of malice, the knot of holding morality and asceticism as paramount, and the knot of insisting ‚Äúthis is the truth‚Äù and clinging to it.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir mdud pa rnams so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir mdud pa rnams so //
translated: The fetters are so called because they fetter the mind to the body, and because they fetter the body to the mind.

original: de dag gzugs lus kyi mdud pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gzugs lus kyi mdud pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The fetters are not fetters of the form body, but of the mind body.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du gcod pas mdud pa dag go /'di ltar g-yeng ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyi bar du gcod pas mdud pa dag go /'di ltar g-yeng ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of distraction:

original: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyus sems g-yeng ba dang / rtsod pa la legs par mi bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs drag pos sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang tshul bzhin ma yin par shes bya la rtogs pa'i rgyus sems g-yeng bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyus sems g-yeng ba dang / rtsod pa la legs par mi bsgrub pa'i rgyu dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs drag pos sdug bsngal bar gnas pa'i rgyu dang tshul bzhin ma yin par shes bya la rtogs pa'i rgyus sems g-yeng bar byed pa'o //
translated: distraction of the mind due to a slight cause of material things, distraction of the mind due to a cause of not properly accomplishing the debate, distraction of the mind due to a cause of abiding in suffering by a strict moral vow, and distraction of the mind due to a cause of conceptualizing the knowable in an improper way.

original: so so'i lta ba la brten nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes mngon par zhen nas shes bya la rtogs pas /
analyzed: so so'i lta ba la brten nas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni gti mug go zhes mngon par zhen nas shes bya la rtogs pas /
translated: One becomes distracted by conceptualizing the knowable, by adhering to one's own view and by conceiving, this alone is the truth, the others are ignorant.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par shes bya la rtogs pa'i rgyus sems g-yeng bar byed do //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par shes bya la rtogs pa'i rgyus sems g-yeng bar byed do //
translated: It is the distraction of the mind by reason of the search for knowledge in a manner contrary to the rules.

original: gang la rnam par g-yeng bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang la rnam par g-yeng bar byed ce na /
translated: In regard to what does it distract?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes mthong ba las so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes mthong ba las so //
translated: In regard to the mind in absorption, in regard to the knowledge and the seeing of the truth as it is.

original: sgrib pa ni lnga ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni lnga ste /
translated: There are five hindrances:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa ste /
translated: the hindrance of desire for pleasure, the hindrance of malice, the hindrance of languor-and-sleep, the hindrance of excitation-and-remorse, and the hindrance of doubt.

original: the tshom gyi sgrib pa ste //üîΩdge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas sgrib pa rnams so //üîΩdge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs par sems la sgrib par byed pas sgrib pa rnams te //
analyzed: the tshom gyi sgrib pa ste // dge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas sgrib pa rnams so // dge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs par sems la sgrib par byed pas sgrib pa rnams te //
translated: the hindrance of doubt.üîΩThey are hindrances because they are the cause of the non-production of the wholesome.üîΩThey are hindrances because they hinder the production of the wholesome in the mind.

original: dge ba la 'jug pa'i bar chad byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge ba la 'jug pa'i bar chad byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are obstacles to the entry into the wholesome.

original: rab tu 'byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i dus dang / bskul ba na legs par bsgrub pa'i dus dang / zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang // btang snyoms kyi dus na'ang /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i dus dang / bskul ba na legs par bsgrub pa'i dus dang / zhi gnas kyi dus dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i dus dang // btang snyoms kyi dus na'ang /
translated: The time of delight in going forth, the time of proper practice when urged, the time of serenity, the time of full attention, and the time of equanimity.

original: dge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas sgrib rnams @193a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs mi rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas sgrib rnams @193a * //
translated: Because they are causes for not understanding the side of virtue, they are obscurations.

original: so // de la 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni rab tu 'byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i bar chad byed do //üîΩyul la nye bar spyod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: so // de la 'dod pa la 'dun pa ni rab tu 'byung ba la mngon par dga' ba'i bar chad byed do // yul la nye bar spyod par 'dod pa'i sgo nas /
translated: Among them, sensual desire is an obstruction to delight in going forth,

original: de la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mngon par mi dga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not delight in that due to the desire to enjoy objects.

original: gnod sems ni legs par bskul ba'i dus na ste /
analyzed: gnod sems ni legs par bskul ba'i dus na ste /
translated: Ill will is at the time of proper urging,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i slob pa'i gnas la bskul na /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i slob pa'i gnas la bskul na /
translated: because when one is urged to train in the states of training by those who practice pure conduct,üîΩone does not properly train due to a hostile mind.üîΩSloth is at the time of equanimity,

original: gnod sems kyi sems kyis yang dag par mi slob pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi sems kyis yang dag par mi slob pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because one does not understand the side of virtue due to the mind being inwardly contracted.

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa gnyis snga ma bzhin du zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa ni zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa gnyis snga ma bzhin du zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Sloth, sleep, excitation, and regret are the resistances to serenity and to equanimity, as before, because they cause depression and distraction.

original: the tshom ni btang snyoms te /
analyzed: the tshom ni btang snyoms te /
translated: Doubt is the resistance to equanimity,

original: btang la phab pa med par btang snyoms su byed mi nus pa'i phyir ri //
analyzed: btang la phab pa med par btang snyoms su byed mi nus pa'i phyir ri //
translated: because one cannot be indifferent without eliminating doubt.

original: tha ba ni gsum ste /üîΩ'dod chags kyi tha ba dang / zhe sdang gi tha ba dang / gti mug gi tha ba'o //
analyzed: tha ba ni gsum ste / 'dod chags kyi tha ba dang / zhe sdang gi tha ba dang / gti mug gi tha ba'o //
translated: There are three kinds of latent dispositions:üîΩlatent dispositions of desire, latent dispositions of hatred, and latent dispositions of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of desire, hatred, and delusion,

original: sngon goms pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod par 'gyur te //
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i tshul gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod par 'gyur te //
translated: one engages in the practice of desire, etc., through the force of habit.

original: spyod pa de ma spangs pas sems las su mi rung ba dang / 'bral dka' bar gyur pa de dag ni tha ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod pa de ma spangs pas sems las su mi rung ba dang / 'bral dka' bar gyur pa de dag ni tha ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one does not eliminate that practice, the mind becomes unworkable and difficult to liberate. These are called latent dispositions.

original: gnyen po'i thong gshol gyis rlog par dka' ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyen po'i thong gshol gyis rlog par dka' ba'i phyir //
translated: They are difficult to eradicate by the plow of the antidote.

original: tha bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tha bar rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the latter are the three kinds of moral defilement.

original: tshe rabs gzhan du goms par byas pas spyod pa tha par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du goms par byas pas spyod pa tha par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latter are the three kinds of moral transgression that are respectively due to the influence of the three kinds of moral defilement.

original: dri ma ni gsum ste //
analyzed: dri ma ni gsum ste //
translated: The three kinds of moral defilement are:

original: 'dod chags kyi dri ma dang / zhe sdang gi dri ma dang / gti mug gi dri ma'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi dri ma dang / zhe sdang gi dri ma dang / gti mug gi dri ma'o //
translated: the moral defilement of passion, the moral defilement of hatred and the moral defilement of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas de'i ngo bo 'chal ba'i tshul khrims lhag par spyod de //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas de'i ngo bo 'chal ba'i tshul khrims lhag par spyod de //
translated: On the basis of passion, hatred and delusion, the latter, i.e. the three kinds of moral transgression, are respectively indulged in excessively.

original: grong na 'dug kyang rung //
analyzed: grong na 'dug kyang rung //
translated: Whether in a village or in the forest,

original: dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung //
analyzed: dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung //
translated: whether in the presence of the wise or in the absence of the wise,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis mthong na gang gi phyir 'di skad du //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis mthong na gang gi phyir 'di skad du //
translated: when the wise, who are fellow brahmacarins, see them, they say:

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni 'di lta bu byed pa //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'di ni 'di lta bu byed pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThe venerable one is one who acts in this way,

original: 'di lta bu spyod pa ste //
analyzed: 'di lta bu spyod pa ste //
translated: one who behaves in this way.üîΩHe is one who is impure, a village-man‚Äù.

original: mi gtsang ba grong gi tshe ma zhes brjod par 'gyur ba de dag ni dri ma rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba grong gi tshe ma zhes brjod par 'gyur ba de dag ni dri ma rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are described as the three kinds of moral defilement.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims mi gtsang bar 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims mi gtsang bar 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dri ma rnams so //
translated: The impurities are so called because they are the cause of the arising of impure morality.

original: sdig pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sdig pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of sins:

original: 'dod chags kyi sdig pa dang / zhe sdang gi sdig pa dang / gti mug gi sdig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi sdig pa dang / zhe sdang gi sdig pa dang / gti mug gi sdig pa'o //
translated: the sin of attachment, the sin of aversion, and the sin of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ste de rnams la brten nas dus ring por skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba myong bar 'gyur bar de dag ni sdig pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug ste de rnams la brten nas dus ring por skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba myong bar 'gyur bar de dag ni sdig pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called sins because, based on attachment, aversion, and delusion, one experiences birth, old age, and death for a long time.

original: yang dang yang 'khor bar skye ba dang / rga @193b ba dang // 'chi ba'i tshul gyis gnod par byed pas sdig pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang dang yang 'khor bar skye ba dang / rga @193b ba dang // 'chi ba'i tshul gyis gnod par byed pas sdig pa rnams so //
translated: They are sins because they harm by the method of repeated birth, old age, and death in cyclic existence.

original: zug rngu ni gsum ste 'dod chags kyi zug rngu dang / zhe sdang gi zug rngu dang / gti mug gi zug rngu'o //
analyzed: zug rngu ni gsum ste 'dod chags kyi zug rngu dang / zhe sdang gi zug rngu dang / gti mug gi zug rngu'o //
translated: There are three kinds of barbs: the barb of attachment, the barb of aversion, and the barb of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas srid pa dang / srid pa'i yo byad rnams la shin tu 'dod pa skye zhing gnas te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas srid pa dang / srid pa'i yo byad rnams la shin tu 'dod pa skye zhing gnas te /
translated: On the basis of these three, desire, hatred and delusion, there arises and persists a strong desire for existence and the things that sustain existence.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams la the tshom za ba de dag ni zug rdu rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams la the tshom za ba de dag ni zug rdu rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who doubt the Buddha, the Dharma, the Sa·πÖgha, suffering, origination, cessation and the path are said to be ‚Äúpierced by stakes‚Äù.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byed rnams dang / dkon mchog rnams la srid pa dang / the tshom gyi sgo nas zhugs nas gnod pa'i phyir zug rdu rnams so //
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byed rnams dang / dkon mchog rnams la srid pa dang / the tshom gyi sgo nas zhugs nas gnod pa'i phyir zug rdu rnams so //
translated: Because they are pierced by the stakes of existence and the things that sustain existence, and because they are pierced by the stakes of doubt in regard to the Jewels, they are harmed.

original: ci yang ni gsum ste /
analyzed: ci yang ni gsum ste /
translated: The ‚Äúanything‚Äù is threefold:

original: 'dod chags kyi ci yang dang / zhe sdang gi ci yang dang / gti mug gi ci yang ngo /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi ci yang dang / zhe sdang gi ci yang dang / gti mug gi ci yang ngo /
translated: anything of desire, anything of hatred and anything of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas 'jigs pa dang bcas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas 'jigs pa dang bcas /
translated: On the basis of these three, desire, hatred and delusion, there arises and persists a strong desire for existence and the things that sustain existence.

original: 'khon dang bcas shing /
analyzed: 'khon dang bcas shing /
translated: Those who are fearful, hostile,

original: g-yeng ba rnams mang bar gnas pa de dag ni ci yang rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: g-yeng ba rnams mang bar gnas pa de dag ni ci yang rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are situated in many distractions are called ‚Äúthose who have everything.‚Äù

original: yo byad mang po yongs su 'dzin pas ci yang dang bcas pas byas nas 'jig pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ci yang rnams so //
analyzed: yo byad mang po yongs su 'dzin pas ci yang dang bcas pas byas nas 'jig pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba'i phyir ci yang rnams so //
translated: Because they are engaged in the destruction, etc. of what is done with everything, since they hold on to many possessions.

original: nyes par spyod pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of misconduct:

original: 'dod chags kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / zhe sdang gi dang / gti mug gi nyes par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi nyes par spyod pa dang / zhe sdang gi dang / gti mug gi nyes par spyod pa'o //
translated: misconduct of desire, misconduct of hatred, and misconduct of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of desire, hatred, and delusion,

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa dang / ngag dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: one engages in misconduct with the body, speech, and mind.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i mi dge ba la 'jug par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they cause one to engage in nonvirtuous actions such as killing,

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams ni nyes par spyod pa mi dge ba rnam par bzhag ste de rnams kyi sgo nas nyes par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams ni nyes par spyod pa mi dge ba rnam par bzhag ste de rnams kyi sgo nas nyes par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment, hatred, and delusion are the roots of nonvirtuous actions, because nonvirtuous actions are performed through their force.

original: yang zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyu dang / longs spyod don du gnyer ba rnams chags pa nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: yang zang zing cung zad tsam gyi rgyu dang / longs spyod don du gnyer ba rnams chags pa nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Moreover, those who are attached to the cause of a small amount of material wealth and those who are attached to the enjoyment of material wealth perform actions that are nonvirtuous due to attachment.

original: gnod par bya ba'i rgyu las yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu dang / gzhan gyis nyes par mi bzod pa rnams zhe sdang gi nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba'i rgyu las yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu dang / gzhan gyis nyes par mi bzod pa rnams zhe sdang gi nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Those who are unable to tolerate the harm that others cause and who are unable to tolerate the faults of others perform actions that are nonvirtuous due to hatred.

original: chos la log par mngon par zhen pa'i rgyus phyin ci log tu lta ba mchod sbyin la sogs pa dag gti mug gi nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: chos la log par mngon par zhen pa'i rgyus phyin ci log tu lta ba mchod sbyin la sogs pa dag gti mug gi nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Those who are mistaken about the Dharma and who have a wrong view of the propriety of making sacrifices, etc., perform actions that are nonvirtuous due to delusion.

original: sems can rnams nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams nyes par spyad pa spyod do //
translated: Thus, sentient beings perform nonvirtuous actions.

original: de lta bas na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyes par spyod pa'i rtsa ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, attachment, hatred, and delusion are called the roots of nonvirtuous actions.

original: zag pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: zag pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of defilements:

original: 'dod par zag @194a * //
analyzed: 'dod par zag @194a * //
translated: defilement of desire,üîΩdefilement of existence, and

original: pa dang / srid par zag pa dang / ma rig par zag pa'o //üîΩsems rnam par 'phro bar zag par byed pa dang / phyi rol du bltas te zag pa'i phyir 'dod par zag pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / srid par zag pa dang / ma rig par zag pa'o // sems rnam par 'phro bar zag par byed pa dang / phyi rol du bltas te zag pa'i phyir 'dod par zag pa'o //
translated: defilement of ignorance.üîΩThe defilement of desire is so called because it causes the mind to scatter and be attached to external objects.

original: nang du bltas te zag pa'i phyir srid par zag pa'o //
analyzed: nang du bltas te zag pa'i phyir srid par zag pa'o //
translated: The defilement of existence is so called because it causes the mind to scatter and be attached to internal objects.

original: zag pa de gnyi ga'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ma rig par zag pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa de gnyi ga'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ma rig par zag pa'o //
translated: The defilement of ignorance is so called because it is the basis of both of these defilements.

original: sems rnam par 'phro bar byed pa'i phyir zag pa rnams so /
analyzed: sems rnam par 'phro bar byed pa'i phyir zag pa rnams so /
translated: The defilements are so called because they cause the mind to scatter.

original: phongs pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: phongs pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of afflictions:

original: 'dod chags kyi phongs pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi phongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi phongs pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi phongs pa'o //
translated: affliction of desire, affliction of hatred, and affliction of ignorance.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug de rnams la brten nas /üîΩsrid pa'i yo byad 'dod pa'i phongs pas gnod par byed pa de dag phongs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug de rnams la brten nas / srid pa'i yo byad 'dod pa'i phongs pas gnod par byed pa de dag phongs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: On the basis of these three, desire, hatred, and ignorance,üîΩone is afflicted by the affliction of desiring the necessities of existence.

original: lus dang sems la phongs par byed pas phongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lus dang sems la phongs par byed pas phongs pa rnams so //
translated: They are called afflictions because they afflict the body and mind.

original: yongs su gdung ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of torment:

original: 'dod chags kyis yongs su gdung ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis yongs su gdung ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis yongs su gdung ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis yongs su gdung ba'o //
translated: torment by desire, torment by hatred, and torment by delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of desire, hatred, and delusion,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin par mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin par mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: one grasps at signs and grasps at the secondary marks in a way that is not in accordance with reality.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa gang gis lus yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / sems yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba de dag gdung ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin pa gang gis lus yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / sems yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba de dag gdung ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The signs and secondary marks that cause the body and mind to be tormented are called ‚Äútorments.‚Äù

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin du bcug nas lus dang sems la yongs su gdung bar byed pas gdung ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma dang / mngon rtags su 'dzin du bcug nas lus dang sems la yongs su gdung bar byed pas gdung ba rnams so //
translated: They are called ‚Äútorments‚Äù because they cause the body and mind to be tormented by making one grasp at signs and secondary marks in a way that is not in accordance with reality.

original: 'khrug pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of disturbances:

original: 'dod chags kyis 'khrug pa dang / zhe sdang gis 'khrug pa dang / gti mug gis 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis 'khrug pa dang / zhe sdang gis 'khrug pa dang / gti mug gis 'khrug pa'o //
translated: disturbances by desire, disturbances by hatred, and disturbances by delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas gang du dga' ba dang / lhag par chags pa de rnam par gyur cing gzhan du gyur na mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas gang du dga' ba dang / lhag par chags pa de rnam par gyur cing gzhan du gyur na mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
translated: On the basis of those desires, attachments, and confusions, when there is a transformation and change in what is liked and what is strongly attached to, then there is grief, lamentation, pain, mental anguish,

original: 'khrug pa rnams kyis reg par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'khrug pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa rnams kyis reg par 'gyur ba de dag ni 'khrug pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: and disturbance. Those are called disturbances.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la dga' ba dang / lhag par chags par byed du bcug nas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la dga' ba dang / lhag par chags par byed du bcug nas /
translated: Having caused the liking and strong attachment to things such as form,

original: de rnam par gyur na mya ngan la sogs pas sems can rnams 'khrug par byed pa'i phyir 'khrug pa rnams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de rnam par gyur na mya ngan la sogs pas sems can rnams 'khrug par byed pa'i phyir 'khrug pa rnams zhes brjod do //
translated: when there is a transformation in that, it is said that disturbances disturb sentient beings with grief and so forth.

original: @194b 'thab pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: @194b 'thab pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of quarrels:

original: 'dod chags kyis 'thab pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis 'thab pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis 'thab pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis 'thab pa'o //
translated: quarrels of desire, quarrels of anger, and quarrels of confusion.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of those desires, attachments, and confusions,

original: chags pa gcod pa dang / mtshon chag len pa dang / dbyug pa len pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa rnams 'byung ba de dag ni 'thab pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa gcod pa dang / mtshon chag len pa dang / dbyug pa len pa dang / 'thab pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa rnams 'byung ba de dag ni 'thab pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Quarreling is the occurrence of disputes, arguments, contentions, and conflicts, such as taking up weapons, taking up sticks, and fighting, as well as the occurrence of disputes, arguments, contentions, and conflicts that are verbal offenses such as slander, divisive speech, and idle speech.

original: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa'i 'thab par byed pas 'thab pa rnams so //
analyzed: mtshon cha len pa la sogs pa'i 'thab par byed pas 'thab pa rnams so //
translated: Quarrels are disputes that are accompanied by the taking up of weapons, etc.

original: rims nad ni gsum ste /
analyzed: rims nad ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three fevers:

original: 'dod chags kyi rims nad dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rims nad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rims nad dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi rims nad do //
translated: the fever of passion, the fever of hatred, and the fever of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de rnams la brten nas /üîΩchos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pas yongs su gdung ba chen pos yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / de la chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug de rnams la brten nas / chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pas yongs su gdung ba chen pos yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / de la chos ma yin pa la 'dod chags pa ni /
translated: On the basis of passion, hatred, and delusion,üîΩone is tormented by great anguish due to one‚Äôs passion for what is contrary to the Dharma.

original: gang mi dge ba'i lam rnams la rjes su chags pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba'i lam rnams la rjes su chags pa'o //
translated: Passion for what is contrary to the Dharma is attachment to the paths that are not spiritual.

original: mi mthun pas chags pas yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / mi mthun pas chags pa ni mi rigs pa chos ma yin pas yul kun du tshol ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pas chags pas yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / mi mthun pas chags pa ni mi rigs pa chos ma yin pas yul kun du tshol ba'o //
translated: The burning of attachment to what is not in accordance with the Dharma is the search for objects by means of what is not right, by means of what is not the Dharma.

original: chos log pa'i yongs su gdung ba chen pos yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba chos log pa ni nyes par bshad pa'i chos su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos log pa'i yongs su gdung ba chen pos yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba chos log pa ni nyes par bshad pa'i chos su rig par bya'o //
translated: The burning of great attachment to false doctrines is the attachment to false doctrines which should be known as the false teachings of bad doctrines.

original: de dag ni rims nad rnams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni rims nad rnams zhes brjod do //
translated: These are called the fevers.

original: nags sbyor ni gsum ste /
analyzed: nags sbyor ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three thickets:

original: 'dod chags kyi nags sbyor dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nags sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi nags sbyor dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nags sbyor ro //
translated: the thicket of craving, the thicket of hatred, and the thicket of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
translated: Based on craving, hatred, and delusion,

original: skye ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed rnams la chags te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rtsa ba 'du byed rnams la chags te /
translated: one becomes attached to the formations which are the root of birth.

original: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar lus rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa de dag ni nags sbyor rnams zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar lus rnam pa sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa de dag ni nags sbyor rnams zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thicket is that which causes the various kinds of bodies to be produced in the five destinies of cyclic existence.

original: skye ba'i rtsa ba'i 'khor ba'i shing gi nags tshal la chags par byed pas nags sbyor rnams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba'i rtsa ba'i 'khor ba'i shing gi nags tshal la chags par byed pas nags sbyor rnams zhes brjod do //
translated: They are called obstacles because they obstruct the roots of wholesome actions, and because they obstruct the forest of the tree of cyclic existence.

original: gag sa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: gag sa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of obstacles:

original: 'dod chags kyi gag sa dang / zhe sdang dang // gti mug gi gag sa so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gag sa dang / zhe sdang dang // gti mug gi gag sa so //
translated: obstacles of attachment, obstacles of aversion, and obstacles of delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug de rnams la brten nas /
translated: On the basis of attachment, aversion, and delusion,

original: lus la lta ba dang bcas pas dge ba la mi sbyor ba dang / lus la lta ba dang bcas pa de bzhin du longs spyod la lta ba dang bcas pa dang / blo ma byang ba dang / 'dre zhing gnas pa dang / cung zad tsam gyis chog @195a * //
analyzed: lus la lta ba dang bcas pas dge ba la mi sbyor ba dang / lus la lta ba dang bcas pa de bzhin du longs spyod la lta ba dang bcas pa dang / blo ma byang ba dang / 'dre zhing gnas pa dang / cung zad tsam gyis chog @195a * //
translated: one does not apply oneself to wholesome actions because one is preoccupied with one's body, or because one is preoccupied with one's body and possessions, or because one's mind is not trained, or because one is in a bad situation, or because one is satisfied with only a little.

original: par 'dzin pas dge ba la mi sbyor ba de dag ni gags rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par 'dzin pas dge ba la mi sbyor ba de dag ni gags rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called obstacles.

original: lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pas dge ba sbyor ba'i gags te /
analyzed: lus la lta ba la sogs pa dang bcas pas dge ba sbyor ba'i gags te /
translated: Being preoccupied with one's body, etc., is an obstacle to applying oneself to wholesome actions.

original: yang lus la lta ba la sogs pa ni gags rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: yang lus la lta ba la sogs pa ni gags rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Moreover, being preoccupied with one's body, etc., is a fivefold obstacle.

original: log par zhugs pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: log par zhugs pa ji lta bu /
translated: What is wrong practice?

original: 'dod chags ni yul dang lta bal log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni yul dang lta bal log par rtog pa'o //
translated: Attachment is a false conception in regard to an object and a view.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is abandoned by cultivation and by insight, respectively.

original: 'dod chags ni sdug pa tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni sdug pa tsam du dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment is a false conception in regard to an object, because it is produced in regard to a mere agreeable object.

original: gang yang sems can la 'dod chags pa de ni yul gyi sgo nyid nas log par rtog par rig par bya'o //üîΩ'dod chags ji lta bar khong khro'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gang yang sems can la 'dod chags pa de ni yul gyi sgo nyid nas log par rtog par rig par bya'o // 'dod chags ji lta bar khong khro'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, attachment to sentient beings is a false conception in regard to the door of the object.üîΩAversion is a false conception in regard to an object and a cause of displeasure.

original: de bzhin du khong khro ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu rkyen la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khong khro ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu rkyen la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Aversion is a false conception in regard to an object, because it is produced in regard to a cause of displeasure.

original: sems can rnams la 'byung ba yang yul gyi sgo nyid ni log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'byung ba yang yul gyi sgo nyid ni log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, aversion to sentient beings is a false conception in regard to the door of the object.

original: nga rgyal ni sems can rnams dang / lta ba log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni sems can rnams dang / lta ba log par rtog pa'o //
translated: Pride is a false conception in regard to sentient beings and a view.

original: chung du bas bdag che ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir sems can rnams la log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chung du bas bdag che ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir sems can rnams la log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is a false conception in regard to sentient beings, because it occurs in the form: ‚ÄúI am superior,‚Äù etc.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni shes bya la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba ni shes bya la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: The afflicted view of the self, the view of holding to an extreme, and false view are mistaken thoughts about knowable objects.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i sgo nas ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i sgo nas ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: They are associated with the overestimation and underestimation extremes, respectively, as is fitting.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzi pa ji ltab la log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzi pa ji ltab la log par rtog pa'o //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism and the overesteeming of mere personal rules and rituals are mistaken thoughts about the means of purification.

original: lta ba nyes pa nyid kyi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la yang dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba nyes pa nyid kyi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la yang dag par mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are mistaken thoughts about the means of purification because they overestimate as a means of purification a moral practice and ritual that are faulty.

original: the tshom ni gnyen po la sogs par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni gnyen po la sogs par rtog pa'o //
translated: Doubt is a mistaken thought about the antidote.

original: bden pa rnams la blo rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la blo rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a mistaken thought about the antidote because it is a doubt about the four noble truths.

original: ma rig pa ni thams cad la log par rtog pa'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni thams cad la log par rtog pa'o // nyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad ni /
translated: Ignorance is a mistaken thought about everything.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba la de'i rgyu dang gzhi'i gnas kyis kyang log par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba la de'i rgyu dang gzhi'i gnas kyis kyang log par rtog pa'o //
translated: All ten afflictions are mistaken thoughts about the truths of suffering and origin because they are the causes and bases of the latter.

original: nyon mongs pa bcu char yang sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bcu char yang sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: The ten defilements are causes of suffering and of the origin of suffering.

original: de gnyis kyang da dag gi gzhi'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang da dag gi gzhi'i gnas yin no //
translated: And these two are the basis of the latter.

original: de'i phyir de'i rgyu dang gzhi'i gnas kyis kyang log par rtog ces brjod par bya'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rgyu dang gzhi'i gnas kyis kyang log par rtog ces brjod par bya'o // nyon mongs pa bcu po thams cad ni /
translated: Therefore, they are said to be wrong views because they are causes and a basis of the latter.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la yang de la skrag pa skyed pas log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la yang de la skrag pa skyed pas log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: All ten defilements are wrong engagement because they generate fear of cessation and the path.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dbang @195b gis 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / rnam par byad ba la g-yang sar 'du shes nas skrag pa dang / phyin ci log tu rtog pa 'gog pa dang / lam la log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dbang @195b gis 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / rnam par byad ba la g-yang sar 'du shes nas skrag pa dang / phyin ci log tu rtog pa 'gog pa dang / lam la log par rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that, through the power of the defilements, one delights in samsara, perceives nirvana as a precipice, and has wrong views about cessation and the path.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis ni rnam ba gzhan du kun du brtags nas de la log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis ni rnam ba gzhan du kun du brtags nas de la log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the tirthikas imagine otherwise and have wrong views about them.

original: khams kyi ji lta bu /
analyzed: khams kyi ji lta bu /
translated: What about the realms?

original: khong khro ma gtogs pa khams gsum pa thams cad do //
analyzed: khong khro ma gtogs pa khams gsum pa thams cad do //
translated: All of them exist in the three realms, except for anger.

original: khong khro ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Anger is associated with desire.

original: 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i khams na bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / gtang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams la ji lta bde bzhin du /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i khams na bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / gtang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no // 'dod pa'i khams la ji lta bde bzhin du /
translated: Desire is associated with pleasure, joy, and equanimity in the realm of desire.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: As in the realm of desire, so in the first and second absorptions.

original: gsum pa ni bde ba dang / gtang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bde ba dang / gtang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the third absorption, it is associated with pleasure and equanimity.

original: de yan chad du ni btang snyoms nyid dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de yan chad du ni btang snyoms nyid dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Above that, it is associated only with equanimity.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'dod chags rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang ldan pa ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the realm of desire, desire associated with the five collections of consciousness is associated with pleasure.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang ldan pa ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Desire associated with mental consciousness is associated with joy.

original: 'dod chags thams cad ni rgyun chad pa'i dus na btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags thams cad ni rgyun chad pa'i dus na btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: All desire is associated with equanimity at the time of its cessation.

original: dga' ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with joy.

original: khong khro ni sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: khong khro ni sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Anger is associated with suffering, dissatisfaction, and equanimity.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lnga pa'i khong khro ba ni sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lnga pa'i khong khro ba ni sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Anger in the five consciousnesses is associated with suffering.

original: drug pa yid kyi sa pa ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi sa pa ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Anger in the sixth, the mental consciousness, is associated with dissatisfaction.

original: thams cad ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All are associated with equanimity, as before.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not associated with pleasure or satisfaction,

original: dman pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: dman pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: because it is a lesser mental activity.üîΩPride is associated with satisfaction and equanimity in the realm of desire.

original: bsam gtan dang bo dang gnyis pa la ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang bo dang gnyis pa la ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the first and second trance states, it is associated with pleasure, satisfaction, and equanimity.

original: gsum pa la ni bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the third, it is associated with pleasure and equanimity.

original: de yang chad du btang snyoms khon dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de yang chad du btang snyoms khon dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Moreover, it is associated with equanimity that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang / @196a * //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang / @196a * //

original: mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa na bde ba dang ji ltar ldan zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa na bde ba dang ji ltar ldan zhe na /

original: yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: It is associated with the pleasure of the stage of mental consciousness.

analyzed: de na yid kyi sa pa'i bde ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the pleasure of the stage of mental consciousness there?

analyzed: dga' ba dang / bde ba zhes gang 'byung ba ste /

original: ji skad du dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du dag pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang gnas gyur pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i sems tshim pa dang / sems shin tu dga' ba dang / sems rangs pa dang / sems dga' ba dang / bde ba myong ba ste /

original: tshor bar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor bar gtogs pa'o //

original: bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba gang zhe na /

analyzed: gang gnas gyur pa'i kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i gnas la phan pa dang / gnas tshim pa dang / bde ba myong ba ste /

analyzed: chor bar gtogs pa'o zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //

original: de ni 'di skad du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa yin te /
translated: This means that the phrase ‚Äúbased on the transformed active consciousness‚Äù means based on the transformed mental consciousness,

original: gzhan la mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la mnyam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //

original: bde ba'i tshor ba la bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la 'byung ba na /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba la bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la 'byung ba na /
translated: When the feeling of pleasure occurs in the first and second meditative absorptions,

translated: It is the satisfaction that comes from being in a state of association with the mind and mental factors, and it is the satisfaction that comes from the pleasure of fitness, which is the nature of the consciousness that appropriates the sense faculties.

analyzed: de bas na de gnyi ga'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir 'di ni dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyi gar gzhag par rig par bya'o zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de lta bas na de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nga rgyal ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya'o //

original: nga rgyal ji lta ba bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //

translated: Just as with pride, so it is with the afflicted view of the self, the view that grasps an extreme, the esteeming of views, and the esteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Wrong view is associated with mental pleasure, mental pain, and equanimity in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gang gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gang gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the realm of form and the formless realm, it is associated with whatever feeling exists there.

original: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / ji ltar na mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / ji ltar na mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: How is wrong view associated with mental pleasure and mental pain in the realm of desire?

original: lags @196b par byas pa dang / nyes par bya ba byed pa rnams kyis de'i 'bras bu med par mthong nas mos pa dang dga' ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lags @196b par byas pa dang / nyes par bya ba byed pa rnams kyis de'i 'bras bu med par mthong nas mos pa dang dga' ba skye ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin te /

original: lta ba thams cad ni yid kyi sa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad ni yid kyi sa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all views are on the level of the mental faculty.

original: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Doubt is associated with mental pain and equanimity in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni /
translated: In the form and formless realms,

original: tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: it is associated with whatever feeling exists there.

original: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin te /

original: nges pa med pa'i sems ni mos pa med pas yid la bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i sems ni mos pa med pas yid la bde ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni the tshom gyi shes che ba'i bsam gtan pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang bde ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bskyed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid de //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni the tshom gyi shes che ba'i bsam gtan pa rnams kyi dga' ba dang bde ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs bskyed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid de //
translated: In the form realm, doubt is associated with pleasure and mental pleasure, because the pleasure of those who are absorbed in concentration through the power of doubt is generated by the power of concentration.

original: de na bde ba dang yid bde ba dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de na bde ba dang yid bde ba dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: There, doubt is associated with pleasure and mental pleasure.

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa can yin pas //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa can yin pas //
translated: Since ignorance is associated with all the defilements,

analyzed: gang na tshor ba gang yod pa de na de dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //

original: yang ma rig pa ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de ni //
analyzed: yang ma rig pa ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de ni //

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //

original: de yan chad tshor ba gang yod pa dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de yan chad tshor ba gang yod pa dang mtshungs par ldan no //

analyzed: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin /

analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa las brtsams te the chom dang tshul mtshungs par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan /

analyzed: tha mal par 'dug pa la brten nas nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgyun je chung je du 'gro bas rgyun chad pa'i shugs kyis rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tha ma gdon mi za bar tha mal bar 'dug pa'i sgo nas btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the last is necessarily associated with equanimity by way of the state of indifference.

analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang mtshungs par ldan no //

analyzed: 'dod chags ji lta bar khong khro dang ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi dang ldan no //

analyzed: de na sna dang lce'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: @197a * // gzugs med pa'i khams na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan no //

analyzed: 'dod chags ji lta bar ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //

analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ni thams cad du yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan no //

analyzed: nga rgyal la sogs pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid de /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro dang nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na dngos po'i phyogs gcig la 'jug go //

analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin te /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba drug ste /

analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs su bla ba lhan cig skyes pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ste //

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:
