translated: However, I have not abandoned the pride thinking ‚ÄòI am‚Äô with regard to these appropriated aggregates, nor the intention thinking ‚ÄòI am,‚Äô nor the latent tendency thinking ‚ÄòI am.‚Äô

original: yongs su ma shes so //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes so //
translated: I have not completely understood them.

original: ma bkag go //
analyzed: ma bkag go //
translated: I have not stopped them.

original: mtha' med par ma byas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mtha' med par ma byas so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is not made limitless.

original: dper na ma ma'i gos dri ma can du gyur pa bu la tog la sogs pas legs par bkrus te //
analyzed: dper na ma ma'i gos dri ma can du gyur pa bu la tog la sogs pas legs par bkrus te //
translated: For example, a mother‚Äôs garment becomes soiled by her child‚Äôs excrement.

original: dri ma med par gyur kyang de zhen par gos pas dri'i bag yod de de spos dri zhim pos bsgos pas yang bsal bar bya dgos pa de bzhin du /üîΩmthong ba'i lam gyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun brtags pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos la yang sngon mngon par zhen te /
analyzed: dri ma med par gyur kyang de zhen par gos pas dri'i bag yod de de spos dri zhim pos bsgos pas yang bsal bar bya dgos pa de bzhin du / mthong ba'i lam gyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun brtags pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos la yang sngon mngon par zhen te /
translated: Although it is washed well with soap and becomes free of stains, the smell of excrement remains in the cloth.

original: goms par byas pa dngos po ma brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: goms par byas pa dngos po ma brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: In the same way, although the stains of the reifying view of the perishing aggregates are eliminated by the path of seeing, the innate view of the self that has been habituated since beginningless time continues to exist.

original: de ni lam bsgom pas spang bar bya dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni lam bsgom pas spang bar bya dgos pa yin no //
translated: This is eliminated by the path of meditation.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni chad par lta bas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa ni chad par lta bas bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: The innate extreme view of reification should be understood as the view of annihilation.

original: des bdag gi bdag gang yin zhes yongs su yi chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des bdag gi bdag gang yin zhes yongs su yi chad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the despair that thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is the self of mine?‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa las yid phyir ldog par byed de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa las yid phyir ldog par byed de /
translated: They turn their minds away from nirvana.

original: lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ma gtogs par 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bsgom pas spang ba bya ba dag go //
analyzed: lta ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa ma gtogs par 'dod chags la sogs pa ni bsgom pas spang ba bya ba dag go //
translated: Except for the view of the transitory collection, attachment and so on are objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni khong khro gtogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni khong khro gtogs pa lnga'o //
translated: Five afflictions exist in the form realm, excluding anger.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin te /üîΩde @198a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin te / de @198a * //
translated: The formless realm is similar to the form realm.

original: dag mdor bsdu na bcu drug ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ris so //
analyzed: dag mdor bsdu na bcu drug ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ris so //
translated: In brief, these are the sixteen types of affliction that are objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: spong bas ji lta bu ji ltar spong ba dang yid la byed pa ci 'dra ba dang / gang zhig gang las spang pa'o //
analyzed: spong bas ji lta bu ji ltar spong ba dang yid la byed pa ci 'dra ba dang / gang zhig gang las spang pa'o //
translated: How are they abandoned?

original: ji ltar spong yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su spong ba dang / gnyen po rnyed pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar spong yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su spong ba dang / gnyen po rnyed pas so //
translated: They are abandoned by means of thorough knowledge, thorough relinquishment, and obtaining the antidote.

original: yongs su shes pas gang /
analyzed: yongs su shes pas gang /
translated: What is thorough knowledge?

original: de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: It is thorough knowledge of the basis of affliction, thorough knowledge of the nature of affliction, and thorough knowledge of the faults of affliction.

original: de la de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa yin zhes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de la de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs pa yin zhes pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the thing that is its basis is the non-abandonment of the latent impressions of the afflictions.

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa ni sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa ni 'byung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa ni sems kun nas nyon mongs par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyon mongs pa ni 'byung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the essence is the afflictions that are the nature of the afflictions of the mind.

original: nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa ni bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba dang / mthong ba'i chos kyis kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang /
analyzed: nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa ni bdag la gnod pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gnyi ga la gnod par 'gyur ba dang / mthong ba'i chos kyis kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang / tshe phyi ma'i kha na ma tho ba skyed pa dang /
translated: The thorough knowledge of the disadvantages is the harm to oneself, the harm to others, the harm to both, the production of the demerit of the present life, the production of the demerit of the next life,

original: de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba myong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sems las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba myong bar byed pa'o //
translated: and the experience of the mental suffering and unhappiness that arise from that.

original: yongs su spang ba gang byung bar gyur pa dang du mi len pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su spang ba gang byung bar gyur pa dang du mi len pa'o //
translated: The thorough knowledge of the escape is the thorough knowledge of the escape from the afflictions.üîΩThe thorough knowledge of the antidote is the antidote to the afflictions.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su shes na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi de'i gzhi dngos po yongs su shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su shes te byung bar gyur pa dang du mi len pa'i tshul gyis yongs su spang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su shes na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi de'i gzhi dngos po yongs su shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyis yongs su shes te byung bar gyur pa dang du mi len pa'i tshul gyis yongs su spang ngo //
translated: Thus, if one understands them in these three ways, one completely abandons the afflictions by understanding their basis, their thing, etc. , and by not accepting their arising.

original: gnyen po rnyed pa gang ma skyes pa spang ba'i phyir lam rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po rnyed pa gang ma skyes pa spang ba'i phyir lam rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The path that one obtains for the abandonment of that which has not yet arisen is the obtaining of the antidote.

original: 'di ltar ma skyes pa mi skye ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma skyes pa mi skye ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa'o //
translated: Thus, one cultivates the path in order that what has not yet arisen will not arise.

original: yid la byed pa ci 'dras bas spang //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ci 'dras bas spang //
translated: What is the mental attention by which one abandons?

original: 'dres pa las dmigs pas spang ste /üîΩchos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa las dmigs pas spang ste / chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One abandons by means of the mental attention that is directed toward the unmixed and the mixed.

original: tha dad pa med pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: One abandons by means of the mental attention that is directed toward the unmixed, as when one understands that all things are without a self.

original: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One abandons by means of the mental attention that is directed toward the mixed, as when one understands that all things are of one nature, i.e., that they are all characterized by being neither bound nor liberated.

original: gal te chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bdag med par shes par nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bdag med par shes par nyid kyis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur na ni //
translated: If the afflictions were abandoned by the mere understanding that all things are without a self,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci'i phyir bstan ce na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci'i phyir bstan ce na /
translated: Why are the aspects of impermanence, etc. taught?

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang bdag med pa'i rnam pa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ma yin gyi 'on kyang bdag med pa'i rnam pa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not for the purpose of abandoning the defilements, but rather for the purpose of purifying the aspects of selflessness.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang gang yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa yongs su sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang gang yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa yongs su sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúThe aspects of impermanence, etc. are also the aspects of selflessness.

original: mi @198b rtag pa'i rnam pa la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi @198b rtag pa'i rnam pa la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: One attains the aspect of suffering in dependence on the aspect of impermanence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la brten nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la brten nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa 'thob ste /
translated: One attains the aspect of selflessness in dependence on the aspect of suffering.

original: ji skad du gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: As it is said: ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: de bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That is selfless.‚Äù

original: de bas na bdag med pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni bla na med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na bdag med pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni bla na med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of selflessness is established as unsurpassed.

original: bla na med pa'i rnam pa nyid las brtsams nas bla na med pa nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i rnam pa nyid las brtsams nas bla na med pa nyid gsum ste /
translated: The three kinds of unsurpassedness are begun with the unsurpassed aspect.

original: shes pa bla na med pa nyid dang / lam bla na med pa nyid dang / rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa bla na med pa nyid dang / lam bla na med pa nyid dang / rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid do //
translated: the unexcelled knowledge, the unexcelled path, and the unexcelled liberation.

original: de la shes pa bla na med pa nyid ni bdag med par shas pa ste //
analyzed: de la shes pa bla na med pa nyid ni bdag med par shas pa ste //
translated: The unexcelled knowledge is the knowledge of selflessness.

original: de'i pha rol tu shes pa gzhan btsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu shes pa gzhan btsal du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other knowledge to be sought beyond that.

original: lam bla na med pa nyid ni sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba ste /
analyzed: lam bla na med pa nyid ni sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba ste /
translated: The unexcelled path is the easy path with swift superknowledge.

original: de ni lam thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lam thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the best of all paths.

original: rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid ni mi slob pa mi 'khrugs pa'i rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid ni mi slob pa mi 'khrugs pa'i rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The unexcelled liberation is the unshakable liberation of the nonlearner.

original: rnam par grol ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is superior to all other liberations.

original: bla na med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: These three kinds of unexcelledness should be understood as referring respectively to the paths of seeing, cultivation, and completion.

original: gang zhig gang la spang /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la spang /
translated: What is abandoned by what?

original: 'das pa ni 'gags pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'gags pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The past is not [the object] because it has ceased.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The future is not [the object] because it has not yet arisen.

original: da ltar byung ba ni lam dang mnyam du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni lam dang mnyam du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The present is not [the object] because it does not occur simultaneously with the path.

original: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa de las spong ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gang yin pa de las spong ngo //
translated: However, it is the elimination of the negative reflex action of the defilement.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa gang gi gnyen po gang byung ba gnyen po'i rnam pa de 'byung ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa de 'gog pa mnyam pas mnyam ste snang ba dang mun pa 'byung ba dang 'gag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa gang gi gnyen po gang byung ba gnyen po'i rnam pa de 'byung ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa de 'gog pa mnyam pas mnyam ste snang ba dang mun pa 'byung ba dang 'gag pa bzhin no //
translated: The occurrence of the aspect of the counteragent, which is the antidote to the aspect of negative reflex action, and the simultaneous cessation of that aspect of negative reflex action, are equal, like the occurrence and cessation of light and darkness.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa dang bral bas ma 'ongs pa na mi skye ba'i chos can du gnas pa de ni spang ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa dang bral bas ma 'ongs pa na mi skye ba'i chos can du gnas pa de ni spang ba'o //
translated: The elimination is the state of the non-arising of the future of that which is free from the aspect of negative reflex action.

original: las gang sems pa'i las dang bsam pa'i las te las kyi mtshan nyid du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: las gang sems pa'i las dang bsam pa'i las te las kyi mtshan nyid du bsdus pa'o //
translated: Karma is that which is included in the characteristics of karma, which are the karma of intention and the karma of performance.

original: yang las rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang las rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, karma is of five types:

original: dmigs pa'i las dang byed pa'i las dang / rtsol ba'i las dang / bsgyur ba'i las dang / 'thor ba'i las so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i las dang byed pa'i las dang / rtsol ba'i las dang / bsgyur ba'i las dang / 'thor ba'i las so //
translated: The action of perception, the action of performance, the action of effort, the action of transformation, and the action of attainment.

original: de la dmigs pa'i las zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ste /üîΩgzugs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i las zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa ste / gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action of perception is the eye, etc.

original: byed pa'i las ni sa la sogs pa ste rten la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i las ni sa la sogs pa ste rten la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action of performance is the earth, etc.

original: yang na @199a * //
analyzed: yang na @199a * //
translated: Or else,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: the action of performance is that which is performed by its own nature.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: gzugs ni gzugs su yod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs su yod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: form is that which is capable of resistance.

original: rtsol ba'i las ni bsam pa sngon du btang ba'i lus la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: rtsol ba'i las ni bsam pa sngon du btang ba'i lus la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: The action of effort is the action of body, speech, and mind that is preceded by the will.

original: bsgyur ba'i las ni gser mgar la sogs pa'i las te rgyan la sogs par bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i las ni gser mgar la sogs pa'i las te rgyan la sogs par bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The action of transformation is the action of a goldsmith, etc., in transforming gold into ornaments, etc.

original: 'thob pa'i las ni 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i las ni 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action of attainment is the attainment of nirvana, etc., through the noble path, etc.

original: skabs 'dir ni phal cher rtsol ba'i las su 'dod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni phal cher rtsol ba'i las su 'dod do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In this context, the majority of scholars maintain that the term karma refers to the action of striving.

original: 'thob pa dang byed pa'i las kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang byed pa'i las kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the action of obtaining and the action of doing also exist.

original: sems pa gang sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i yid kyi las te /
analyzed: sems pa gang sems mngon par 'du byed pa'i yid kyi las te /
translated: The action of intention is mental karma.

original: de yang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable.

original: bsam pa'i las gang /
analyzed: bsam pa'i las gang /
translated: What is the action of volition?

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las so /
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las so /
translated: It is bodily action, vocal action, and mental action.

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las de la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las de la yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: Bodily action, vocal action, and mental action are virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: mi dge nga ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ste /
analyzed: mi dge nga ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ste /
translated: Nonvirtuous action is the ten paths of nonvirtuous action.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /üîΩlog par lta ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig 'khyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /üîΩlog par lta ba'o //
translated: killing, taking what has not been given, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: dge ba ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams te 'di lta ste /
translated: Virtue is the ten virtuous karmic paths.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba nas /
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba nas /
translated: They are the avoidance of the taking of life,

original: tshig 'khyal ba'i bar du spong ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal ba'i bar du spong ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: up to the avoidance of idle chatter, the absence of covetousness, the absence of malice, and right views.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las ni las kyi lam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las ni las kyi lam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The karmic paths of body, etc.,

original: mdo sde'i rjes su 'brangs nas ji ltar gtso bor bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde'i rjes su 'brangs nas ji ltar gtso bor bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: are to be understood as taught in the sutras, in accordance with their predominance.

original: de la sbyor ba la sogs pa la yang lus la sogs pa'i las kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba la sogs pa la yang lus la sogs pa'i las kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the preparations, etc., are included in the karmic paths of body, etc.

original: las kyi lam gsum dang bzhi dang / gsum ni go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi lam gsum dang bzhi dang / gsum ni go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The three karmic paths, the four, and the three are to be understood as having the characteristics of karmic actions of body, speech, and mind, respectively.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristics of the karmic paths of taking life, etc.,

original: gzhi dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / zin par byas pas kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / zin par byas pas kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: are to be understood in terms of basis, attitude, performance, affliction, and completion.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can grangs su ma gtogs pa dang / ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can grangs su ma gtogs pa dang / ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te //
translated: The basis of killing and so on is a sentient being or what is counted as a sentient being, or what is not counted as a sentient being, as is appropriate.

original: gang la brten nas @199b srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang la brten nas @199b srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is that in dependence upon which killing and so on occur.

original: bsam pa ni gzhi de la der 'du shes pa'i sems pa dang / las kyi lam de byed par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni gzhi de la der 'du shes pa'i sems pa dang / las kyi lam de byed par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention is the thought that perceives that basis as such and the intention to commit that karmic path.

original: sbyar ba ni de byed pa'i phyir bdag gam gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba ni de byed pa'i phyir bdag gam gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyis rtsom pa'o //
translated: The performance is the physical, verbal, or mental activity of oneself or another in order to carry out that action.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug 'dus pa dang / so so ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug 'dus pa dang / so so ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: The mental affliction is the combination of attachment, aversion, and delusion, or each one individually, as is appropriate.

original: zin par byas pa ni sbyor ba de dang des de'i dus sam phyis las de yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni sbyor ba de dang des de'i dus sam phyis las de yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The completion is the full realization of that action at that time or later by that performance or by that means.

original: de la srog gcod pa'i gzhi ni sems can no //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa'i gzhi ni sems can no //
translated: The basis of killing is a sentient being.

original: bsam pa de ni de la der 'du shes shing bsang ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa de ni de la der 'du shes shing bsang ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention is the recognition of that as that, and the intention to steal.

original: sbyor ba ni gsang bar bsams pa'i mtshon cha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gsang bar bsams pa'i mtshon cha la sogs pa'o //
translated: The performance is the act of stealing with the weapon of stealth and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa ni chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The affliction is attachment and so on.

original: zin par byas pa ni sbyor ba des de ma thag tu 'am phyis shi ba'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni sbyor ba des de ma thag tu 'am phyis shi ba'o //
translated: The completion is the death of the owner immediately after the performance, or later.

original: ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i gzhi dang / zin par byas pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i gzhi dang / zin par byas pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: The basis and the completion of taking what is not given and so on should be explained.

original: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: The rest should be applied according to the corresponding explanation.

original: ma byin par len pa'i gzhi ni gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i gzhi ni gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of taking what is not given is that which is owned by another, whether it is included in the category of sentient beings or not.

original: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: The completion is the appropriation of it.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i gzhi ni spyod yul ma yin pa'i bud med dang / spyod yul yang yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin pa dang / tshod ma yin pa dang / rigs ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa'i gzhi ni spyod yul ma yin pa'i bud med dang / spyod yul yang yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin pa dang / tshod ma yin pa dang / rigs ma yin pa dang /
translated: The basis of sexual misconduct is an unsuitable woman, or a suitable woman in an unsuitable part of the body, in an unsuitable place, at an unsuitable time, to an unsuitable degree, or in an unsuitable manner.

original: pho dang ma ning thams cad do //
analyzed: pho dang ma ning thams cad do //

original: zin par byas pa ni //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni //
translated: The performance is

analyzed: gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa'o //

original: brdzun du smra ba'i gzhi ni //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i gzhi ni //
translated: The basis of false speech is

analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / bye brag ma phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes pa'o //

analyzed: bsam pa ni gzhan du 'du shes pa la gzhan du smra bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the desire to speak of what you have seen and so on as if you had not, or vice versa.

original: zin par byas pa ni /üîΩ'khor dang phyir rgol ba la go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni / 'khor dang phyir rgol ba la go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The performance isüîΩto make others understand.üîΩThe basis of divisive speech is

original: phra ma'i gzhi ni sems can 'dum pa dang / mi 'dum pa dag go //
analyzed: phra ma'i gzhi ni sems can 'dum pa dang / mi 'dum pa dag go //
translated: people who are in harmony or not in harmony.

original: bsam pa ni dbye ba dang bsdums mi bya bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni dbye ba dang bsdums mi bya bar sems pa'o //
translated: The intention is the thought to divide or to cause disharmony.

original: zin par byas pa ni phye bar shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni phye bar shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The performance is the act of informing the divided party.

original: ngag rtsub po'i rgyun ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa sems can rnams so //
analyzed: ngag rtsub po'i rgyun ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa sems can rnams so //

original: zin par byas pa ni ngag rtsub mo smras pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni ngag rtsub mo smras pa'o //
translated: The performance is the act of speaking harshly.

original: tshig 'khyal ba'i gzhi ni don med pa dang ldan pa'i don to //üîΩzin @200a * //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal ba'i gzhi ni don med pa dang ldan pa'i don to // zin @200a * //
translated: The basis of idle speech is a meaningless topic.

original: par byas pa ni de smra ba'o //
analyzed: par byas pa ni de smra ba'o //
translated: The performance is speaking about it.

original: brnab sems kyi gzhi ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad do //
analyzed: brnab sems kyi gzhi ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad do //
translated: The basis of covetousness is the wealth and possessions of others.

original: bsam pa ni de la der 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni de la der 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the perception of that as such and the desire for it.

original: sbyor ba ni bdag gis bya bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni bdag gis bya bar sems pa'o //
translated: The performance is the thought to make it one‚Äôs own.

original: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir byas par nges pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir byas par nges pa'o //
translated: The performance is the certainty of making it one‚Äôs own.

original: gnod sems kyi gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: The basis of malice is sentient beings who are the cause of complete torment.

original: zin par byas pa ni bsad pa la sogs par nges pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni bsad pa la sogs par nges pa'o //
translated: The performance is the certainty of killing and so on.

original: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni don yod pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni don yod pa'o //
translated: The basis of wrong views is the existence of objects.

original: bsam ni yod pa med par 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam ni yod pa med par 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the perception and the wish that what exists does not exist.

original: zin par byas pa ni skur bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni skur bar nges pa'o //
translated: The completion is the certainty of the denial.

original: sems pa las gyur ba'i las zhes gang bshad pa la /
analyzed: sems pa las gyur ba'i las zhes gang bshad pa la /
translated: As for the action that is explained as being mental,

original: sems pa las gyur ba gang gzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur ba dang / mi shes pa'i sems pa las gyur ba dang / rtsa ba mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur ba gang //
analyzed: sems pa las gyur ba gang gzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur ba dang / gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur ba dang / mi shes pa'i sems pa las gyur ba dang / rtsa ba mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur ba gang //
translated: there is the mental action that is the order of another, the mental action that is the request of another, the mental action that is ignorance, and the mental action that is the attachment to a root.

original: phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba'o//
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba'o//
translated: There is also the mental action that is error.

original: de la gzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste //
translated: Among these, the mental action that is the order of another is as follows.

original: 'ga' zhig mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis bsgo nas bsams te //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis bsgo nas bsams te //
translated: For example, when someone, not wanting to, is ordered by another to do something, and then thinks about it.

original: mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: He performs nonvirtue.

original: gzhan dag gis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur ba 'di lta ste //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur ba 'di lta ste //
translated: The mental action that is the request of another is as follows.

original: 'ga' zhig mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis gsol ba btab nas 'di ni phan pa'o zhes yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug len du bcug nas bsams te mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis gsol ba btab nas 'di ni phan pa'o zhes yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug len du bcug nas bsams te mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: Some, though not wanting to, are urged by others to do so, and, thinking that it is beneficial, they are made to accept it and to take it up.

original: mi shes pa'i sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: From the point of view of ignorance, it is as follows.

original: kha cig yon tan dang nyes pa mngon par mi shes pa shing mngon par zhen pa med par 'dod gar bsams nas mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig yon tan dang nyes pa mngon par mi shes pa shing mngon par zhen pa med par 'dod gar bsams nas mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: Some, not knowing the good qualities and faults, and not having a clear idea of anything, do what is unwholesome, thinking whatever comes to mind.

original: rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste //
translated: From the point of view of attachment to the root, it is as follows.

original: 'ga' zhig mi dge ba'i rtsa ba chags pa la sogs pas zil gyis non cing sems non nas mngon par shes pa drag pos bsams te mi dge ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi dge ba'i rtsa ba chags pa la sogs pas zil gyis non cing sems non nas mngon par shes pa drag pos bsams te mi dge ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: Some, overwhelmed by the roots of the unwholesome, such as attachment, and with their minds overpowered, do what is unwholesome, thinking with intense wrong knowledge.

original: phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba ni 'di lta ste //
translated: From the point of view of mistaken thought, it is as follows.

original: 'ga' zhig chos 'dod kyang mi mthun pa'i rgyu la lta ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig chos 'dod kyang mi mthun pa'i rgyu la lta ste /
translated: Some, though desiring the Dharma, look to a cause that is not in accord with it.

original: phyi ma la yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i don du bsams nas mi dge ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i don du bsams nas mi dge ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: The latter is the performance of nonvirtue after reflecting on it for the sake of a pleasant result.

original: de la rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur ba dang / phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa myong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur ba dang / phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa myong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Karma that is done and accumulated through the volition of attachment to a root and the volition of error is not without the experience of its ripening.

original: sngon @200b ma gsum ni las byas zin kyang sems pa las gyur ba'i las bsags pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon @200b ma gsum ni las byas zin kyang sems pa las gyur ba'i las bsags pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The first three kinds of karma are done, but they are not accumulated through the volition of error.

original: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, their ripening is not inevitable.

original: sems pa las gyur ba'i las phyi ma dag ni gal te byas par gyur na bsags pa yin te //
analyzed: sems pa las gyur ba'i las phyi ma dag ni gal te byas par gyur na bsags pa yin te //
translated: The latter kinds of karma that are done through the volition of error are accumulated if they are done.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their ripening is inevitable.

original: las byed pa ni kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: las byed pa ni kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The performance of karma is its practice.

original: bsags pa ni bag chags 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni bag chags 'phel ba'o //
translated: Its accumulation is the increase of its habitual tendencies.

original: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa sa bon gsos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du len pa'i rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa sa bon gsos par rig par bya'o //
translated: The consciousness that appropriates should be understood as the seed of the maturation that is nourished.

original: myong bar nges pa'i las zhes gang bshad pa la //
analyzed: myong bar nges pa'i las zhes gang bshad pa la //
translated: As for the karma that is certain to be experienced,

original: nges pa gang las byed par nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa dang / dus des pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa gang las byed par nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa dang / dus des pa'o //
translated: certainty is of three kinds: certainty of performance, certainty of experience of the karmic maturation, and certainty of time.

original: de la las byed par nges pa ni //
analyzed: de la las byed par nges pa ni //
translated: As for certainty of performance,

original: sngon gyi las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyud nges par byas nas 'phangs par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi las rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyud nges par byas nas 'phangs par gyur ba ste /
translated: having already determined the stream of the maturation of former karma, it is projected.

original: gang tshe de la nges 'di byed par nges pa de dang mi 'gal bar las de byed de /
analyzed: gang tshe de la nges 'di byed par nges pa de dang mi 'gal bar las de byed de /
translated: When it is certain that it will be performed, then it is performed without contradiction with that.

original: rgyu'i nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu'i rgyun 'gyur ba'i phyir de mi bya bar bzlog par ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang mdzad par mi byed do //
analyzed: rgyu'i nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu'i rgyun 'gyur ba'i phyir de mi bya bar bzlog par ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang mdzad par mi byed do //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddhas cannot prevent it from being performed, because the stream of the result is in accordance with the certainty of the cause.

original: rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa ni sems pa las gyur ba'i las kyis de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa ni sems pa las gyur ba'i las kyis de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: As for certainty of the experience of the karmic maturation, it is like the karma that is performed by intention.

original: dus nges pa ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi dus kyang nges par byas pa yin te /üîΩji ltar rnam par smin pa 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar byed do //
analyzed: dus nges pa ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi dus kyang nges par byas pa yin te / ji ltar rnam par smin pa 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar byed do //
translated: The time is also determined for the karma to be experienced in this life, and so on.

original: 'dis ni skye gnas so //üîΩ'dis ni lan grangs gzhan la'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni skye gnas so // 'dis ni lan grangs gzhan la'o zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, this karma will be experienced in this life, this in the next life, this in subsequent lives.

original: de la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lan rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song rnams su'o //üîΩchung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams te /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lan rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song rnams su'o // chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po rnams te /
translated: The ripened result of the ten unwholesome actions is the miserable realms.

original: yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / dmyal ba rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The weak, medium, and strong [actions] should be known as the hungry ghosts, animals, and hells, respectively.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun par mi'i lus dang / yongs su gzung ba'i 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun par mi'i lus dang / yongs su gzung ba'i 'byor ba'o //
translated: The result corresponding to the cause is, in accordance with each, the body of a human and the prosperity of possessions.

original: ngan song rnams nas shi 'phos nas mir skyes pa rnams kyis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa so so dang mthun pa'i lus dang yongs su bzung ba mi 'byor pa ste //
analyzed: ngan song rnams nas shi 'phos nas mir skyes pa rnams kyis srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa so so dang mthun pa'i lus dang yongs su bzung ba mi 'byor pa ste //
translated: Those who die in the lower realms and are reborn as humans do not obtain a body and possessions consistent with their individual actions, such as killing and stealing.

original: 'di ltar tshe thung ba dang / dbul ba la sogs pa ji ltar rig par ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe thung ba dang / dbul ba la sogs pa ji ltar rig par ro //
translated: Thus, they have a short life, are poor, and so on, as is well known.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun pa nyid du phyi'i dngos po mi 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun pa nyid du phyi'i dngos po mi 'byor ba'o //
translated: The dominant result is that external things are not obtained in a way that is consistent with each individual.

original: so sor srog gcod pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyi'i dngos po lo thog la sogs pa mi 'byor ba ste /
analyzed: so sor srog gcod pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyi'i dngos po lo thog la sogs pa mi 'byor ba ste /
translated: External things such as crops are not obtained in a way that is consistent with the individual who kills.

original: 'di lta ste //
analyzed: 'di lta ste //
translated: This is because

original: srog gcod pa'i dbang gis @201a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i dbang gis @201a * //
translated: due to killing,

original: ni gzi brjid med par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa ji ltar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ni gzi brjid med par 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa ji ltar bshad pa'o //
translated: one becomes lusterless, and so on, as explained.

original: mi dge ba bcu po thams cad kyi lam goms pa la brten cing mang du byas pas dmyal ba rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu po thams cad kyi lam goms pa la brten cing mang du byas pas dmyal ba rnams su skye'o //
translated: By relying on and frequently cultivating the path of all ten nonvirtues, one is born in the hells.

original: de rnams su rnam par smin pa myong bar byas nas mi dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs pa na /
analyzed: de rnams su rnam par smin pa myong bar byas nas mi dang skal ba mnyam par 'ongs pa na /
translated: Having experienced the results of these in these realms, when they come to the human realm,

analyzed: srog bcad pas tshe thung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they have short lives due to killing.

original: ma byin par blangs pas longs spyod pa la chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin par blangs pas longs spyod pa la chags par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dod pa la log par spyad pas bud med rnams la 'bad pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have attachment to women due to sexual misconduct.

original: brdzun du smras pas mi dge ba sgrogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smras pas mi dge ba sgrogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have bad reputations due to lying.

original: phra mas ni grogs dang dbye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mas ni grogs dang dbye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are separated from friends due to divisive speech.

original: tshig rtsub kyis ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig rtsub kyis ni yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: They hear unpleasant sounds due to harsh speech.

original: tshig kyal gyis ni ngag cal col du 'gyur ro //üîΩbrnab sems kyis ni 'dod chags drag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig kyal gyis ni ngag cal col du 'gyur ro // brnab sems kyis ni 'dod chags drag par 'gyur ro //
translated: They have frivolous speech due to idle speech.üîΩThey have strong attachment due to covetousness.

original: gnod sems kyis ni zhe sdang bdo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis ni zhe sdang bdo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They have strong anger due to malice.

original: log ltas ni gti mug bdo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log ltas ni gti mug bdo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They have strong delusion due to wrong views.

original: slar yang de la rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang de la rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are confused again.

original: de rnams ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: These are the results that resemble the causes.

original: yang srog gcod pa brten pas ni phyi rol gyi dngos po snum bag chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang srog gcod pa brten pas ni phyi rol gyi dngos po snum bag chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, by the support of killing, external objects have little oil.

original: ma byin par blangs pas ni mi brtan zhing nyams par byed pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byin par blangs pas ni mi brtan zhing nyams par byed pa mang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By taking what is not given, they are unstable and have many defects.

original: 'dod log spyad pas ni rdul gyis khebs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod log spyad pas ni rdul gyis khebs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By sexual misconduct, they are covered with dust.

original: brdzun du smras pas ni dri mi zhim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smras pas ni dri mi zhim par 'gyur ro //
translated: By false speech, they have a bad smell.

original: phra mas ni kha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra mas ni kha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By malicious speech, they are salty.

original: tshig rtsub kyis ni mtho dman can dang rtsub pa dang / sdig pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig rtsub kyis ni mtho dman can dang rtsub pa dang / sdig pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: By harsh speech, they are uneven, rough, and sinful.

original: tshig kyal gyis ni mi mthun zhing 'gyur ldog can du 'gyur ro //üîΩbrnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu rnams phra mor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig kyal gyis ni mi mthun zhing 'gyur ldog can du 'gyur ro // brnab sems kyis ni 'bras bu rnams phra mor 'gyur ro //
translated: By idle chatter, they are inconsistent and changeable.üîΩBy covetousness, their fruits are small.

original: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu rnams ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod sems kyis ni 'bras bu rnams ngo tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By ill will, their fruits are bitter.

original: log ltas ni lo thog rnams la 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log ltas ni lo thog rnams la 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By wrong view, their fruits are fruitless.

original: de rnams ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: These are the dominant results.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni lha dang mi rnams su'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni lha dang mi rnams su'o //
translated: The ripened result of the ten paths of virtuous action is birth as a god or human.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun par lus dang yongs su gzung bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun par lus dang yongs su gzung bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: The result corresponding to the cause is the body and possessions that are in accordance with each other in those same realms.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun pa'i phyi'i dngos po sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun pa'i phyi'i dngos po sbyor ba'o //
translated: The dominant result is the external entities that are in accordance with each other in those same realms.

original: ji ltar mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam smin gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa gsum rnam par gzhag par byas pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam smin gyi 'bras bu la sogs pa gsum rnam par gzhag par byas pa ltar /
translated: Just as the three results, the ripened result and so on, are posited for the nonvirtuous karmic paths,

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi yang lha dang mi rnams su 'bras bu gsum ni @201b ji ltar rig par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi yang lha dang mi rnams su 'bras bu gsum ni @201b ji ltar rig par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: so too the three results of the contaminated virtuous karmic paths should be applied as appropriate.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis ni /üîΩbde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror skye ba 'phen pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis ni /üîΩbde 'gro dang / ngan 'gror skye ba 'phen pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that virtuous and nonvirtuous karmaüîΩproject birth in fortunate realms and unfortunate realms, respectively, and complete the nature of those births.

original: 'phen pa ni gang gis rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'o //üîΩyongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni gang gis skyes pa na /
analyzed: 'phen pa ni gang gis rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'o // yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni gang gis skyes pa na /
translated: The projecting cause is that which projects the result.

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba'o //
translated: The completing cause is that which, when born, experiences the desirable or undesirable result.

original: las gcig gis lus gcig 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
analyzed: las gcig gis lus gcig 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
translated: There is karma that projects one body by one action.

original: las kyi skad cig gcig gis tshe gcig kho na'i rnam par smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi skad cig gcig gis tshe gcig kho na'i rnam par smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed of the result of one lifetime is nourished by one moment of karma.

original: las gcig gis lus du ma 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
analyzed: las gcig gis lus du ma 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
translated: There is karma that projects many bodies by one action.

original: de nyid kyi tshe rabs du ma'i rnam par smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe rabs du ma'i rnam par smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed of the result of many lifetimes is nourished.

original: las gzhi du mas lus gcig 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
analyzed: las gzhi du mas lus gcig 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
translated: There is karma that projects one body by many bases of karma.

original: las kyi skad cig mang po de nyid kyis yang dang yang sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyi skad cig mang po de nyid kyis yang dang yang sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seed is nourished again and again by many moments of karma.

original: las gzhi du mas lung du ma 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
analyzed: las gzhi du mas lung du ma 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
translated: There is karma that projects many bodies by many bases of karma.

original: mang po dag phan tshun ltos nas tshe rabs phan tshun brgyud de sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po dag phan tshun ltos nas tshe rabs phan tshun brgyud de sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because many actions, in mutual dependence, nourish the seeds of each other in mutual dependence.

original: las mang po dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams ji ltar rim gyis rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur /üîΩde la gang shin tu lci bar gyur pa de thog mar rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las mang po dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams ji ltar rim gyis rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur / de la gang shin tu lci bar gyur pa de thog mar rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: How does a sentient being who possesses many actions experience the ripening of action?üîΩThe most serious action ripens first.

original: yang na 'chi ba'i dus na gang mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba'i dus na gang mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, at the moment of death, whichever action is practiced most is the one that comes to mind.

original: yang na gang goms par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang goms par gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, whichever action is most habitual.

original: yang na gang thog mar spyad pa de thog ma nyid du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gang thog mar spyad pa de thog ma nyid du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, whichever action was committed first, that is, at the beginning of the life, ripens first.

original: bsod nams kyi las dang / bsod rnams ma yin pa'i las dang / mi g-yo ba'i las zhes gang bshad pa la bsod nams gang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las dang / bsod rnams ma yin pa'i las dang / mi g-yo ba'i las zhes gang bshad pa la bsod nams gang /
translated: What is meritorious action? What is demeritorious action? What is immovable action?

original: gang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o //üîΩbsod nams ma yin pa gang /üîΩgang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o // bsod nams ma yin pa gang / gang mi dge ba'o //
translated: Meritorious action is good action associated with the realm of desire.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las gang /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las gang /
translated: Demeritorious action is bad action.üîΩImmovable action is action of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality.

original: gang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: It is the wholesome that is associated with the form and formless realms.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba la mi g-yo ba zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba la mi g-yo ba zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the wholesome of the form and formless realms called unshakable?

original: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gyi rdzogs byed dge ba gzhan du rnam par smin par 'byin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gyi rdzogs byed dge ba gzhan du rnam par smin par 'byin par 'gyur la /
translated: Because the wholesome that perfects the other destinies in the desire realm does not produce its result in another destiny.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa la spyod pa na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa la spyod pa na ni ma yin te /
translated: But when one is in the form and formless realms, it does not.

original: sa nges pas 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa nges pas 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result is produced by the certainty of the stage.

original: de bas na rnam par smin 'byin par g-yo ba med pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba @202a * //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin 'byin par g-yo ba med pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba @202a * //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is called unshakable because it does not move to produce its result, and because it is on the level of meditative equipoise.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams dang bsod rnams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams so zhes gang gsungs pa de la ji ltar bsod rnams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams dang bsod rnams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams so zhes gang gsungs pa de la ji ltar bsod rnams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin /
translated: How are the meritorious, demeritorious, and unshakable volitions produced from the condition of ignorance?

original: rmongs pa ni gnyis te 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa dang de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni gnyis te 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa dang de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'o //
translated: There are two kinds of delusion: delusion about the ripening of results and delusion about the meaning of reality.

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: From delusion about the ripening of results, demeritorious volitions arise.

original: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa ni bsod nams dang / mi g-yo ba rnams so //
analyzed: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa ni bsod nams dang / mi g-yo ba rnams so //
translated: From delusion about the meaning of reality, meritorious and unshakable volitions arise.

original: de la 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, ‚ÄúFrom delusion about the ripening of results, demeritorious volitions arise‚Äù means:

original: de dag gis ni gcig tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas ma rig pa yod par gyur na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gcig tu nyon mongs pa can ma yin pas ma rig pa yod par gyur na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they are not exclusively afflicted, when ignorance exists, there is no opportunity for the correct view that has the aspect of conviction in the ripening of results.

original: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa ni bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba rnams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa ni bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba rnams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: Delusion about the meaning of reality is merit and unwavering karma.

original: de kho na'i don ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: de kho na'i don ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
translated: The meaning of reality is the four noble truths.

original: de la rmongs na dge ba'i sems yod du zin kyang bden pa ma mthong ba rnams la bag la nyal gyi rjes su 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rmongs na dge ba'i sems yod du zin kyang bden pa ma mthong ba rnams la bag la nyal gyi rjes su 'brel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is delusion about that, even if there is a virtuous mind, the latent afflictions will be connected for those who have not seen the truths.

original: de'i dbang gis de dag khams gsum pa sdug bsngal nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir yang srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams slong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de dag khams gsum pa sdug bsngal nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir yang srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams slong bar byed do //
translated: By the power of that, they generate meritorious and unwavering formative forces that are the cause of renewed existence, because they do not understand the three realms as they are in reality.

original: bden pa mthong ba rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Those who have seen the truths are not like that,

original: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not confused about the meaning of reality.

original: de bas na de dag ni de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, they are called those who have arisen from that cause.

original: srog gcod pa la ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor te /
translated: One engages in killing through attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin par byed do //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin par byed do //
translated: One completes it through hatred.

original: srog gcod pa la ji ltar ngag rtsub mo dang gnod sems la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la ji ltar ngag rtsub mo dang gnod sems la yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with killing, so also with harsh speech and malice.

original: de la sha la sogs pa 'dod pa rnams ni chags pa sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la sha la sogs pa 'dod pa rnams ni chags pa sbyor ba'o //
translated: Among them, those who desire flesh, etc. engage through attachment.

original: zhe 'gras pa la lan ldon pa ni zhe sdang gis so //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa la lan ldon pa ni zhe sdang gis so //
translated: Those who are hostile engage through hatred.

original: mchod sbyin rnams la gti mug gis sbyor ro //
analyzed: mchod sbyin rnams la gti mug gis sbyor ro //
translated: Those who are deluded engage through delusion, such as in the case of animal sacrifices.

original: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin par byed de snying rje med pa ma yin par sems can gsod mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ni mthar phyin par byed de snying rje med pa ma yin par sems can gsod mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One completes it through hatred, because it is impossible to kill a sentient being without cruelty.

original: de ltar ngag rtsub pa la sogs pa la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ngag rtsub pa la sogs pa la yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply this also to harsh speech, etc., as appropriate.

original: ma byin par len pa ni /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa ni /
translated: Taking what is not given is initiated by

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti @202b mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti @202b mug gis sbyor te /
translated: greed, hatred, and delusion.

original: chags pas mthar phyin par byed do //
analyzed: chags pas mthar phyin par byed do //
translated: It is completed by greed.

original: ma byin par len pa la ji lta bar 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brnab sems la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la ji lta bar 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brnab sems la yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with taking what is not given, so it is with sexual misconduct and covetousness.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa la ji ltar chags pa la sogs pas sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa la ji ltar chags pa la sogs pas sbyor zhe na /
translated: How are covetousness and so on initiated by greed and so on?üîΩCovetousness is taught to be the definite determination to make another's property and possessions one's own.

original: de la brnab sems kyi las kyi lam ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad bdag gir byed par nges pa'o zhes bstan pa de la gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad de nyid 'dod par gyur na de dag bdag gir bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: de la brnab sems kyi las kyi lam ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad bdag gir byed par nges pa'o zhes bstan pa de la gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad de nyid 'dod par gyur na de dag bdag gir bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: If one is greedy for another's property and possessions, one will make efforts to make them one's own.

original: de'i phyir chags pas sbyor ba rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pas sbyor ba rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, covetousness is established as initiated by greed.

original: ji ste 'di yir ma gyur cig ce na /
analyzed: ji ste 'di yir ma gyur cig ce na /
translated: If one thinks, May they not belong to another,

original: de lta na ni zhe sdang gis sbyor ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhe sdang gis sbyor ro //
translated: then one initiates covetousness with hatred.

original: ji ste gzhan gyis bdag gir byas kyang nyes pa ci yang med do snyam na gti mug gis sbyor bar lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ste gzhan gyis bdag gir byas kyang nyes pa ci yang med do snyam na gti mug gis sbyor bar lta bar bya'o //
translated: If you think that there is no fault in taking what is not given because it belongs to no one, you should know that it is done through delusion.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other [non-virtues].

original: brdzun du smra ba rnams la ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba rnams la ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor te /
translated: As for lying, it is done through attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: gsum po dag la gang yang rung ba mthar phyin par byed do //
analyzed: gsum po dag la gang yang rung ba mthar phyin par byed do //
translated: Among the three, any one of them is brought to completion.

original: brdzun du smra ba la ji lta bar /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la ji lta bar /
translated: As for lying,

original: phra ma dang / tshig 'khyal ba la yang de bzhin no //üîΩbrdzun ni mthong ba la chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra ma dang / tshig 'khyal ba la yang de bzhin no // brdzun ni mthong ba la chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the same should be applied to slander and idle talk.üîΩAs for lying, it is done through attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: log par lta ba la yang chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: log par lta ba la yang chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis sbyor te /
translated: As for wrong views, they are done through attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: gti mug gis mthar phyin par byed do //üîΩlas thun mong par yang bshad /
analyzed: gti mug gis mthar phyin par byed do // las thun mong par yang bshad /
translated: Among the three, delusion brings them to completion.üîΩIt is also explained as a common action.

original: thun mong ma yin par yang bshad /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin par yang bshad /
translated: It is also explained as a non-common action.

original: stobs dang ldan par yang bshad /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan par yang bshad /
translated: It is also explained as a powerful action.

translated: It is the wholesome action of the fourth meditation and of the higher stages.

original: mthong ba'i chos las myong bar 'gyur ba gang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos las myong bar 'gyur ba gang /
