original: gang mthong ba'i chos la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i chos la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the action which produces results in the present existence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is, for example,üîΩthe action which produces results in the present life for one who has arisen from the concentration of loving-kindness, whether it be beneficial or harmful.

original: byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed pa las byung ba dang / byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ji lta bar /
analyzed: byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa la phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed pa las byung ba dang / byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin las ji lta bar /
translated: As it is for the concentration of loving-kindness,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las langs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las langs pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun la yang de bzhin no //
translated: the concentration of the absence of conflict, the meditative attainment of cessation, the fruit of entering the stream and the fruit of arhatship, and also with regard to the community of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: yang na bsam pa ni shin tu drag pos sbyar bas dge ba dang mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bsam pa ni shin tu drag pos sbyar bas dge ba dang mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: Or else, virtue and nonvirtue are practiced with a very intense intention.

original: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni /
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life is

original: tshe gang la byas pa de nyid la gang rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe gang la byas pa de nyid la gang rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: that which will be experienced in the very lifetime in which it is committed.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang /
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang /
translated: What is karma to be experienced after taking rebirth?

original: gang tshe phyi ma nyid la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang tshe phyi ma nyid la rnam par smin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is that which will be experienced in the very next lifetime.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i las rnams so //
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i las rnams so //
translated: it is the five actions of immediate retribution.

original: yang na dge ba dang mi dge ba gzhan yang yin no /
analyzed: yang na dge ba dang mi dge ba gzhan yang yin no /
translated: Or else, it is other virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni /
analyzed: skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni /
translated: Karma to be experienced after taking rebirth is

original: gang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i tshe la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang de ma thag tu 'byung ba'i tshe la myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Karma to be experienced after rebirth means karma to be experienced in the next life.

original: 'di ltar mtshams med pa lnga'i las rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshams med pa lnga'i las rnams so //
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life means karma to be experienced in this lifetime.

original: gang gis mtshams med pa gcig de'i rnam par smin pa de ma thag par rigs na /üîΩde gang gi mang po gang yin pa de'i de dag gi rnam par smin pa ji ltar myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis mtshams med pa gcig de'i rnam par smin pa de ma thag par rigs na / de gang gi mang po gang yin pa de'i de dag gi rnam par smin pa ji ltar myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Karma to be experienced in a subsequent rebirth means karma to be experienced in the rebirth after the next.üîΩKarma to be experienced in other subsequent rebirths means karma to be experienced in a rebirth after that.

original: thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa cig car myong bar 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar mtshams med pa du ma byed pa'i lus shin tu rab tu gnon par mngon par 'grub la chad pa mang zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rnam par smin pa cig car myong bar 'gyur te / 'di ltar mtshams med pa du ma byed pa'i lus shin tu rab tu gnon par mngon par 'grub la chad pa mang zhing /
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.

original: mi bzad pa sna tshogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi bzad pa sna tshogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.

original: de'i dbang gis tshor ba shin tu mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis tshor ba shin tu mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.

original: rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur pa la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par @206b gzhag gi /
analyzed: rtsom pa'i dbang du byas nas mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur pa la sogs pa 'di dag rnam par @206b gzhag gi /
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is not experienced in this life.

original: de tsam la myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa ni ma yin no //üîΩtshe de nyid la gang gi rnam par smin ba rtsom pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam la myong bar 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas pa ni ma yin no // tshe de nyid la gang gi rnam par smin ba rtsom pa de ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: But this is not from the point of view of the experience of the result.

original: gang de ma thag pa'i tshe la rtsom pa de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'o //üîΩgang de ma thag tu byung ba'i tshe thal nas rtsom pa de ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste de ltar byas na ni kyi hud sems zhes bya ba'i rtog pa brjod pa las mtshams med pa lnga'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i sems can
analyzed: gang de ma thag pa'i tshe la rtsom pa de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'o // gang de ma thag tu byung ba'i tshe thal nas rtsom pa de ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba ste de ltar byas na ni kyi hud sems zhes bya ba'i rtog pa brjod pa las mtshams med pa lnga'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i sems can
translated: When the result of an action is experienced in the very same life in which the action was done, it is called karma to be experienced in this life.üîΩWhen the result is experienced in the next life after the one in which the action was done, it is called karma to be experienced after taking rebirth.üîΩWhen the result is experienced in a life after that, it is called karma to be experienced in a third life or later.

original: dmyal bar yang dang yang 'chi 'pho zhing skye bar rnam par smin pa myong ngo zhes gsungs pa dang mthun par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dmyal bar yang dang yang 'chi 'pho zhing skye bar rnam par smin pa myong ngo zhes gsungs pa dang mthun par byas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the statement in the Sutra of the Questions of Ksudrapanthaka that ‚Äúthe result of the five heinous actions is experienced in hell over and over again‚Äù is consistent with the explanation of the Abhidharma.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang /
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gang /
translated: What is karma to be experienced in a third life or later?

original: gang de phan chad du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang de phan chad du rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is karma whose result will be experienced after that.

original: gnag la rnam par smin pa'i las gang /
analyzed: gnag la rnam par smin pa'i las gang /
translated: What is the action that is black and has black ripening?

original: gang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba'o //
translated: It is the unwholesome.

original: gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las ni mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: gnag la rnam par smin pa gnag pa'i las ni mi dge ba ste /
translated: The unwholesome is the action that is black and has black ripening,

original: nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is defiled and has a ripening.

original: dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las gang /
analyzed: dkar la rnam par smin pa dkar ba'i las gang /
translated: What is the action that is white and has white ripening?

original: khams gsum pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: It is the wholesome of the three realms.

original: gang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //üîΩdkar gnag tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o // dkar gnag tu 'gyur la /
translated: It is that which is not defiled.üîΩWhat is the action that is white and black and has white and black ripening?

original: rnam par smin pa dkar gnag tu gyur pa dang / gang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i 'dren ma ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dkar gnag tu gyur pa dang / gang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i 'dren ma ste /
translated: It is the mixed wholesome and unwholesome of the realm of desire.

original: de'i dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is wholesome and unwholesome.

original: gcig ji ltar na dge bar yang 'gyur la mi dge bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gcig ji ltar na dge bar yang 'gyur la mi dge bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can one action be wholesome and unwholesome?

original: 'di la 'jug pa'i skad cig nges par de gnyi ga brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la 'jug pa'i skad cig nges par de gnyi ga brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, it is not said that the moment of entry is both.

original: 'on kyang bsam pa dang lhan cig pa'i sbyor ba la gcig ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsam pa dang lhan cig pa'i sbyor ba la gcig ces bya ste /
translated: However, the preparation that is associated with the intention is called one.

original: 'di ni 'di ltar dgongs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di ltar dgongs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning that should be understood.

original: de gnyi ga nag po dang dkar po nyid du 'dra bar gyur bas de ltar nag po dang dkar po nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de gnyi ga nag po dang dkar po nyid du 'dra bar gyur bas de ltar nag po dang dkar po nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Both are similar in being black and white, so they are established as black and white.

original: bsam pas gnag la sbyor bas dkar ba'am sbyor bas gnag la bsam pas dkar ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pas gnag la sbyor bas dkar ba'am sbyor bas gnag la bsam pas dkar ba'o //
translated: It is black in intention and white in application, or white in intention and black in application.

original: de la bsam pas gnag la sbyor bas dkar ba ni /
analyzed: de la bsam pas gnag la sbyor bas dkar ba ni /
translated: Among them, black in intention and white in application is

original: dper na 'ga' zhig gzhan dag la slu bar 'dod na de dag yid ches par bya ba'i mtshan mar bsams nas sbyin pa nas rab tu 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig gzhan dag la slu bar 'dod na de dag yid ches par bya ba'i mtshan mar bsams nas sbyin pa nas rab tu 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: for example, if someone wishes to deceive others, they think of the signs of gaining their trust, and then give to them up to going forth.

original: sbyor bas gnag la bsam pas dkar po ni /
analyzed: sbyor bas gnag la bsam pas dkar po ni /
translated: White in intention and black in application is

original: dper na 'ga' zhig bu'am slob ma mi phan pa bzlog par 'dod cing phan pa la sbyor bar 'dod nas snying brtse ba'i sems kyis lus dang / ngag drag tu byed @207a * //
analyzed: dper na 'ga' zhig bu'am slob ma mi phan pa bzlog par 'dod cing phan pa la sbyor bar 'dod nas snying brtse ba'i sems kyis lus dang / ngag drag tu byed @207a * //
translated: for example, if someone wishes to stop their child or student from doing harm and wishes to connect them to benefit, with a compassionate mind they speak harshly to their body and speech.

original: pa'i tshe de las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i tshe de las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, they become afflicted.

original: mi gnag cing dkar la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhing las zad par 'gyur ba'i las gang /
analyzed: mi gnag cing dkar la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhing las zad par 'gyur ba'i las gang /
translated: What is the action that is neither black nor white and does not result in a ripening, but which exhausts action?

original: sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la zag pa med pa'i las so //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa'i lam rnams la zag pa med pa'i las so //
translated: It is the uncontaminated action of the paths of preparation and immediate succession.

original: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams spong ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams spong ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the antidotes that eliminate the paths of preparation and immediate succession.

original: de la mi gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not black because it is free from the stain of the afflictions.

original: dkar ba ni mtha' gcig tu rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar ba ni mtha' gcig tu rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is white because it is exclusively pure.

original: rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not result in a ripening because it is incompatible with samsara.

original: las zad par 'gyur ba ni yang dag par bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las zad par 'gyur ba ni yang dag par bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It exhausts action because it transforms it.

original: 'dir mi gnag cing dkar ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni zag pa med pa'i las so //
analyzed: 'dir mi gnag cing dkar ba la sogs pa rnam pa gsum ni zag pa med pa'i las so //
translated: Here, the three types of action that are neither black nor white, etc., are uncontaminated action.

original: de bas na zag pa med pa ni rnam par smin pa len pa med pa'i phyir kun du bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na zag pa med pa ni rnam par smin pa len pa med pa'i phyir kun du bcom pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since the uncontaminated does not take up a ripening, it is completely destroyed.

original: de'i phyir bye brag med par zag pa med pa'i las 'di thams cad kyi bar du gcod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yon po dang / nyes pa dang / rnyog ma dang / gtsang ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir bye brag med par zag pa med pa'i las 'di thams cad kyi bar du gcod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yon po dang / nyes pa dang / rnyog ma dang / gtsang ba dang /
translated: Therefore, in terms of all uncontaminated karma, without distinction, they are positive, negative, contaminated, pure,üîΩ

original: thub pa ba rnams go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: thub pa ba rnams go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o /
translated: Therefore, all uncontaminated actions are to be understood as being established in order, without distinction, in terms of their obscuration, conformity, and nature, as crooked, faulty, turbid, clear, and pure.

original: de la yon po ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las drang po'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'byung ba'i sgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yon po ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las drang po'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'byung ba'i sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: Crooked action is the action of body, speech, and mind that is an obstruction to the arising of the straight path, the eightfold noble path.

original: nyes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i las gang gis rnam par sun 'byin pa'i sems kyi rgyud la de dang / de 'dra ba'i sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i las gang gis rnam par sun 'byin pa'i sems kyi rgyud la de dang / de 'dra ba'i sgrib par 'gyur ba'i las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Faulty action is the action of body, etc., that is an obstruction to the mind that is being disciplined by that action.üîΩTurbid action is the action of body, etc., that is based on the views of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: rnyog ma ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba la brten pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnyog ma ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba la brten pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa ste /
translated: Clear action is the action of body, etc., that is based on the views of the noble ones.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa'i rnyog mas yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa'i rnyog mas yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is completely seized by the turbidity of non-faith, which is the adverse side to faith in the Buddha's teaching.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mthar lhung ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na rtag pa dang / chad pa'i mthar lhung ste /
translated: In another way, it is a fall into the extremes of eternalism and annihilationism.

original: dbu ma'i lam dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yon po'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yon po'o //
translated: It is crooked because it is not in accord with the middle way.

original: skur ba'i lta bas yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: skur ba'i lta bas yongs su bzung ste /
translated: It is seized by the view of negation.

original: rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa la rab tu sdang ba'i phyir nyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa la rab tu sdang ba'i phyir nyes pa'o //
translated: It is a fault because it is hostile to the establishment of purification.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bas yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bas yongs su bzung ste /
translated: It is seized by the view of individuality.

original: bdag med pa kho na la lta ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir rnyog ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa kho na la lta ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir rnyog ma zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called turbidity because it obstructs the view of no-self.

original: gtsang ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyis yongs su zin pa dang / lta ba drag pos yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gtsang ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyis yongs su zin pa dang / lta ba drag pos yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las gang yin pa ste /
translated: Purity is any action of body, speech, or mind that is seized by very pure morality and seized by a strong view.

original: tshul khrims dang lta ba log par @207b zhugs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang lta ba log par @207b zhugs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is free from the stain of false morality and view.

original: thub pa la ni gang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa la ni gang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zag pa med pa ste /
translated: The action of the Muni is the uncontaminated action of body, speech, and mind of those in training and beyond training.

original: de thub pa rnams kyi las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thub pa rnams kyi las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the action of the Muni because it is the action of the Muni.

original: sbyin pa'i las gang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i las gang /
translated: What is the action of generosity?

original: de'i gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood through its basis, its instigation, its object, and its nature.

original: gzhi ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi ni ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa'o //
translated: Its basis is nonattachment, nonaversion, and nonignorance.

original: kun nas slong ba ni de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir tshor ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas slong ba ni de dag dang ldan pa'i phyir tshor ba'o //
translated: Its instigation is feeling, because it is associated with those three.

original: dngos po ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: Its object is the thing to be given.

original: ngo bo nyid ni stong pa na lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni stong pa na lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las so //
translated: Its nature is the action of body and speech, because it is empty.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pa yin /
translated: How is generosity perfect?

original: phyir zhing sbyin pa dang / phyogs mi 'byed par sbyin pa dang / 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir zhing sbyin pa dang / phyogs mi 'byed par sbyin pa dang / 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is perfect through repetition, through non-discrimination, and through fulfillment of desires.

original: de dag ni sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste de la sbyin pa por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyir zhing sbyin pa ston te /
analyzed: de dag ni sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste de la sbyin pa por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyir zhing sbyin pa ston te /
translated: These should be understood as the best kinds of generosity. The phrase ‚Äúhe becomes a true giver‚Äù shows that generosity is repeated.

original: de'i ngang tshul can du gyur bas yang dang yang sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ngang tshul can du gyur bas yang dang yang sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has that nature, he gives again and again.

original: dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams la gces pa la sogs pas ni phyogs mi 'byed par sbyin pa ston te /
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams la gces pa la sogs pas ni phyogs mi 'byed par sbyin pa ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúto ascetics and brahmins‚Äù shows that generosity is impartial,

original: 'dod pa thams cad la bye brag med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad la bye brag med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he gives without making distinctions among those who want something.

original: bza' ba sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyin pa ston te /
analyzed: bza' ba sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sbyin pa ston te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe gives food to those who want food‚Äù shows that generosity fulfills desires,

original: bsam pa ji ltar ba bzhin du yo byad kyi dngos po ma rul zhing dri ma med pa'i gzhi thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa ji ltar ba bzhin du yo byad kyi dngos po ma rul zhing dri ma med pa'i gzhi thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he gives away all the things that are needed without reservation, in whatever way they are needed.

original: yang mi gnas par sbyin pa dang / rgya cher sbyin pa dang / dga' bas sbyin pa dang / phyir zhing sbyin pa dang / snod la sbyin pa dang / 'khor dang / glo bur du 'ongs pa la legs par bgos te sbyin pas sbyin pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang mi gnas par sbyin pa dang / rgya cher sbyin pa dang / dga' bas sbyin pa dang / phyir zhing sbyin pa dang / snod la sbyin pa dang / 'khor dang / glo bur du 'ongs pa la legs par bgos te sbyin pas sbyin pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Generosity is considered perfect when it is timely, disinterested, respectful, one gives with one's own hand, and when it is given without doing harm.üîΩGenerosity is timely when it is given at the right time.üîΩGenerosity is disinterested when it is given without seeking the result of that giving either in this world or the next.

original: lhug par gtong ba dang / lag pa brkyang ba dang / gtong ba la dga' ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa'i tshul can dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin la legs par 'gyed pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di dag ni mi gnas par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshig dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhug par gtong ba dang / lag pa brkyang ba dang / gtong ba la dga' ba dang / mchod sbyin byed pa'i tshul can dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin la legs par 'gyed pa la dga' ba zhes bya ba 'di dag ni mi gnas par sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshig dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Generosity is respectful when it is given with one's own hand and with devotion, and to a recipient who is held in high esteem.üîΩGenerosity is with one's own hand when it is given by oneself.

original: mi gnas par sbyin pa ni /üîΩsrid pa dang longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas par sbyin pa ni / srid pa dang longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Generosity is without doing harm when it is given without doing harm to others.

original: ji ltar na sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: How is generosity considered perfect with regard to the thing given?

original: sbyin pa bya ba'i dngos po gnod pas grub pa ma yin pa dang / sbyin pa la bya ba'i dngos gzhan las phrogs par ma yin @208a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa bya ba'i dngos po gnod pas grub pa ma yin pa dang / sbyin pa la bya ba'i dngos gzhan las phrogs par ma yin @208a * //
translated: The object to be given is not established by harm, not taken from another,

original: pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po ma rul zhing dri ma med pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rung ba dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chos kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po ma rul zhing dri ma med pa dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rung ba dang / sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chos kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: not rotten or spoiled, suitable, and established by Dharma as the object to be given.

original: sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: In terms of the perfection of the object to be given, it is said to be obtained through the effort of rising.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gnod pas grub pa ma yin pa ston to //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gnod pas grub pa ma yin pa ston to //
translated: This shows that the object to be given is not established by harm.

original: gnod pas grub pa ni ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pas grub pa ni ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa ma yin te /
translated: What is established by harm is not obtained through the effort of rising,

original: rang gi gnas na 'dug cing gzhan gyis bcol ba bsnyon pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi gnas na 'dug cing gzhan gyis bcol ba bsnyon pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is obtained by staying in one's own place and being accused by others.

original: lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: By the power of the merchant's effort, it is said to be obtained.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan las phrogs pa ma yin pa ston to //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan las phrogs pa ma yin pa ston to //
translated: This shows that the thing given is not taken from another.

original: gzhan las phrogs pa ni lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las phrogs pa ni lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not taken from another if it is not obtained by the power of begging.

original: de dag gi sha thang bar thabs sna tshogs kyis bsgrubs pa phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sha thang bar thabs sna tshogs kyis bsgrubs pa phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taken from those who have obtained it through various kinds of hardship.

original: rdul dang dri mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: rdul dang dri mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot defiled by dust and dirt‚Äù

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po ma rul zhing dri ma med pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po ma rul zhing dri ma med pa ston pa ste /
translated: shows that the thing given is not rotten and is pure.

original: rdul dang dri mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba ni spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdul dang dri mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba ni spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúNot defiled by dust and dirt‚Äù means ‚Äúnot rejected.‚Äù

original: chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rung ba ston te mtshon cha dang / dug dang / chang la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rung ba ston te mtshon cha dang / dug dang / chang la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin accordance with the Dharma‚Äù shows that the thing given is suitable, because unsuitable things such as weapons, poison, and intoxicants are excluded.

original: chos kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: chos kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúobtained righteously‚Äù

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chos kyis bsgrubs pa ston to //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chos kyis bsgrubs pa ston to //
translated: shows that the thing given is obtained righteously.

original: gzhal ba las g-yo 'jug pa la sogs pa dang / log pas 'tsho ba la sogs pa yongs su spangs pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal ba las g-yo 'jug pa la sogs pa dang / log pas 'tsho ba la sogs pa yongs su spangs pas bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished by avoiding deceit, hypocrisy, etc. and wrong livelihood.

original: ji ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin /
translated: How is he endowed with morality?

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he protects the morality that he has undertaken.

original: mnyam sa pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mnyam sa pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with morality because he is endowed with that.

original: ji ltar na so sor thar pa'i sdoms pas bsdoms pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na so sor thar pa'i sdoms pas bsdoms pa yin /
translated: How is he restrained by the prƒÅtimok·π£a vow?

original: nges par 'phyi na pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'phyi na pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has the morality of restraint.

original: thar pa'i phyir sdom pa gang yin pa de ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa'i phyir sdom pa gang yin pa de ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ste /
translated: That restraint which is for the sake of liberation is the prƒÅtimok·π£a vow.

original: de ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba las nges par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is the definite release from cyclic existence.

original: ji ltar na cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin /
translated: How is he perfect in his conduct and sphere of activity?

original: ma smad pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smad pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has irreproachable morality.

original: chog phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod lam la sogs pa dam pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chog phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod lam la sogs pa dam pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of contentment is the absence of criticism by holy beings with regard to one's behavior, etc.

original: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod yul ma yin pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod yul ma yin pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of the sphere is the avoidance of the five improper spheres.

original: dge slong gi skyod @208b yul ma yin pa lnga ni gsod pa'i sa dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gnas dang / chang 'tshong ma'i khyim dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gdol ba'i khyim ste lnga'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi skyod @208b yul ma yin pa lnga ni gsod pa'i sa dang / smad 'tshong ma'i gnas dang / chang 'tshong ma'i khyim dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gdol ba'i khyim ste lnga'o //
translated: The five improper spheres for a monk are: a slaughterhouse, a brothel, a tavern, the palace of a king, and the house of an outcast.

original: ji ltar na kha na ma tho ba chung ngu tsam rnams la yang 'jigs par blta ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na kha na ma tho ba chung ngu tsam rnams la yang 'jigs par blta ba yin /
translated: How does one view even the slightest misdeed with fear?

original: shin tu gus par slob pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu gus par slob pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is disciplined with great respect.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams dang / rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba rnams la yang bsam pa drag pos slob pa kha na ma tho ba chung ngu tsam rnams la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams dang / rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba rnams la yang bsam pa drag pos slob pa kha na ma tho ba chung ngu tsam rnams la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
translated: One is disciplined with a strong intention with regard to the natural misdeeds and the misdeeds of transgression, and one views even the slightest misdeed with fear.

original: ji ltar na yang dag par blangs pa la slob /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang dag par blangs pa la slob /
translated: How does one train in what has been undertaken?

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par slob pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par slob pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is morality in which one trains in the completion of the training in the bases of training.

original: kun nas yongs su rdzogs par bslab pa rnams blangs nas slob pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: kun nas yongs su rdzogs par bslab pa rnams blangs nas slob pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs te /
translated: Having undertaken the training in its entirety, one trains.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob ces brjod do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob ces brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one trains in the bases of training.

original: 'di man chad du ni tshul khrims las brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'di man chad du ni tshul khrims las brtsams nas /
translated: From here on, the text discusses morality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan du lus dang ngag gis bsdams pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa de'i don brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan du lus dang ngag gis bsdams pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan pa de'i don brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of what was taught by the Blessed One in other s≈´tras, such as ‚Äúrestraint in body and speech,‚Äù should be explained.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyad pa bsdams pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyad pa bsdams pa yin /
translated: How is one restrained in the practice of body and speech?

original: shes bzhin gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is fully embraced by introspection.

original: ji ltar gnang ba bzhin du 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la blo sngon du btang nas legs par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gnang ba bzhin du 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la blo sngon du btang nas legs par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one proceeds and turns away after first considering, and so on, in accordance with what is permitted.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag phun sum tshogs pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag phun sum tshogs pa yin //
translated: How is it that they are endowed with body and speech?

original: ltung bas mi gnod pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ltung bas mi gnod pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because they are not harmed by downfalls.

original: ltung bas mi gnod pa'i phyir ni tshul khrims chud mi gzon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung bas mi gnod pa'i phyir ni tshul khrims chud mi gzon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not harmed by downfalls because they do not waste morality.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa dag yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa dag yin /
translated: How is it that they are endowed with bodily and vocal action?

original: 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa rim gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi bar la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa rim gyis ting nge 'dzin gyi bar la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are free from regret, etc., and because they are established in concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established in concentration, they are free from the stain of immorality.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa dge ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa dge ba yin /
translated: How is it that they are endowed with virtuous bodily and vocal action?

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not mixed with afflicted views.

original: gcig tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are exclusively virtuous.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa yin /
translated: How is it that they are endowed with uncensurable bodily and vocal action?

original: de smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de smon nas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are free from the vow of celibacy that is motivated by desire for rebirth in the Brahma world.

original: srid pa longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo bas dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo bas dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not dedicated to the enjoyment of existence, and because they are praised by the holy ones.

original: ji ltar na lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi kun du spyod pa gnod pa med pa yin /üîΩgzhan la brnyas thabs mi byed cing 'grogs na @209a * //
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi kun du spyod pa gnod pa med pa yin / gzhan la brnyas thabs mi byed cing 'grogs na @209a * //
translated: How are their bodily, vocal, and mental practices free from harm?

original: bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not despise others and are easy to get along with.

original: bdag la bstod pa la sogs pas gzhan khyad du gsod cing 'grogs na mi bde bas zher 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa la sogs pas gzhan khyad du gsod cing 'grogs na mi bde bas zher 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not praise themselves and do not despise others.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa rjes su mthun pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa rjes su mthun pa yin /
translated: How are their bodily and vocal practices in accord with Dharma?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are in accord with the attainment of nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa dang mthun pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed pa dang mthun pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because they are in accord with the attainment of nirvana.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are directed toward the noble path.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa rjes su 'byor ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa rjes su 'byor ba yin /
translated: How are their bodily and vocal practices in accord with Dharma?

original: dge ba mi bcom pa dang / sdig pa mi 'chab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba mi bcom pa dang / sdig pa mi 'chab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not destroy the good, and because he does not conceal his sins.

original: rang gi nyes pa mthol zhing yon tan 'chab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa mthol zhing yon tan 'chab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he confesses his faults and conceals his good qualities.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa thabs dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa thabs dang ldan pa yin /
translated: How is bodily and vocal action skillful?

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nye bar sdud pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nye bar sdud pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is morality which attracts companions in the holy life.

original: nye bar 'gro ba'i bya ba'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar 'gro ba'i bya ba'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is suitable for attracting those who are not yet attracted.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa la 'cham pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa la 'cham pa yin //
translated: How is bodily and vocal action agreeable?

original: bla ma rnams dang / bla ma dang 'dra ba rnams lang rgyal bcag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla ma rnams dang / bla ma dang 'dra ba rnams lang rgyal bcag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the salutation of superiors and equals.

original: ci rigs su bsnyen bkur byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci rigs su bsnyen bkur byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the service rendered to them in a manner appropriate to their worth.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa mthun pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa mthun pa yin //
translated: How is bodily and vocal action consistent?

original: gdams ngag la mthun par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdams ngag la mthun par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the acceptance of advice.

original: rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the absence of pride in one's own view.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa gdung ba med pa yin //
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa gdung ba med pa yin //
translated: How is it that his bodily and vocal conduct is not tormented?

original: dka' thub drag po dang ngan ngon la mos pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' thub drag po dang ngan ngon la mos pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has rejected the idea that austerities and the bare necessities are the path.

original: rgyud la gdung ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud la gdung ba mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not torment his own mindstream.

original: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa phyis 'gyod pa med pa yin /üîΩlongs spyod dang las kyi mtha' spangs pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa phyis 'gyod pa med pa yin / longs spyod dang las kyi mtha' spangs pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How is it that his bodily and vocal conduct is not later regretted?üîΩBecause he does not regret having rejected wealth and work.

original: longs spyod dang las kyi mtha' spangs pa las brtsams nas phyir 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dang las kyi mtha' spangs pa las brtsams nas phyir 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not regret having rejected wealth and work.

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dpag tu med pa kun tu ston to //
translated: By mastery of superknowledge, one manifests innumerable miracles in order to develop living beings.üîΩBy mastery of the dh√¢ra·πá√Æs, one retains the teachings of the scriptures and so on.üîΩBy mastery of the Pith Instructions, one is able to explain the scriptures and so on.

original: ye shes la dbang bas ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa rnams kyi rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gro'o //üîΩchos la dbang bas ni ci rigs par ji tsam du sems can rnams la ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzhan dag gis mdo las sogs pa'i chos rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: ye shes la dbang bas ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa rnams kyi rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gro'o // chos la dbang bas ni ci rigs par ji tsam du sems can rnams la ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzhan dag gis mdo las sogs pa'i chos rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: By mastery of intuition, one goes to the ultimate perfection of the Dharma, of meaning, of expression, and of confidence.

original: cig car sems can yongs su tshim par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car sems can yongs su tshim par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By mastery of Dharma, one is able to satisfy beings all at once by presenting the Dharma of the Sutras, etc. with other collections of names, expressions, and letters, as is appropriate.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa'i phrin las kyi las bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa'i phrin las kyi las bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: The activity of the Buddha is inconceivable.

original: ji lta bu zhe na //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na //
translated: How so?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad lhun gyis grub par rtogs par khong du chud cing chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa nyid du gyur @211a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad lhun gyis grub par rtogs par khong du chud cing chos kyi dbyings ro gcig pa nyid du gyur @211a * //
translated: All the Blessed Buddhas have realized the spontaneous, and have become one taste in the Dharma-element.

original: nas / sems can rnams gang gi tshe dang / ji lta bu dang / ji srid du mdzad pa sgrub par byed pa de thams cad rjes su gnas te /
analyzed: nas / sems can rnams gang gi tshe dang / ji lta bu dang / ji srid du mdzad pa sgrub par byed pa de thams cad rjes su gnas te /
translated: and he remains in the same way until sentient beings are established in the performance of their duties.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab po //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab po //
translated: Thus, the domain of the buddhas is inconceivable.

original: de dag mdor bsdus na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag mdor bsdus na kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, the characteristic of the truth of origination should be understood as fourfold:

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rab tu skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rab tu skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / rkyen gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of cause, the characteristic of origination, the characteristic of strong production, and the characteristic of condition.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid gang yang srid pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid gang yang srid pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of cause should be understood as the cause that deposits the latent impressions of existence.

original: yang srid pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa ni bsdu na rgyu'o //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa ni bsdu na rgyu'o //
translated: The cause that deposits the latent impressions of existence is, in brief, the cause.

original: kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang sems can bag chags bsags pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang der kun 'byung ba'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir /üîΩkun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gang sems can bag chags bsags pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang der kun 'byung ba'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir / kun 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of origination is to be known as the origination of the accumulation of the latent impressions of beings in that and that class of beings, because it is the active cause of origination.

original: sems can bag chags bsags pa rnams lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi rus su de'i cha byad dang rang bzhin 'drar bar mthun pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya pa ni kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can bag chags bsags pa rnams lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi rus su de'i cha byad dang rang bzhin 'drar bar mthun pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya pa ni kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The active cause of the accumulation of the latent impressions of beings in the class of beings such as gods, etc., is called origination, because it is the active cause of the conformity of the form and nature of those beings to the form and nature of the gods, etc.

original: rab tu skye ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: rab tu skye ba'i mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of appearance?

original: so sor rang dang / rnam pa dang / mchog tu 'byung ba'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir rab tu skye ba'i mtshan nyid du blta'o //
analyzed: so sor rang dang / rnam pa dang / mchog tu 'byung ba'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir rab tu skye ba'i mtshan nyid du blta'o //
translated: The characteristic of appearance should be understood as the active cause of the appearance of the individual, the aspect, and the manifestation.

original: so sor rang gi rgyud nges pa dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa la rnam pa du mar rab tu 'byung ba srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gro ba'i bar du 'byung ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: so sor rang gi rgyud nges pa dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa la rnam pa du mar rab tu 'byung ba srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gro ba'i bar du 'byung ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: The specific nature of each continuum, and the arising in many forms, such as in the destinies and places of rebirth, up to the peak of cyclic existence, is called the productive cause.

original: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gang /
analyzed: rkyen gyi mtshan nyid gang /
translated: What is the characteristic of condition?

original: gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa dang / 'da' ba'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen gyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa dang / 'da' ba'i byed rgyu yin pa'i phyir rkyen gyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the characteristic of condition because it is the cause of obtaining another and another, and the cause of the passing away of what has been obtained.

original: sngon ma byung ba'i lus gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa dang / sngon thob pa'i lus 'da' ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rkyen to //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba'i lus gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa dang / sngon thob pa'i lus 'da' ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rkyen to //
translated: The cause of obtaining another and another body that has not yet arisen, and the cause of the passing away of the body that has been obtained, is called condition.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rnam par nges pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
translated: The Determination of the Truth of Origination is completed.

original: // /'gog pa'i bden pa gang /
analyzed: // /'gog pa'i bden pa gang /
translated: What is the truth of cessation?

original: mtshan nyid dang / zab pa dang / brda dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / zab pa dang / brda dang / don dam pa dang / yongs su ma rdzogs pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rgyan med pa dang / rgyan dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med pa dang /
translated: by its profundity, by its conventional expressions, by its ultimate reality, by its incompleteness, by its completeness, by its lack of adornment, by its adornment, by its remainder, and by its lack of remainder.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rnam grangs kyis kyang 'gog pa'i bden par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa dang / rnam grangs kyis kyang 'gog pa'i bden par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known by its superiority and by its synonyms.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ji lta bu /
translated: How by its characteristics?

original: de bzhin nyid dang / lam dang / nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / lam dang / nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is cessation by its suchness, by its path, and by its non-arising of the addictions.

original: gang du 'gog pa dang / gang gis 'gog pa dang / gang 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang du 'gog pa dang / gang gis 'gog pa dang / gang 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is cessation in that it is the cessation of something, by that by which it is caused to cease, and that which ceases.üîΩAs the Lord has said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gang du mig @211b dang rna ba dang // de bzhin sna dang lce dang lus //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar gang du mig @211b dang rna ba dang // de bzhin sna dang lce dang lus //
translated: ‚ÄúHere the eye, the ear, and likewise the nose, the tongue, the body,

original: yid dang de bzhin ming dang gzugs //
analyzed: yid dang de bzhin ming dang gzugs //
translated: the mind, and likewise name-and-form

original: ma lus par ni 'gag par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus par ni 'gag par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: cease without remainder.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang gsungs pa gang du mig 'gags pa dang / kha dog gi 'du shes med par 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi bar du 'gags pa dang / chos kyi 'du shes med par 'gyur ba de ni gnas su rig par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gsungs pa gang du mig 'gags pa dang / kha dog gi 'du shes med par 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi bar du 'gags pa dang / chos kyi 'du shes med par 'gyur ba de ni gnas su rig par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said: ‚ÄúWhere the eye ceases and the perception of form is absent, up to where phenomena cease and the perception of phenomena is absent, that should be known as the basis.‚Äù

original: rnam grangs 'dis ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa gang du zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa gang du zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: By this enumeration, the object of observation of suchness is the cessation of contaminated things, which is characterized as a non-entity.

original: gang gis 'gog pa dang / gang du 'gog pa dang / gang 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'gog pa dang / gang du 'gog pa dang / gang 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of that which is to be ceased, by which it is to be ceased, and where it is to be ceased.

original: zab pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: zab pas ji lta bu /
translated: How is it profound?

original: 'du byed de dag gis 'jig pa las 'gog pa gzhan par mi bya /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag gis 'jig pa las 'gog pa gzhan par mi bya /
translated: It is not made to be other than the destruction of those compounded phenomena.

original: gzhan ma yin par yang mi bya /üîΩgzhan yang ma yin /üîΩgzhan ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin par yang mi bya / gzhan yang ma yin / gzhan ma yin /
translated: It is not made to be non-other.üîΩIt is not made to be both other and non-other.

original: gzhan ma yin pa'ang ma yin par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa'ang ma yin par yang mi bya'o //
translated: It is not made to be neither other nor non-other.

original: gal te ci'i rgyu 'du byed de dag gis 'jig pa las 'gog pa de gzhan zhig yin na de 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: gal te ci'i rgyu 'du byed de dag gis 'jig pa las 'gog pa de gzhan zhig yin na de 'brel ba med do //
translated: If the cessation of those compounded phenomena due to their destruction were other, it would be unrelated.

original: de don gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de don gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be a different object.

original: ci ste gzhan ma yin na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan ma yin na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not different, it would have the characteristic of defilement.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is neither of the two.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not even that it is neither of the two.

original: de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?

original: spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from conceptual elaboration.

original: spros pa ni yang 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin par don la sems pa ste /
analyzed: spros pa ni yang 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin par don la sems pa ste /
translated: Conceptual elaboration here means the improper consideration of an object.

original: lam ma yin pa dang / rigs ma yin pa dang / thabs ma yin pa dang / sems pa zhes bya ba ni don to //
analyzed: lam ma yin pa dang / rigs ma yin pa dang / thabs ma yin pa dang / sems pa zhes bya ba ni don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúimproper consideration‚Äù is ‚Äúa path that is not a path, a reasoning that is not reasoning, a method that is not a method.üîΩThe Blessed One said, ‚ÄúThe other is the cessation, pacification, and exhaustion of the six sense-spheres of cognition.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar rig pa'i skye mched drug po dag zad pa dang / rnam par zhig pa dang / 'gog pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nus pa las gzhan yod do zhe na /üîΩspros pa med pa spros par byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar rig pa'i skye mched drug po dag zad pa dang / rnam par zhig pa dang / 'gog pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nus pa las gzhan yod do zhe na / spros pa med pa spros par byed do //
translated: ‚Äù One who says ‚Äúthe other exists‚Äù elaborates on what is free from elaboration.

original: gzhan med do zhe'am /üîΩyod kyang yod la med kyang med do zhe'am /üîΩgzhan yod pa'ang ma yin /üîΩmed pa'ang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan med do zhe'am / yod kyang yod la med kyang med do zhe'am / gzhan yod pa'ang ma yin / med pa'ang ma yin zhe na /
translated: One who says ‚Äúthe other does not exist‚Äù elaborates on what is free from elaboration.üîΩOne who says ‚Äúthe other both exists and does not exist‚Äù elaborates on what is free from elaboration.

original: yang spros pa med pa spros par byed do //
analyzed: yang spros pa med pa spros par byed do //
translated: One who says ‚Äúthe other neither exists nor does not exist‚Äù elaborates on what is free from elaboration.

original: ji srid du de skye mched drug yod pa de srid du spros pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid du de skye mched drug yod pa de srid du spros pa'o //
translated: As long as the six sense-spheres exist, there is conceptual proliferation.

original: skye mched drug 'gag pas spros pa med pa ste myu ngan las 'das par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pas spros pa med pa ste myu ngan las 'das par gsungs pa'o //
translated: When the six sense-spheres cease, there is no conceptual proliferation, which is called nirvana.

original: de ltar spros pa med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar spros pa med pa mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Thus, the absence of conceptual proliferation is nirvana.

original: spros pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems ba yin no //
analyzed: spros pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa sems ba yin no //
translated: Conceptual proliferation is incorrect mental activity.

original: sems pa gang gzhan la /
analyzed: sems pa gang gzhan la /
translated: What is the other mental activity?

original: sems par bya ba yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems par bya ba yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mental activity that is different from the former.

original: sems pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the mental activity that is like it?

original: zhi ba dang gya nom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhi ba dang gya nom pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams so //
translated: It is the mental activity that has the aspects of peace, excellence, etc.

original: brdas ji lta bu /
analyzed: brdas ji lta bu /
translated: What is the mental activity that is like a conventional symbol?

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sa bon nyams smad pas 'gog pa gang yin pa ste /üîΩde'i phyir bcom ldan @212a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi sa bon nyams smad pas 'gog pa gang yin pa ste / de'i phyir bcom ldan @212a * //
translated: It is the cessation that results from the weakening of the seeds of the mundane path.

original: 'das kyis de'i rnam grangs su de'i cha shas kyi mya ngan las 'das par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'das kyis de'i rnam grangs su de'i cha shas kyi mya ngan las 'das par gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Lord has declared it to be a partial nirvana.

original: don dam bas ji lta bu /
analyzed: don dam bas ji lta bu /
translated: What is the mental activity that is like the ultimate?

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi sa bon kun du bcom pas 'gog pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi sa bon kun du bcom pas 'gog pa yang yin no //
translated: It is the cessation that results from the complete destruction of the seeds of the holy wisdom.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pas ji lta bu /üîΩrgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'am /üîΩlan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pas ji lta bu / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'am / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'am /
translated: What is incomplete?üîΩIt is the cessation of those in training, included in the fruit of the stream-enterer,üîΩor in the fruit of the once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'ang rung ste /üîΩslob pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bur bsdus pa'ang rung ste / slob pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: or in the fruit of the non-returner.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa gang /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa gang /
translated: What is complete?

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩrgyan med pa ji lta bu shes rab kyi rnam par grol pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bur bsdus pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o // rgyan med pa ji lta bu shes rab kyi rnam par grol pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of those beyond training, included in the fruit of the perfected being.üîΩWhat is without adornment?

original: rigs pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i rgyan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cessation of those who are liberated through wisdom, i.e., of those perfected beings who are not provided with the adornments of the higher qualities.

original: rgyan dang bcas pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: rgyan dang bcas pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is with adornment?

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol bar rig pa gsum dang mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol bar rig pa gsum dang mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa'i dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cessation of those who are liberated through both parts, i.e., of those perfected beings who are provided with the adornments of the higher qualities.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is it with a remainder?

original: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cessation with a remainder of aggregates.

original: lhag ma med pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: lhag ma med pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is it without a remainder?

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is cessation without a remainder of aggregates.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa ji lta bu /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa ji lta bu /
translated: What is it that is distinguished?

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa ste sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas bsdus pa'i 'gog pa gang yin pa ste sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cessation included in the Nirvana without a remainder of aggregates, which is realized by the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, because it is the basis for the benefit and happiness of all beings.

original: rnam grangs kyis ji lta bu /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis ji lta bu /
translated: What is it by way of synonyms?

original: ma lus par spangs pa dang / nges par spangs pa dang / byang bar 'gyur ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / nub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus par spangs pa dang / nges par spangs pa dang / byang bar 'gyur ba dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / nub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is abandonment, relinquishment, purification, destruction, detachment, cessation, appeasement, and disappearance.

original: ci'i phyir ma lus par spangs pa tshig lhag ma rnams kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma lus par spangs pa tshig lhag ma rnams kyi phyir ro //
translated: Why is it abandonment? Because of the remainder of the aggregates.

original: ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving abandoned them without remainder‚Äù is the teaching.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the remainder of those words.‚Äù

original: de dag gis de bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they explain that.

original: ji ltar byas nas ma lus par spangs she na ;
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas ma lus par spangs she na ;
translated: How is it that they are abandoned without remainder?

original: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entanglements and the latent dispositions are abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir nges par spangs pa kun nas dkris pa por ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par spangs pa kun nas dkris pa por ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is the abandonment certain? Because the entanglements are abandoned.

original: kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: It is based on the entanglements.

original: 'byung ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the occurrence is abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir byang bar 'gyur ba bag la nyal mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang bar 'gyur ba bag la nyal mthar phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it purified? Because the latent dispositions are brought to an end.

original: bag @212b nyal ba spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bag @212b nyal ba spangs pa ste /
translated: It is the abandonment of the latent dispositions.

original: rtsa ba med na gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba med na gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the root is cut, they will not arise again.

original: ci'i phyir zad pa de ni gnyen po mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zad pa de ni gnyen po mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Why is that extinction established as twofold by the specific distinction of the path of vision and the path of cultivation?

original: zag pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called extinction and separation from passion.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ci'i phyir zad pa gnyen po mthong ba'i lam gyis bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde la zad pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zad pa gnyen po mthong ba'i lam gyis bral ba'i phyir ro // de la zad pa ni /
translated: Why is extinction the result of the path of vision? Because it is the separation from the passions.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa nyon mongs pa'i tshig cung zad tsam lus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩci'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa nyon mongs pa'i tshig cung zad tsam lus pa'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: In this regard, extinction is taken as the separation from the passions by the path of vision, because even a small amount of the words of the passions remain.üîΩWhy is separation from passion the result of the path of cultivation?

original: gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam gyis bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa'i lam gyis bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the separation from the passions.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Separation from passion is taken as the separation from the passions by the path of cultivation,

original: de ni sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished as the separation from passion for the stages.

original: de gnyis kyi 'bras bur gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'bras bur gyur pa ni /
translated: The result of those two is:

original: yang phyi ma la sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang phyi ma la sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: And later, suffering will cease.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ci'i phyir 'gog pa phyi ma la de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ci'i phyir 'gog pa phyi ma la de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, why is cessation said to be later? Because it is the result of that path, since suffering is not produced.

original: ma skyes pa ni skye ba med pa'i chos nyid du byas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni skye ba med pa'i chos nyid du byas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the non-arisen is made into the nature of non-arising.

original: mthong ba'i chos la yid mi bde ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la yid mi bde ba nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because mental dissatisfaction is pacified in this life.

original: de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas nas gsung pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dbang du byas nas gsung pa /
translated: Therefore, in this regard, it is said:

original: ci'i phyir rnam par zhi ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par zhi ba /
translated: Why is it peace?

original: mthong ba'i chos la de'i 'bras bu sems kyi sdug bsngal rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la de'i 'bras bu sems kyi sdug bsngal rgyu ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in this life, the result of that, the suffering of the mind, does not arise.

original: ci'i phyir nus pa phung po lhag ma rnams 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nus pa phung po lhag ma rnams 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it power? Because the remaining aggregates are destroyed.

original: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phung po rnams ni rang gi dang gis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phung po rnams ni rang gi dang gis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aggregates that are fully accomplished by former karma and afflictions are destroyed by their own nature.

original: de ltar byas na ma lus pa spangs par bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na ma lus pa spangs par bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the teaching of complete abandonment is made in this way.

original: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dus byas las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro // 'dus byas las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Why is it free from the three characteristics?üîΩBecause it is the opposite of the conditioned.

original: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free from origination, destruction, and duration.üîΩWhy is it difficult to see?

original: ci'i phyir blta dka' ba sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig gi spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir blta dka' ba sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig gi spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is beyond the range of the fleshly eye and the divine eye.

original: 'phags pa kho na'i shes rab kyi spyan gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa kho na'i shes rab kyi spyan gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the domain of the eye of wisdom of the noble ones.üîΩWhy is it unmoving?

original: ci'i phyir g-yo ba med pa 'gro 'pho dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir g-yo ba med pa 'gro 'pho dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from going and coming.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar mi 'pho bas brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar mi 'pho bas brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stable because it does not go to the realms of hell and so forth.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'dud pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'dud pa /
translated: Why is it not bent?

original: srid pa gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa gsum dang bral ba'i phyir ro //

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa med pas mi 'dud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa med pas mi 'dud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not bent because it is free from the existences of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: ci'i phyir 'chi ba med pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'chi ba med pa /
translated: Why is it immortal?

original: @213a * // phung po'i bdud dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @213a * // phung po'i bdud dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the demon of the aggregates.

original: 'chi ba'i rten phung po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i rten phung po med pa'i phyir ro //

original: zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis of the joy of liberation.üîΩWhy is it the absence of the defilement of birth? Because it is the basis of the severance from the three realms.üîΩBecause it is like a dry land out of the great ocean of cyclic existence.

original: ci'i phyir gling khams gsum yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir gling khams gsum yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it the absence of the defilement of retribution? Because it is the basis of the severance from the three realms.

analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po las thang lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is like a dry land out of the great ocean of cyclic existence.üîΩWhy is it the absence of the defilement of retribution? Because it is the basis of the severance from the three realms.

analyzed: ci'i phyir dpung gnyen 'phags pa'i mchog nyid du 'gro ba'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it the supreme refuge? Because it is the basis for going to the supreme state of the noble ones.
