analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa'i thabs la dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: ci'i phyir 'chi 'pho med pa skye ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //

original: ma skyes pas nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pas nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not born, it is free from destruction.

original: ci'i phyir rims nad med pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rims nad med pa /
translated: Why is it free from disease?

original: 'dod pas phongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from all the sufferings of desire.

original: 'dod pas phongs pa'i gdung ba bcom nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa'i gdung ba bcom nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it destroys the burning of the suffering of desire.

original: ci'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yongs su gdung ba med pa /
translated: Why is it free from distress?

original: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: mya ngan la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rgyun chad pas bsil ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rgyun chad pas bsil ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cool because it is the cessation of all the torments of sorrow, etc.

original: ci'i phyir bde ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bde ba /
translated: Why is it happiness?

original: 'jigs pa med par gnas pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par gnas pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the abode of fearlessness.

original: na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral bas 'phags pa gnas pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral bas 'phags pa gnas pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the abode of the noble ones because it is free from the fear of sickness, old age, and death.

original: ci'i phyir zhi ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhi ba /
translated: Why is it peace?

original: phan pa'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa'i dngos po'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of benefit.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of all virtuous things.

original: ci'i phyir bde ba'i gzhi don dam pa'i bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bde ba'i gzhi don dam pa'i bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it the basis of happiness? It is the basis of ultimate happiness.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa thams cad kyi bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the happiness of all supramundane things.

original: ci'i phyir dge bar 'gyur ba /üîΩsbyor ba bde bas de thob pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dge bar 'gyur ba / sbyor ba bde bas de thob pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it virtue?üîΩIt is the basis of the attainment of happiness through practice.

original: sbyor ba bde bas de 'thob par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba bde bas de 'thob par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the object of the attainment of happiness through practice.

original: ci'i phyir @213b nad med pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir @213b nad med pa /
translated: Why is it health?

original: sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from all obscurations.

original: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the obscurations of the afflictions, etc.

original: ci'i phyir mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi g-yo ba /
translated: Why is it unshakable?

original: g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from all distraction.

original: yul gyi spros pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gyi spros pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from all distraction of proliferation concerning objects.

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa /
translated: Why is it nirvana?

original: mtshan ma med cing zhi la bde bar gnas pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing zhi la bde bar gnas pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro // gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral te /
translated: Because it is the basis for the state of peace and bliss that is free from signs.

original: zhi zhing bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi zhing bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the state of peace and bliss that is free from all discriminations of form, etc.

original: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa la brtsams nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams te /
analyzed: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa la brtsams nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams te /
translated: Moreover, the synonyms of non-production, etc. are based on the truth of cessation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the opposite of the characteristics of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ni sems can gyi ris de dang / der nyid mtshams sbyor bar byas pas skye ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sems can gyi ris de dang / der nyid mtshams sbyor bar byas pas skye ba'o //
translated: Suffering is the birth of sentient beings in that and that realm of existence, due to the linking of consciousness at death with rebirth.

original: de las bzlog par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las bzlog par gsungs pa /
translated: The opposite of that is stated:

original: ci'i phyir ma skyes pa nying mtshams sbyor ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma skyes pa nying mtshams sbyor ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it unborn? Because it is free from the linking of consciousness at death with rebirth.

original: sdug bsngal ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na lus yongs su rdzogs par 'phel lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni nying mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na lus yongs su rdzogs par 'phel lo //
translated: Suffering is the growth of the body to completion at the time of linking with rebirth.

original: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
translated: The opposite of that is stated:

original: ci'i phyir ma byung ba /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma byung ba /
translated: Why is it non-arisen?

original: de'i 'og tu byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the arising of that.

original: sdug bsngal ba de yang sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs te byas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba de yang sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs te byas so //
translated: Moreover, that suffering is created by previous karma and afflictions that have been projected.

original: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
translated: The opposite of that is stated:

original: ci'i phyir ma byas pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma byas pa /
translated: Why is it uncreated?

original: sngon gyi mtha'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'phen pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'phen pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the projection of karma and afflictions in the past.

original: sdug bsngal de yang las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi srid pa gzhan du byed pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyi srid pa gzhan du byed pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That suffering is also the basis for the creation of other existences by karma and afflictions.

original: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
translated: The opposite of that is stated.

original: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dus ma byas /
translated: Why is it unconditioned?

original: da ltar nyon mongs pa las 'dus mi byed pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar nyon mongs pa las 'dus mi byed pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for not being conditioned by the afflictions in the present.

original: de'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul gyis yang srid pa'i rgyun skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul gyis yang srid pa'i rgyun skye bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the arising of the continuum of rebirth through the mode of its uninterrupted continuum.

original: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa gsungs pa /
translated: The opposite of that is stated.

original: ci'i phyir skye ba med pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir skye ba med pa /
translated: Why is it non-arisen?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu 'byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu 'byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the arising of future causes.

original: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang go rims ltar ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / skye ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa dang go rims ltar ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / skye ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The cessation of suffering should be known as the noble truth of cessation, in order, as non-arisen, non-occurring, uncreated, unconditioned, and non-arisen.

original: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the characteristic of the truth of cessation should be known as fourfold:

original: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dang / gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of cessation, the characteristic of peace, the characteristic of excellence, and the characteristic of escape.

original: ci'i phyir 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid dang / nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from the afflictions.

original: @214a * // 'byung ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: @214a * // 'byung ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is from the perspective of being free from the afflictions, which are the causes of origination.

original: ci'i phyir zhi ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhi ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Why is it characterized as peace?

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from suffering.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is from the perspective of being free from the appropriated aggregates, which are characterized by nonpeace due to the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: ci'i phyir gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Why is it characterized as sublime?

original: gtsang ba dang bde ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyo / mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtsang ba dang bde ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro // nyo / mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a state of purity and bliss.

original: bdag nyid gtsang ba dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gtsang ba dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is from the perspective of being a state of purity and bliss for oneself, because it is free from the afflictions and suffering.

original: ci'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid /
translated: Why is it characterized as definite emergence?

original: rtag pa dang phan pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang phan pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the state of permanence and benefit.

original: rtag pa dang / phan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / phan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste //
translated: and the nature of benefit.

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa dang bde ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa dang bde ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is irreversible and blissful,

original: phan pa dang / dge ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: phan pa dang / dge ba dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: it is beneficial, virtuous, and sequential.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam par nges pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa rnam par nges pa rdzogs so /
translated: The ascertainment of the truth of cessation is complete.

original: // / lam gyi bden pa gang yin /
analyzed: // / lam gyi bden pa gang yin /
translated: What is the truth of the path?

original: lam gang gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung spong ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du byed pa dang / lam sgom pa ste /
analyzed: lam gang gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung spong ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du byed pa dang / lam sgom pa ste /
translated: The path by which one fully understands suffering, abandons the origin, manifests cessation, and cultivates the path.

original: 'di ni lam gyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lam gyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the concise definition of the path.

original: bden pa rnams la 'di'i bya ba'i skabs kyis mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la 'di'i bya ba'i skabs kyis mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The definition of the truths should be understood according to their function.

original: yang lam rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang lam rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, the path is of five kinds:

original: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar phyin pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: tshogs kyi lam dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam dang / mthar phyin pa'i lam mo //

original: lam rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba'i skabs kyis so //
analyzed: lam rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba'i skabs kyis so //
translated: The so-called five kinds of paths is according to the classification.

original: rab tu dbye ba 'di yang lam gyi bden pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i skabs kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba 'di yang lam gyi bden pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i skabs kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: This classification should be understood as referring to the path of preparation together with its retinue.

original: de la tshogs kyi lam gang so so'i skye bo'i tshul khrims dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdoms pa dang / zas kyi tshod shes pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi lam gang so so'i skye bo'i tshul khrims dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdoms pa dang / zas kyi tshod shes pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang /

analyzed: shes bzhin du gnas par mngon par dga' ba'o //

analyzed: yang gang rgyu mthun pa'i dge ba gzhan dang / thos pa las byung ba dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyang ste /

analyzed: de bsgoms pas mngon par rtogs pa dang / rnam par thar par 'gyur ba'i gnas kyi snod nyid thob par 'gyur ro //

original: sems kyi rgyud 'os su gyur pa 'thob ces pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud 'os su gyur pa 'thob ces pa'o //

original: sbyor ba'i lam gang /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gang /

analyzed: tshogs kyi gang yin pa sbyor ba'i yang de yin no //

original: dro bar gyur pa gang /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa gang /

original: mthong ba'i lam gang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gang /
translated: What is the Path of Seeing?

analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam @215a * // par shes pa'ang de yin te /

translated: It is also the knowledge of the object that is the manifestation of the conventional symbols of sentient beings and of the Dharma, because it is the knowledge of the object that is the manifestation of both symbols everywhere.

original: so so rang la sems can gyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: so so rang la sems can gyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /

translated: What is Dharma knowledge that focuses on the clear manifestation of the Dharma in one's own mind? It is Dharma knowledge that is nonconceptual regarding the signs of form and so on in one's own mindstream.

original: thams cad du gnyi ga'i brda'i gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad du gnyi ga'i brda'i gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /

analyzed: thams cad du bye brag med par bdag dang chos shes pa'i chos kyi mtshan ma la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is Dharma knowledge that is nonconceptual regarding the signs of both the self and phenomena in all without differentiation.

analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos gang /

analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i mdo la sogs pa'i chos la rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la de bzhin
translated: It is subsumed by the correct mental contemplation that analyzes the Dharma of the sutras and so on that are related to the truth of suffering.

analyzed: de bas na de rnams sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes de ltar bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa gang /

original: dang po bzod pa dang rjes su rtogs par shes pa 'di gnyis ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /üîΩde la de yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu'o zhes de la dmigs nas so so rang la mngon sum du gyur ba'i zag pa med pa'i shas rab ni sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i bzod pa zhes brjod do //

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa gang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa gang /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag drug pa bka' stsal ba /

analyzed: gang mthong ba'i lam las brtsams te /

analyzed: de la rnam par gzhag pa ni / nyan thos la sogs pa ji ltar rang gi khong du chud pa mthar phyin nas /

analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas gzhan dag la go bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bden pa rnams la bzod pa dang / shes pa ni 'di lta bu'o zhes @216b bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Conception is as follows:

translated: The wheel of Dharma is threefold,üîΩhaving the nature of teaching, understanding, and practice.üîΩThe wheel of Dharma is threefold:üîΩthe wheel of teaching, the wheel of understanding, and the wheel of practice.üîΩThe wheel of teaching is the first turning of the wheel of Dharma, which is the four truths.üîΩThe wheel of understanding is the second turning of the wheel of Dharma, which is the absence of characteristics.üîΩThe wheel of practice is the third turning of the wheel of Dharma, which is the differentiation of the very subtle and very extensive topics of the three natures, the eight consciousnesses, the two kinds of selflessness, and so on.

analyzed: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis ni rdul med de /

translated: Because they abandon the dust of the afflictions.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyis ni dri ma dang bral te /
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyis ni dri ma dang bral te /

analyzed: rdul med pa dang / rdul dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known as the path of purification, as the S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThe path of purification is the path of seeing.‚Äù

original: chos mthong ba /
analyzed: chos mthong ba /
translated: One sees the Dharma,

original: chos thob pa /üîΩchos rig pa //
analyzed: chos thob pa / chos rig pa //
translated: one obtains the Dharma,üîΩone knows the Dharma,

original: chos rtogs pa //üîΩsom nyi las brgal ba /
analyzed: chos rtogs pa // som nyi las brgal ba /
translated: one penetrates the Dharma,üîΩone crosses over doubt,

original: the tshom las brgal ba /
analyzed: the tshom las brgal ba /
translated: one crosses over uncertainty,

original: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa /
translated: one is not dependent on others,

original: ston pa'i bstan pa las gzhan gyis mi bkri'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa las gzhan gyis mi bkri'o //
translated: one is not led by others.

original: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa zhes gang gsungs pa de yang mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa zhes gang gsungs pa de yang mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúOne obtains fearlessness with regard to the Dharma,‚Äù is also made from the perspective of the path of seeing,

original: 'dul ba rnams bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i 'og tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i 'og tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated immediately after the passage on the clear realization of the truths.

original: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis chos mthong ngo //
translated: With the acceptances of the Dharma, one sees the Dharma.

original: de dag gi de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one realizes thatness.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyis chos 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyis chos 'thob bo //
translated: Those who know the teaching obtain the teaching.

original: de rnams kyi gnas gyur pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes su @217a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gnas gyur pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro // rjes su @217a * //
translated: Because they manifest the transformation of those.

original: rtogs pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rig go //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rig go //
translated: By subsequent acceptance, one knows the teaching.

original: de dag gis 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu'o zhes de gnyis rig pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de dag gis 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu'o zhes de gnyis rig pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because by those two, one knows that this is the cause of the noble teaching.

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis chos rtogs so //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa rnams kyis chos rtogs so //
translated: By subsequent knowledge, one realizes the teaching.

original: de dag gi shes bya ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi shes bya ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one completely perfects the knowable objects of those.

original: thams cad kyis rang gi chos thob pa la som nyi las brgal to //
analyzed: thams cad kyis rang gi chos thob pa la som nyi las brgal to //
translated: By all, one crosses over doubt regarding one's own attainment of the teaching.

original: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las brgal te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las brgal te /
translated: By all acceptance and knowledge, one crosses over doubt.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pas yun ring po nas 'dod pa rang gis thob pa la the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob pas yun ring po nas 'dod pa rang gis thob pa la the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is free from doubt regarding one's own attainment of the desired for a long time, by obtaining it through the supramundane path.

original: thams cad kyis gzhan gyis thob pa la the tshom las brgal to //
analyzed: thams cad kyis gzhan gyis thob pa la the tshom las brgal to //
translated: By all, one crosses over doubt regarding others' attainment.

original: de'i dus na gzhan gyis khyad par thob pa la yang yid gnyis za ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus na gzhan gyis khyad par thob pa la yang yid gnyis za ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, there is no doubt about the attainment of distinction by others.

original: lam bsgom pa la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog go //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa la gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog go //
translated: One is not led by others in the cultivation of the path.

original: gzhan las lung du mnos pa med pa yang bdag nyid mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las lung du mnos pa med pa yang bdag nyid mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is not dependent on others for the oral transmission of the scriptures, because one is learned by oneself.

original: mu stegs can rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ston pa'i bstan pa dag gzhan gyis mi bkri'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ston pa'i bstan pa dag gzhan gyis mi bkri'o //
translated: One is not led by others in the teaching of the Master, because one is not carried away by the tirthikas.

original: shes nas dad pa thob pas gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis tshe rabs gzhan la yang ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes nas dad pa thob pas gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis tshe rabs gzhan la yang ston pa'i bstan pa la mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One obtains faith through knowledge, and thus one is not carried away by other tirthikas in other lives.

original: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni yongs su dri ba'i chos dang lung du bstan pa'i chos ni 'dir chos su 'dod do //üîΩsems zhum pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob pa ni yongs su dri ba'i chos dang lung du bstan pa'i chos ni 'dir chos su 'dod do // sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The attainment of fearlessness with regard to the Dharma is the attainment of fearlessness with regard to the Dharma of questions and the Dharma of replies, which are considered here to be the Dharma.

original: de la mi 'jigs pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: One obtains fearlessness with regard to that, because one's mind is not depressed.

original: thob pa las yongs su dri ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams dang / sdig pa 'dod pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa las yongs su dri ba'i chos rnams dang / lung du bstan pa'i chos rnams dang / sdig pa 'dod pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the factors conducive to penetrative insight, the factors conducive to determination of the teachings, and the factors conducive to decisiveness are absent in the path of cultivation, as is the desire to commit evil and the pride of one who has attained.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gang /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gang /
translated: What is the path of cultivation?

original: mthong ba'i lam las gong du gyur pa 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / lam chung ngu dang / lam 'bring po dang / lam chen po dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / bar chad med pa'i lam dang /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las gong du gyur pa 'jig rten pa'i lam dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dang / lam chung ngu dang / lam 'bring po dang / lam chen po dang / sbyor ba'i lam dang / bar chad med pa'i lam dang /
translated: It is the path that is higher than the path of vision, namely, the mundane path, the supramundane path, the weak path, the medium path, the strong path, the path of application, the immediate path,

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam dang / khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: the path of liberation, and the special path.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The noble disciple who has attained the realization of the truths,

original: de'i gong du gyur pa ni kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma spang ba'i phyir zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gong du gyur pa ni kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma spang ba'i phyir zhugs pa ste /
translated: and who, higher than that, is engaged in the relinquishment of the residues associated with the fetters,

original: gang 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam zhes brjod do //
translated: is said to be on the path of cultivation, whether he is on the mundane or supramundane path, the weak, medium, or strong path, the path of application, the immediate path,üîΩthe path of liberation, or the special path.

original: de la 'jig rten ba'i lam gang /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten ba'i lam gang /
translated: What is the mundane path?

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye @217b mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye @217b mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched de /
translated: The mundane concentrations are the first, second, third, and fourth concentrations, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: These concentrations and formless states should be understood in terms of their defilement, their purification, their establishment, and their complete purity.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu /
translated: How are they defiled?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po srid pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po srid pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: The four unwholesome roots are the roots of defilement: craving for existence, false view, conceit, and ignorance.

original: de dag ni sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bsam gtan gyi sgo nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bsam gtan gyi sgo nas gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsgribs pa'i lung du ma bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: These are the afflicted meditative stabilizations of those whose minds are afflicted, because all the afflictions and secondary afflictions of the form and formless realms are obscured neutral states.

original: de la sred pas ni ro myang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: de la sred pas ni ro myang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: Among them, craving afflicts through the affliction of relishing.

original: shin tu sbyong ba'i bde ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyong ba'i bde ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one relishes the pleasure of purification.

original: lta bas ni lta ba'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: lta bas ni lta ba'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: View afflicts through the meditative stabilization of the predominance of view.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one generates views such as the investigation of the prior limit in dependence on meditative stabilization.

original: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Pride afflicts through the meditative stabilization of the predominance of pride.

original: des khyad par thob nas khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des khyad par thob nas khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having attained a special state, he becomes proud.

original: ma rig pas ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: ma rig pas ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: By ignorance, the one who is devoted to meditation is defiled by the predominance of doubt.

original: de kho na ma gtogs pas thar par 'dod pa khyad par de thob pa la thar pa yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ma gtogs pas thar par 'dod pa khyad par de thob pa la thar pa yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, having attained that special state, he doubts whether it is liberation or not.

original: de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dag la gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dag la gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the defilements of the mind are the defilements of the realms of form and the formless.

original: rnam par byang bas ji lta bu /
analyzed: rnam par byang bas ji lta bu /
translated: What is purification?

original: dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The pure meditations and formless attainments are called purification because they are wholesome.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And also because they are free from the stain of the envelopers.

original: rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
translated: What is definition?

original: yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pas rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: 1. classification of the members, 2. classification of the meditative attainment, 3. classification of the dimensions, 4. classification of the designations.

original: bsam gtan rnams ji snyed pa de ltar bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ji snyed pa de ltar bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The absorptions are established as four in number

original: yan lag dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / tshad dang / ming du gdags pas phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / tshad dang / ming du gdags pas phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are distinguished by their members, meditative attainment, dimensions, and designations.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni yan lag ma gtogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni yan lag ma gtogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The formless are distinguished by three, excluding the members.

original: yan lag rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /üîΩbsam gtan @218a * //
analyzed: yan lag rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu / bsam gtan @218a * //
translated: How are they distinguished by their members?

original: dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The first absorption has five members.

original: yan lag lnga ni /
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni /
translated: The five members are

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yang yan lag bzhi ste yan lag bzhi ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yang yan lag bzhi ste yan lag bzhi ni /
translated: The second absorption has four members. The four members are

original: nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: inner clarity, joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la yang yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la yang yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The third meditative absorption has five branches:

original: yan lag lnga ni btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag lnga ni btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The five branches are equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, pleasure, and singlepointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yang yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth meditative absorption has four branches:

original: yan lag bzhi ni /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ni /
translated: The four branches are

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, and singlepointedness of mind.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas chos gzhan dag kyang yod bzhin du rtog pa la sogs pa kho na mtha' gcig tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas chos gzhan dag kyang yod bzhin du rtog pa la sogs pa kho na mtha' gcig tu rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: In terms of what, are investigation and so on posited as branches of the first meditative absorption alone, even though other phenomena also exist there?

original: de tsam gyi gnyen po dang / phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyi gnyen po dang / phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the branches are complete in terms of the antidote to that much, the benefit of that much, and the basis of both of those.

original: de ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: gnyen po'i yan lag dang / phan yon gyi yan lag dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i yan lag dang / phan yon gyi yan lag dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag gi phyir ro //
translated: The limbs of antidotes, the limbs of benefits, and the limbs of the basis of both.

original: bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the first meditative stabilization, investigation and analysis are the limbs of antidotes because

original: de gnyis kyi 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they abandon the conception of desire, malice, and harm.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Joy and pleasure are the limbs of benefits

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyi gnyen po byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyi gnyen po byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one obtains the joy and pleasure that arise from the separation from those two, investigation and analysis, which are discordant with the antidotes.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni /
translated: One pointedness of mind

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag ste /
translated: is the limb of the basis of both.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis rtogs pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis rtogs pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one enters into investigation and so on by the power of depending on concentration.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: Similarly, in the second meditative stabilization, inner clarity is the limb of antidotes.

original: des rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it acts as the antidote to discursive thought and investigation.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis la snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis la snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind are the remaining three branches, as before.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la btang snyoms dang dran pa dang shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the third meditative absorption, equanimity, mindfulness, and introspection are the branches that are antidotes.

original: de dga' ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dga' ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they act as antidotes to joy.

original: bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: Pleasure and one-pointedness of mind are the remaining two branches, respectively.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the fourth meditative absorption, pure equanimity and pure mindfulness are the branches that are antidotes.

original: de @218b gnyis bde ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de @218b gnyis bde ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they act as antidotes to pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: Neither-pleasure-nor-displeasure is the branch that is a benefit.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag go //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the branch that is the basis of both.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni zhi gnas su ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni zhi gnas su ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: The formless meditative attainments are not distinguished by members, because they are of the same flavor as calm abiding.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par bzhag pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par bzhag pas ji lta bu /
translated: How are they distinguished by meditative attainment?

original: yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: One enters the first meditative attainment through seven attentions:

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: up to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: yid la byed pa bdun gang /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bdun gang /
translated: What are the seven attentions?

original: mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i mtha' dang sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i mtha' dang sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Attention that is knowledge of the characteristics, attention that arises from belief, attention that arises from seclusion, attention that is the gathering of joy, attention that is investigation, attention that is the culmination of application, and attention that is the result of the culmination of application.

original: ji ltar na bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bdun du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bdun du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are the seven attentions related to the first meditative attainment?

original: mnyam bar gzhag pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs la sogs par blta bas /
analyzed: mnyam bar gzhag pa'i yid la byed pa gang gis 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs la sogs par blta bas /
translated: The attention of one who is equipoised does not see the faults of the desire realm, etc.

original: rags pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par byed pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa'i mtshan nyid du rig par byed pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not see the coarseness of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rab tu rig ba mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rab tu rig ba mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attention of one who is equipoised sees the first meditative absorption as peaceful, and this is called the attention of one who is aware of the characteristics.

original: de'i thos pa dang / sems pa 'dres par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i thos pa dang / sems pa 'dres par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the combination of hearing and reflection.

original: de'i 'og tu thos pa dang / sems pa las 'das nas gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam par de'i rigs pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom zhing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu thos pa dang / sems pa las 'das nas gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam par de'i rigs pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom zhing /
translated: After that, one transcends hearing and reflection and cultivates the samƒÅdhi of serenity and insight that focuses on the sign of the coarseness and peacefulness that is the type of that meditative absorption.

original: yang yang ji ltar yongs su btsal bar rags pa dang zhi ba nyid du mos te //
analyzed: yang yang ji ltar yongs su btsal bar rags pa dang zhi ba nyid du mos te //
translated: Again and again, one cultivates the aspiration for coarseness and peacefulness just as they were investigated.

original: 'di ni mos pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the attention arisen from aspiration.

original: de goms pas thog ma kho nar spong ba'i lam dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni rab tu dben pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de goms pas thog ma kho nar spong ba'i lam dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni rab tu dben pa las byung ba ste /
translated: The attention that is endowed with the path of abandonment is the one that arises from isolation.

original: des nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po spangs pa yang de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po spangs pa yang de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By cultivating that, one first abandons the great class of afflictions, because one is free from the negative reflex actions of that class.

original: rnal 'byor ba de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: After that, the practitioner becomes delighted with abandonment.

original: spong ba la phan yon du blta ste /
analyzed: spong ba la phan yon du blta ste /
translated: He sees the benefits of abandonment.

original: rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chung dus reg pa dang / dus dus su dad par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas ji tsam du rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang bral bar byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba chung dus reg pa dang / dus dus su dad par 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pas ji tsam du rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang bral bar byas pa'i phyir /
translated: He is delighted by the joy and pleasure of isolation, by the small contact, and by the attention that is faith from time to time.

original: rab tu dga' bar byed pa 'di ni dga' bar sdud pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar byed pa 'di ni dga' bar sdud pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the one that gathers delight, because it delights in the abandonment of the great class of afflictions.üîΩThe practitioner who is thus well engaged in the path of abandonment is one who is endowed with the path of cultivation.

original: de ltar legs par zhugs pa de dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod @219a * //
analyzed: de ltar legs par zhugs pa de dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dod @219a * //
translated: He is one who is endowed with the path of cultivation, because he is engaged in the side of virtue.üîΩHe is one who is endowed with the path of cultivation, because he is engaged in the side of virtue.

original: pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba kun du mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba kun du mi 'byung bas /
translated: and the joy and pleasure of the afflictions of the desire realm do not arise.

original: de spangs sa ma ma spangs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de spangs sa ma ma spangs par khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand that they are abandoned, not merely suppressed,

original: 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid la byed pas so sor rtogs pa ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i sdug bsngal ba'i mtshan nyid la byed pas so sor rtogs pa ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: the attention of analysis is the attention of the antidote to the characteristics of suffering that is compatible with the arising of the first absorption.

original: des ni 'di ltar dpyad nas gnyen po bsgoms pas dus de srid cig pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: des ni 'di ltar dpyad nas gnyen po bsgoms pas dus de srid cig pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Through that, one analyzes and cultivates the antidote and in that way one becomes free of all the afflictions of the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa ni /
translated: The attention of the antidote that is the culmination of the preparation for the first absorption

original: sbyor ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mtha'o //
translated: is the culmination of preparation.

original: de'i 'og tu dngos gzhi bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs par gyur pa ni sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dngos gzhi bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par zhugs par gyur pa ni sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: After that, the attainment of the actual basis of the first absorption is called the result of the culmination of preparation.

original: de la mtshan nyid rab tu rig pas ni spang bar byas pa dang / thob par bya bas legs par yongs su shes nas //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rab tu rig pas ni spang bar byas pa dang / thob par bya bas legs par yongs su shes nas //
translated: By the knowledge of the characteristics, one understands well what is to be abandoned and what is to be attained.

original: spang ba dang thob par bya ba'i phyir sems 'jog go //
analyzed: spang ba dang thob par bya ba'i phyir sems 'jog go //
translated: Then one fixes the mind in order to abandon and attain.

original: mos pa las byung bas ni de'i 'og tu yang dag par sbyor ba brtsam mo //
analyzed: mos pa las byung bas ni de'i 'og tu yang dag par sbyor ba brtsam mo //
translated: By the one arisen from belief, one undertakes the correct application.

original: rab tu dben pa las byung bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa chen po rnams rab tu spang ngo //üîΩdga' ba sdud pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu dben pa las byung bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa chen po rnams rab tu spang ngo // dga' ba sdud pa ni /
translated: By the one arisen from seclusion, one abandons the great afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By the one arisen from joy, one abandons the medium and great afflictions.

original: spyod pas ni thob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa las sems 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: spyod pas ni thob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa las sems 'jog par byed do //
translated: By the one arisen from practice, one fixes the mind in the absence of the pride of attainment.

original: sbyor ba'i mtha' ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa chung ngu rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mtha' ni nyon mongs pa rnam pa chung ngu rab tu spong ngo //
translated: By the culmination of practice, one abandons the small afflictions.

original: sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bus ni yid la byed pa legs par bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu myong bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bus ni yid la byed pa legs par bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu myong bar byed do //
translated: By the result of the culmination of practice, one experiences the result of well-cultivated attention.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of entering the first concentration,

original: yid la byed pa bdun ji lta ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bdun ji lta ba de bzhin du /
translated: The seven attentions should be understood in the same way as above.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other meditative attainments, up to and including the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: rags pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa 'og ma thams cad de ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: rags pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa 'og ma thams cad de ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: The characteristic of coarseness is all the lower stages, up to and including the sphere of nothingness.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as twofold:

original: rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pas shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / shin tu tshe thung ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pas shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / shin tu tshe thung ba'o //
translated: the suffering of abiding in a state of great unrest, and the suffering of abiding in a state of great shortness of life.

original: de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the characteristic of calmness.

original: sa gong ma la ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa gong ma la ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the higher stages are characterized by calmness.

original: tshad rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: tshad rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
translated: How so by the establishment of the measure?

original: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngur yongs su bsgom pa dang / 'bring du yongs su bsgom pa dang / chen por yongs su bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngur yongs su bsgom pa dang / 'bring du yongs su bsgom pa dang / chen por yongs su bsgom pa'o //
translated: In the first meditative absorption, there is the cultivation of the small, the cultivation of the medium, and the cultivation of the great.

original: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for the other meditations and the formless meditative attainments.

original: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / cher yongs su bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu @219b ni bsam gtan dang po'i skye ba gsum mo //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / cher yongs su bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu @219b ni bsam gtan dang po'i skye ba gsum mo //
translated: The three births in the first meditation are the effect of the meditation cultivated in a weak, middling or strong manner.

original: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar /
translated: As for the first meditation,

original: bsam gtan lhag ma rnams kyi yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan lhag ma rnams kyi yang de bzhin te /
translated: so for the other meditations.

original: bsam gtan gyi skye ba rnam pa gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi skye ba rnam pa gsum gsum mo //
translated: Each meditation has three births as its effect.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / cher yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni chung ngu dang / 'bring po dang / cher yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meditations are cultivated in a weak, middling or strong manner.

original: re re la yang bsam gtan gyi skye ba gsum gsum ni 'bras bu yin te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: re re la yang bsam gtan gyi skye ba gsum gsum ni 'bras bu yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: Each meditation has three births as its effect.

original: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun du na 'don dang / tshangs chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar gong du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs ris dang / tshangs pa mdun du na 'don dang / tshangs chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar gong du bshad pa'o //
translated: The three births in the first meditation are the gods of the Brahma Group, the gods of the Brahmapurohita Group and the gods of the Great Brahm√§ Group.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir skye ba tha dad pa yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir skye ba tha dad pa yang med do //
translated: There is no separate birth for the formless beings because they have no other place.

original: de rnams na gzhal med khang gi gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams na gzhal med khang gi gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: For them, there is no other place in the celestial mansions.

original: de ltar der skye ba'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar der skye ba'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no classification of birth there.

original: der yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por yongs su bsgoms pas gzugs med pa rnams su skye ba mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom par shes so //
analyzed: der yang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por yongs su bsgoms pas gzugs med pa rnams su skye ba mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / ngan pa dang / gya nom par shes so //
translated: However, it is known that birth in the formless realms is high or low, bad or good, due to the differences in the extensive cultivation of the small, medium and great stages.

original: der skye ba mthon po dang / dma' ba ni tshe la sogs pa'i khyad par ro ;
analyzed: der skye ba mthon po dang / dma' ba ni tshe la sogs pa'i khyad par ro ;
translated: High and low birth there is due to the difference in life span, etc.

original: / dma' ba dang gya nom pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mang ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: / dma' ba dang gya nom pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mang ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Bad and good is due to the difference in the predominance of afflicted or unafflicted states.

original: ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
analyzed: ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu /
translated: How is it established by the designation of names?

original: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed la /
translated: There are as many samadhis included in the first absorptionüîΩas there are atoms in the great trichiliocosm.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi ming yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi ming yang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: The names of the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments of the buddhas and bodhisattvas are not even known to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //üîΩ'di ltar bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji snyed las /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming grangs med pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o // 'di ltar bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji snyed las /
translated: The names of the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments that are included in the four meditative concentrations are innumerable and inconceivable.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes na /üîΩde dag gi grangs su shes par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes na / de dag gi grangs su shes par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: In this way, the meditative concentrations and meditative attainments of the buddhas and bodhisattvas who have attained great power and who are included in the first meditative concentration are not even known by name to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.üîΩHow could they know their number

original: snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: or enter into them?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ting nge 'dzin brgya lhag cig bstan pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ting nge 'dzin brgya lhag cig bstan pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: As in the Perfection of Wisdom, more than one hundred concentrations are taught, and likewise in other MahƒÅyƒÅna s≈´tras.

original: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as they are included in the first concentration, they are also included in the remaining concentrations and the formless [absorptions].

original: de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brten nas so //üîΩrnam par dag @220a * //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brten nas so // rnam par dag @220a * //
translated: They are based on the perfections of concentration.

original: dag pa ji lta bu //üîΩrab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba bsam gtan dang po nas /
analyzed: dag pa ji lta bu // rab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba bsam gtan dang po nas /
translated: What is their purity?

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du rnam par dag pa zhes brjod do //üîΩrab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du rnam par dag pa zhes brjod do // rab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first concentration that arises from the peak of cyclic existence up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception are called pure.

original: yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentrations and formless [absorptions] that arise from the peak of cyclic existence are called pure because they establish special qualities.

original: 'dod pa bzhin du 'thob pa la sogs pas las su rung ba mchog tu phyin par khrid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du 'thob pa la sogs pas las su rung ba mchog tu phyin par khrid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to the supreme mastery of action, the attainment of the desired object, etc.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang /üîΩbsgom pa'i lam la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang / bsgom pa'i lam la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams te /
translated: What is the supramundane path?üîΩIt is the path of cultivation. It consists of the applications of mindfulness of the body, sensation, thought and the dharmas.

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i chos rnams dang / de rnams kyang brgyad de /
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i chos rnams dang / de rnams kyang brgyad de /
translated: It is the cognition of the factors and the subsequent cognition in regard to the truths of unsatisfactoriness, of the origin, of cessation and of the path.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa la chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa brgyad rnams te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa la chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa brgyad rnams te /
translated: It is the eight cognitions of the factors and subsequent cognition in regard to unsatisfactoriness, etc.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la brten pa rnams so //üîΩde dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la brten pa rnams so // de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gtan dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: It is based on the path of insight.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: It is the concentration associated with these cognitions, from the first absorption up to the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa nyid do //
translated: The sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation is mundane because the ideation is not completely clear there.

original: de rnams ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal bas /
analyzed: de rnams ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal bas /
translated: These are not fully clear because the movement of discernment is not clear.

original: 'phags pa'i lam rgyu ba la mchog tu gsal ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam rgyu ba la mchog tu gsal ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because those are not the basis for the supreme clarity of the ƒÅrya path, since the movement of ideation is not very clear there.

original: de 'ba' zhig gcig tu 'jig rten par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig gcig tu 'jig rten par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that only that is mundane.

original: de'i phyir de 'du shes dman pas dmigs pa mtshan mar mi byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'du shes dman pas dmigs pa mtshan mar mi byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the inferiority of ideation, the object is not taken as a sign.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called signless.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la yang 'phags pa'i lam med par gang las shes she na /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la yang 'phags pa'i lam med par gang las shes she na /
translated: How do we know that the ƒÅrya path does not exist in the base of neither ideation nor non-ideation?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du ji srid du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa rtogs so zhes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du ji srid du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de srid du kun shes pa rtogs so zhes so //
translated: Because the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúAs long as there is the meditative attainment of ideation, there is the realization of complete knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: is supramundane.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is attained subsequent to the ƒÅrya path.

original: mi rnams la mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mi rnams la mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: It is actualized by humans.

original: thog ma nyid du skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thog ma nyid du skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression ‚Äúfirst of all‚Äù indicates that one should first generate the superknowledges.

original: mi rnams la mngon par grub nas mi rnams la 'am gzugs kyi khams su mngon du byed do //üîΩsngar bskyed nas mi rnams kyi nang du tshe de nyid dam /
analyzed: mi rnams la mngon par grub nas mi rnams la 'am gzugs kyi khams su mngon du byed do // sngar bskyed nas mi rnams kyi nang du tshe de nyid dam /
translated: Having actualized them among humans, one actualizes them among humans or in the form realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas mngon du 'gyur ro //üîΩgzugs med pa'i khams rnams su ni 'di mngon du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas mngon du 'gyur ro // gzugs med pa'i khams rnams su ni 'di mngon du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Having previously generated them among humans, one actualizes them in that very life or after being reborn in the form realm.

original: zhi ba rnam par thar pa'i rnam par smin pas gnas pa rnams ni de la 'bad pa'i @220b rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'phags pa nyan thos gzugs kyi khams la 'dod chags dang bral te /
analyzed: zhi ba rnam par thar pa'i rnam par smin pas gnas pa rnams ni de la 'bad pa'i @220b rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro // 'phags pa nyan thos gzugs kyi khams la 'dod chags dang bral te /
translated: One does not actualize them in the formless realm because those who abide in the result of the peaceful liberation do not strive to generate them.

original: gzugs med pa thob pa gzugs kyi khams su ji ltar skya zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa thob pa gzugs kyi khams su ji ltar skya zhe na /
translated: How does a noble ≈õrƒÅvaka who is free from attachment to the form realm and who has obtained the formless realm take rebirth in the form realm?

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i nge pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i nge pa med do //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the form realm does not enter meditative attainment in the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there are four possibilities.

original: gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba de thams cad gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa gang /üîΩgzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa de thams cad gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhir 'gyur ste  //üîΩmi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba de thams cad gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa gang / gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa de thams cad gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhir 'gyur ste  // mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: All who enter meditative attainment in the peaceful liberation of the formless realm are free from attachment to the form realm.üîΩThis has four possibilities:

original: zhi ba rnam par thar pa ma thob pa ni mu dang po'o //
analyzed: zhi ba rnam par thar pa ma thob pa ni mu dang po'o //
translated: The first possibility is those who are free from attachment to the form realm but who do not obtain the peaceful liberation of the formless realm by relying on unrestricted access concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i 'phags pa gzugs med par skye ba don du mi gnyen bas spong ba'i lam bsal nas khyad par can gyi lam la gnas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i 'phags pa gzugs med par skye ba don du mi gnyen bas spong ba'i lam bsal nas khyad par can gyi lam la gnas te /
translated: The second possibility is ƒÅryas who obtain the fourth absorption but do not seek to take birth in the formless realm. They abandon the path of elimination and abide on the special path and then enter meditative attainment in the peaceful liberation of the formless realm.

original: gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The third possibility is those who are free from attachment to the form realm and who obtain the peaceful liberation of the formless realm.

original: de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba don du gnyer zhing spong ba'i lam la gnas te /
analyzed: de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba don du gnyer zhing spong ba'i lam la gnas te /
translated: The third alternative is the person who is intent on freedom from attachment and who is established in the path of abandonment.

original: gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
translated: He enters into the meditative attainment of the liberation that is the peaceful state of the formless realm.

original: rnam ba de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: rnam ba de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth alternative is the person who is not included in the previous three alternatives.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams ci'i phyir mngon sum du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams ci'i phyir mngon sum du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why do those who are born in the formless realm not manifest the meditative attainment of the formless realm?

original: zhi bar gnas par 'dod pa'i khams rnams ni mi'i nang du mngon par bsgrubs nas mngon du byed do //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas par 'dod pa'i khams rnams ni mi'i nang du mngon par bsgrubs nas mngon du byed do //
translated: Those who are intent on abiding in peace manifest the meditative attainment of the formless realm after they have accomplished it among humans.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa de dag ni bsgrib mi dgos par rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mchog tu zhi ba /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa de dag ni bsgrib mi dgos par rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i mchog tu zhi ba /
translated: Those who are born in the formless realm abide in the supreme peaceful state that arises from the maturation of karma, without the need for any obscuration.

original: rnam par thar pa la gnas pas gnas pa ste //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa la gnas pas gnas pa ste //
translated: They abide in the meditative attainment of the liberation.

original: de'i phyir de mngon sum du bya ba'i don du yang 'bad pa mi rtsom mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mngon sum du bya ba'i don du yang 'bad pa mi rtsom mo //
translated: Therefore, they do not make any effort to manifest the meditative attainment of the formless realm.
