original: lam chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste /
analyzed: lam chung ngu dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste /
translated: The small path, the medium path, and the great path.

original: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na sbyong ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa chen po'i chen po dang // chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na sbyong ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa chen po'i chen po dang // chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
translated: The great path of cultivation is the path by which one abandons the great of the great, the medium of the great, and the small of the great afflictions that are to be abandoned in the three realms in the various stages.

original: lam 'bring po gang //
analyzed: lam 'bring po gang //
translated: What is the medium path?

original: lam 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po ste //
analyzed: lam 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po ste //
translated: The small of the medium, the medium of the medium, and the great of the medium.

original: gang gis sa dang na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par 'bring po'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa dang na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par 'bring po'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
translated: By which one abandons the great of the medium, the medium of the medium, and the small of the medium afflictions that are to be abandoned in the three realms in the various stages.

original: lam chen po gang /üîΩlam chen po'i chung ngu dang / lam chen po'i @221a * //
analyzed: lam chen po gang / lam chen po'i chung ngu dang / lam chen po'i @221a * //
translated: What is the great path?

original: 'bring po dang / lam chen po'i chen po ste /
analyzed: 'bring po dang / lam chen po'i chen po ste /
translated: The small of the great, the medium of the great, and the great of the great.

original: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
translated: The small of the small, the medium of the small, and the great of the small afflictions of the three realms that are to be abandoned on each stage.

original: lam chung du dang / 'bring po dang / chen po re re la yang chung du la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsum du phye nas rnam pa dgur rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: lam chung du dang / 'bring po dang / chen po re re la yang chung du la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsum du phye nas rnam pa dgur rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Each of the small, medium, and great paths is divided into three types, small, etc., and are posited as nine types.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams rim gyis spang bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams rim gyis spang bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is taught that those to be abandoned by the path of meditation are serially abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir lam chung dus nyon mongs pa chen po spong zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam chung dus nyon mongs pa chen po spong zhe na /
translated: Why does the small path abandon the great affliction?

original: de ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / shin tu bral zhing 'dzem pa med pa'i sems kyi rgyud la kun du 'byung bas ;
analyzed: de ni ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / shin tu bral zhing 'dzem pa med pa'i sems kyi rgyud la kun du 'byung bas ;
translated: It arises in a mindstream that is completely devoid of shame and embarrassment and is shameless.

original: des rtogs par sla zhing yongs su bcad par sla ba ste /
analyzed: des rtogs par sla zhing yongs su bcad par sla ba ste /
translated: It is easy to realize and easy to comprehend.

original: de'i phyir de ni dri ma chen po bzhin du gnyen po chung ngus sel to //üîΩyang yongs su bcad dka' bar kun du 'byung zhing phral /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dri ma chen po bzhin du gnyen po chung ngus sel to // yang yongs su bcad dka' bar kun du 'byung zhing phral /
translated: Therefore, it is like a great stain that is removed by a small antidote.

original: rgyud la zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu de ni dri ma chung ngu bzhin du gnyen po chen po'i stobs kyis sel te de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa las bzlog nas /
analyzed: rgyud la zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu de ni dri ma chung ngu bzhin du gnyen po chen po'i stobs kyis sel te de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa las bzlog nas /
translated: Moreover, the arising of the small of the small afflictions that are difficult to eliminate and subtle is like a small stain that is removed by the power of a great antidote.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the antidote is established as the opposite of the aspect of the counteragent.

original: sbyor ba'i lam gang /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gang /
translated: What is the path of application?

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //üîΩlam gang bsgom pas chen po'i yang chen po la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi cha shas re re dang bral ba'i phyir rim gyis gnas gyur pa ni ;
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o // lam gang bsgom pas chen po'i yang chen po la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi cha shas re re dang bral ba'i phyir rim gyis gnas gyur pa ni ;
translated: It is that by which one abandons the afflictions.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor ba'i lam zhes brjod ngo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor ba'i lam zhes brjod ngo //
translated: The path of cultivation is called the path of application because it is the transformation of the basis that occurs gradually, due to being separated from each part of the negative reflex actions that are the specific aspects of the great of the great afflictions and so on.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gang /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gang /
translated: What is the uninterrupted path?

original: gang gi 'og tu bar chad med par nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi 'og tu bar chad med par nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After which, one will be able to eliminate the passions without interruption.

original: gang gi 'og tu nyon mongs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa'i gnas ngan len ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi 'og tu nyon mongs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa'i gnas ngan len ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: After which, one will be able to eliminate all the bad habits of the various passions.

original: gnas ngan len de gnas gyur pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnas ngan len de gnas gyur pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: The path of no-interruption is the transformation of those bad habits.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gang /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gang /
translated: What is the path of liberation?

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'o //üîΩgang gis gnas gyur pa mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa spangs nas rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'o // gang gis gnas gyur pa mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is that by which one realizes liberation after having eliminated the passions.üîΩIt is the path of liberation by which one realizes the transformation of those bad habits.

original: khyad par gyi lam gang nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de las gzhan pa la sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam gang nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de las gzhan pa la sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: What is the special path? It is the path of application, the path of no-interruption, and the path of liberation that are other than the above.

original: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma spong bar byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba la bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa'i lhag ma spong bar byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba la bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that after that, one eliminates the remaining passions by the path of application, the path of no-interruption, and the path of liberation.

original: yang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba bsal nas /üîΩchos sems pa'am /üîΩzhugs pa'i chos la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba bsal nas / chos sems pa'am / zhugs pa'i chos la gnas pa'am /
translated: Moreover, the path of distinction is the path of preparation for the abandonment of defilements,üîΩor the path of cultivation of the teaching,üîΩor the path of abiding in the teaching of entry,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gyi lam gang ngo //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gyi lam gang ngo //
translated: or the path of meditative concentration.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na khyad par can gyi @221b khams 'dis nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba de nyid bsal te zhes pa ni btang snyoms su byed ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na khyad par can gyi @221b khams 'dis nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba de nyid bsal te zhes pa ni btang snyoms su byed ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: In another way, the path of distinction is the path of preparation for the abandonment of defilements, by means of this special element, after having rejected it, that is to say, after having made it indifferent.

original: mdo la sogs pa'i chos sems pa'am /
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa'i chos sems pa'am /
translated: The path of cultivation of the teaching is the cultivation of the teaching of the Sutras, etc.

original: sngar bsams pa dang / khong du chud pa'i chos la so sor rtog pa'i gnas pa'i gnas pa'am /
analyzed: sngar bsams pa dang / khong du chud pa'i chos la so sor rtog pa'i gnas pa'i gnas pa'am /
translated: The path of abiding is the abiding in the discernment of the teaching that has been reflected upon previously and that has been understood.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i lam gang yin pa nyid 'dir yang khyad par gyi lam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i de ma thag pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i lam gang yin pa nyid 'dir yang khyad par gyi lam zhes brjod do //
translated: The path of meditative concentration is the meditative concentration that is immediately followed by meditative concentration.

original: yang yon tan khyad par can rnams mngon par bsgrub pa gnas pa'i lam gang ngo //
analyzed: yang yon tan khyad par can rnams mngon par bsgrub pa gnas pa'i lam gang ngo //
translated: Moreover, the path of abiding is the path of the accomplishment of special qualities.

original: yang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'am skyed pa la sogs pa de dag gis gnas pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'am skyed pa la sogs pa de dag gis gnas pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is the path of abiding by means of which one accomplishes or generates special qualities such as the superknowledges.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgya cher bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgya cher bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the path of cultivation in detail,

original: de'i zhar la byung ba ni lam bsgom pa gang /
analyzed: de'i zhar la byung ba ni lam bsgom pa gang /
translated: the author now discusses a topic related to it:

original: thob par bya ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa dang / bsten pa'i phyir bsgom pa dang / bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa dang / bsten pa'i phyir bsgom pa dang / bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: cultivation of the path for the sake of attaining, cultivation for the sake of reliance, cultivation for the sake of elimination, and cultivation of the antidote.

original: thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa gang /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa gang /
translated: What is cultivation for the sake of attaining?

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is cultivation for the sake of generating good qualities that have not yet arisen.

original: bsten pa'i phyir bsgom pa gang /
analyzed: bsten pa'i phyir bsgom pa gang /
translated: What is cultivation for the sake of reliance?

original: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi nyams pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams gnas pa dang / mi nyams pa dang / phyir zhing 'byung ba dang / 'phel ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is cultivation for the sake of maintaining, not degenerating, further arising, increasing, and eliminating good qualities that have already arisen.

original: bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa gang /
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa gang /
translated: What is cultivation for the sake of elimination?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is the meditation for the purpose of abandoning the evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have already arisen.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa gang //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa gang //
translated: What is meditation as counteragent?

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir gang bsgom pa'o //
translated: It is the meditation for the purpose of not producing the evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: lam bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi yang dag par spong ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi yang dag par spong ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The fourfold meditation on the path is in terms of the four right efforts.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //üîΩde la thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro // de la thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni /
translated: It is to be applied as is appropriate.

original: thob par bya ba'i don du bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i don du bsgom pa ste /
translated: Herein, meditation for the purpose of obtaining is the meditation for the purpose of obtaining what has not been obtained.

original: des dge ba'i chos ma thob pa rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos ma thob pa rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of obtaining the virtuous dharmas that have not been obtained.

original: bsten pa'i bsgom pa ni bstan pa nyid bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsten pa'i bsgom pa ni bstan pa nyid bsgom pa ste /
translated: Meditation for the purpose of cultivating is the meditation for the purpose of cultivating what has been obtained.

original: dge ba'i chos thob pa goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thob pa goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of cultivating the virtuous dharmas that have been obtained.

original: bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni bsal ba'i don du bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni bsal ba'i don du bsgom pa ste /
translated: Meditation for the purpose of eliminating is the meditation for the purpose of eliminating.

original: kun tu 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba'i chos sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba'i chos sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of eliminating the evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have already arisen.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa ni /
translated: Meditation as counteragent is the meditation for the purpose of counteracting.

original: gnyen po la bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po la bsgom pa ste /
translated: Meditation on the antidote.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba'i chos mi skye ba'i chos can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba'i chos mi skye ba'i chos can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes future nonvirtuous dharmas not to arise.

original: yang lam skye ba na rang gi bag chags 'jog pa de ni thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom mo //
analyzed: yang lam skye ba na rang gi bag chags 'jog pa de ni thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom mo //
translated: Moreover, when the path arises, it deposits its own propensities, and one meditates in order to obtain them.

original: das de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams cher 'bar bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: das de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams cher 'bar bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those that arise from their causes increase greatly.

original: de nyid mngon du gyur nas bsgom par 'gyur ba de ni bsten pa'i @222a * //
analyzed: de nyid mngon du gyur nas bsgom par 'gyur ba de ni bsten pa'i @222a * //
translated: When it becomes manifest, one meditates on it, and that is meditation on reliance.

original: bsgom pa'o // lam de nyid kyi kun du sbyor ba de nyid mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'o // lam de nyid kyi kun du sbyor ba de nyid mngon du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the fetters of that very path become manifest.

original: rang gi sgrib pa spong ba de ni bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sgrib pa spong ba de ni bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
translated: When one abandons one's own obscurations, one meditates in order to eliminate them.

original: des rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len 'gog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len 'gog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the cessation of the negative tendencies that are discordant with it.

original: sgrib pa spang nas kyang phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du 'jog pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa spang nas kyang phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du 'jog pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned the obscurations, one establishes them as dharmas that will not arise in the future, and that is meditation on the antidote.

original: gnas gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the transformation.

original: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spangs nas phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam de rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spangs nas phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because these paths of application and of immediate succession cause the abandonment of the defilements and the establishment of the non-arising of the latter.

original: yang gnyen po rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang gnyen po rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Again, there are four kinds of counteragents:

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang / spong ba'i gnyen po dang / rten gnyen po dang / thag bsring ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o //üîΩso so la bsgom pa zhes brjod par bya'o //üîΩrnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po gang /üîΩzag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su blta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po dang / spong ba'i gnyen po dang / rten gnyen po dang / thag bsring ba'i gnyen po bsgom pa'o // so so la bsgom pa zhes brjod par bya'o // rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po gang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su blta ba'o //
translated: the counteragent of abandonment, the counteragent of support, and the counteragent of distancing.

original: des nad dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nad dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The counteragent of abandonment should be mentioned first, but it is mentioned last because it is the most important.

original: spong pa'i gnyen po gang /
analyzed: spong pa'i gnyen po gang /
translated: What is the counteragent of abandonment?

original: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the path of application and the immediate path.

original: de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa sdang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nyon mongs pa sdang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they cause the abandonment of the defilements.

original: rten gnyen po gang /
analyzed: rten gnyen po gang /
translated: What is the counteragent of support?üîΩIt is the path of liberation.üîΩBecause it is the support of the acquisition of disjunction.üîΩWhat is the counteragent of distancing?üîΩIt is the path of advancement.üîΩBecause it causes the distancing of the defilements that are to be abandoned by it.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: the path of liberation.

original: de rnams kyis spong ba'i 'thob pa kun du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis spong ba'i 'thob pa kun du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they hold the acquisition of abandonment.

original: thag bsring ba'i gnyen po gang /
analyzed: thag bsring ba'i gnyen po gang /
translated: What is the path of distancing?

original: de'i gong ma'i lam mo //
analyzed: de'i gong ma'i lam mo //
translated: It is the path higher than that.

original: der sngar spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag ring du byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang brtag bya'i gnyen po bsgom pa ni /
analyzed: der sngar spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag ring du byed pa'i phyir ro // yang brtag bya'i gnyen po bsgom pa ni /
translated: Because it distances one from the defilements which have already been abandoned.

original: rnam par sun 'byin pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhir phye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pa la sogs pa'i gnyen po rnam pa bzhir phye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Furthermore, the path of the meditation of the counteractives is to be known as being divided into four kinds of counteractives, i.e., the counteractives of abandonment, of support, of distancing and of the antidote.

original: yang dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam dang / rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyor bar byed pa'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang bral ba'i lam dang /
analyzed: yang dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam dang / rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyor bar byed pa'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam dang / mngon par rtogs pa dang bral ba'i lam dang /
translated: Moreover, there is the path of thorough cognition of the object, the path of the arising of effort, the path of the application to concentration, the path of application to realization, the path of realization and the path of separation.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam dang / gnas dang dbang po tha dad pa'i lam dang / bslab pa gsum po yongs su sbyor ba'i lam dang / yon tan thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam dang ;
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i lam dang / rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam dang / gnas dang dbang po tha dad pa'i lam dang / bslab pa gsum po yongs su sbyor ba'i lam dang / yon tan thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam dang ;
translated: the path of clear realization, the path of definite deliverance that is pure, the path of different abodes and faculties, the path of thoroughly training in the three trainings and the path of yoga that accomplishes all good qualities.

original: lam sdud pa'i lam ni lam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lam sdud pa'i lam ni lam zhes brjod do //
translated: The path that subsumes those is called the path.

original: yang byang chub kyi yongs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis lam rnam pa bcu gcig tu rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub kyi yongs la sogs pa'i bye brag gis lam rnam pa bcu gcig tu rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, the path is posited as eleven types due to the differences of enlightenment and so on.

original: de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / lam bzhi dang / chos kyi gnas bzhi dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / dbang po gsum dang go @222b rims so //
analyzed: de yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / lam bzhi dang / chos kyi gnas bzhi dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / dbang po gsum dang go @222b rims so //
translated: They are the thirty seven factors of enlightenment, the four paths, the four abodes of Dharma, calm abiding, insight, the three faculties and their order.

original: de la dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
translated: The path of thorough examination of things is the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: des thog ma nyid du mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos kyi dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des thog ma nyid du mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos kyi dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, he thoroughly investigates the body, feelings, thought and dharmas in terms of their aspects of impurity, etc.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam ni yang dag par spong ba rnams te /
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam ni yang dag par spong ba rnams te /
translated: The path of the origin of striving is the four right efforts.

original: de ltar dngos po rnams yongs su brtags nas des sgrib pa spong ba'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam ni /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rnams yongs su brtags nas des sgrib pa spong ba'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro // ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam ni /
translated: Having thus thoroughly investigated the entities, he strives for the relinquishment of the obscurations.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams te /üîΩde ltar sgrib pa yongs su spangs pa ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams te / de ltar sgrib pa yongs su spangs pa ni /
translated: The path of the purification of meditative concentration is the four bases of supernatural power.

original: 'dis 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis las su rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i sgo'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis las su rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, he who has relinquished the obscurations purifies his meditative concentration by means of the bases of supernatural power.

original: mngon par rtogs par sbyor ba'i lam ni dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par sbyor ba'i lam ni dbang po rnams te /
translated: The path of application to realization is the five faculties.

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang bar byas pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang bar byas pa ni /
translated: Thus, he who has purified his meditative concentration generates the five faculties.

original: de la 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir dbang byed par 'gyur ba dro bar 'gyur ba dang / rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //üîΩmngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam ni stobs rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phyir dbang byed par 'gyur ba dro bar 'gyur ba dang / rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro // mngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam ni stobs rnams te /
translated: because it is the basis for the attainment of the noble path.

original: de ltar dbang byed pa thob pa ni 'dis de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩma dang pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la sbyor ro //üîΩmngon par rtogs pa'i lam ni /
analyzed: de ltar dbang byed pa thob pa ni 'dis de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro // ma dang pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa bzod pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la sbyor ro // mngon par rtogs pa'i lam ni /
translated: The powers are the path of preparation, because they are the basis for the attainment of the state of one who has attained the state of one who has attained the state of irreversibility.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te des thog ma kho nar so so rang gis de kho na mngon du yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te des thog ma kho nar so so rang gis de kho na mngon du yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment are the path of direct seeing, because one directly realizes reality for the first time.

original: rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par nges par 'byin pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: The path of cultivation is the eightfold noble path, because it is the basis for the complete relinquishment of the obscurations of the mental afflictions and the knowable.

original: de'i 'og tu des bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu des bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams /
translated: Then, through meditation, they abandon afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.üîΩ

original: rnam par dag par bya bar nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag par bya bar nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, by cultivating them, one definitely emerges in order to purify the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: de'i phyir de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs de dag gi go rims ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs de dag gi go rims ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the order of these factors of enlightenment should be understood in this way.

original: gnas dang dbang po tha dad pa'i lam ni lam bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas dang dbang po tha dad pa'i lam ni lam bzhi ste /
translated: The path of different bases and faculties is the four paths.

original: gnas ni bsam gtan gyi nyer bsngogs dang / dngos gzhi la sogs pa ni dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ni bsam gtan gyi nyer bsngogs dang / dngos gzhi la sogs pa ni dbang po rtul po dang rnon po'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bases are the access concentrations, actual bases, and so on, because they are differentiated by the specific faculties of dullness and sharpness.

original: bslab pa gsum po yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ni chos kyi gnas bzhi ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ni chos kyi gnas bzhi ste /
translated: The path of thoroughly training in the three trainings is the four abodes of BrahmƒÅ.

original: de rnams kyis lhag pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bslab pa gsum yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis lhag pa tshul khrims la sogs pa'i bslab pa gsum yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they thoroughly train in the three trainings of superior morality and so on.

original: yon tan thams cad mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad mngon par sgrub par byed pa'i lam ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
translated: The path of accomplishing all good qualities is calm abiding and insight.

original: de dag gis yon tan thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis yon tan thams cad bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the means of accomplishing all good qualities.

original: lam sdud pa'i lam ni dbang po gsum @223a * //
analyzed: lam sdud pa'i lam ni dbang po gsum @223a * //
translated: The three faculties are the path of application,

original: ste ; de rnams kyis thog ma dang / bar dang / mthar phyin pa'i lam yang dag par sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ste ; de rnams kyis thog ma dang / bar dang / mthar phyin pa'i lam yang dag par sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they correctly apply to the beginning, middle, and end of the path.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs chos rnams ni bye brag med par rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs chos rnams ni bye brag med par rnam pa lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are to be understood as being established in five ways, without distinction.

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The object, nature, aid, practice, and result of practice.

original: de'i phyir dang po re zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po re zhig dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first of all, the foundations of mindfulness are to be understood in terms of object, nature, aid, practice, and result of practice.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la ji lta bar byang chub kyi phyogs lhag ma rnams la'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la ji lta bar byang chub kyi phyogs lhag ma rnams la'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with the foundations of mindfulness, so it is with the remaining factors of enlightenment.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni dmigs pa gang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams ni dmigs pa gang /
translated: What is the object of the foundations of mindfulness?

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dang / go rims so //
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos rnams dang / go rims so //
translated: phenomena, and order.

original: yang dag pa'i gnas kyi dngos po dang / bdag gi longs spyod kyi gzhi dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gnas kyi dngos po dang / bdag gi longs spyod kyi gzhi dang / bdag gi dngos po dang / bdag kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: The basis of the body, the basis of enjoyment, the basis of the self, and the basis of the afflictions and purification.

original: ci'i phyir 'di dag dmigs par rnam par gzhag ce na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di dag dmigs par rnam par gzhag ce na ;
translated: Why are these established as objects?

original: 'di ltar byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni phal cher dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni phal cher dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten nas /
translated: Thus, those with erroneous minds, the childish, for the most part, in dependence on the body with the faculties,

original: bde ba la sogs pa la spyod pa na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rtog ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la spyod pa na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis bdag 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rtog ste /
translated: when experiencing pleasure and so forth, conceive the self to be afflicted by attachment and so forth, and purified by faith and so forth, through the characteristic of the object.

original: de'i phyir thog ma nyid du dngos po'i mtshan nyid de legs par yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma nyid du dngos po'i mtshan nyid de legs par yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to thoroughly investigate the characteristics of entities, the four kinds of objects are established.

original: ngo bo nyid gang shes rab dang / dran pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang shes rab dang / dran pa'o //
translated: The essence is wisdom and mindfulness.

original: lus la sogs pa la rjes su blta ba zhes bshad pa dang / dran ba nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la rjes su blta ba zhes bshad pa dang / dran ba nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: Because it is explained as the observation of the body, etc., and because it is explained as the establishment of mindfulness, respectively.

original: grogs gang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: grogs gang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The associates are the mind and mental factors that are concomitant with them.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Concomitant with them means

original: de dag ni shes rab dang / dran pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni shes rab dang / dran pa dag go //
translated: wisdom and mindfulness.

original: bsgom pa gang /
analyzed: bsgom pa gang /
translated: What is cultivation?

original: nang gi lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa'i rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa'i rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: It is the observation of the body, etc., in regard to the internal body, etc.

original: nang la ji ltar phyi dang / nang dang / phyi la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nang la ji ltar phyi dang / nang dang / phyi la yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with the internal, so with the external and with both the internal and external.

original: nang gi lus gang /
analyzed: nang gi lus gang /
translated: What is the internal body?

original: lus gang la nang gi skye mched gzugs can gang dag yin no //
analyzed: lus gang la nang gi skye mched gzugs can gang dag yin no //
translated: The body is the internal sense-spheres which are material.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: The eye, ear, nose, tongue and body sense-spheres.

original: nang gi skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are included in the internal sense-spheres and because they are counted as belonging to a living being.

original: phyi'i lus gang phyi'i skye mched gzugs can rnams so //
analyzed: phyi'i lus gang phyi'i skye mched gzugs can rnams so //
translated: The external body is the external sense-spheres which are material.

original: gzugs dang / @223b sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / rog bya rnams te /
analyzed: gzugs dang / @223b sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / rog bya rnams te /
translated: The form, sound, smell, taste and tangible-object sense-spheres.

original: phyi'i skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched rnams kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are included in the external sense-spheres and because they are not counted as belonging to a living being.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus gang /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus gang /
translated: What is the internal and external body?

original: nang gi skye mched dang 'brel ba'i phyi'i skye mched dbang po'i gnas rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched dbang po'i gnas su gyur pa rnams te sems can gyi grongs su gtogs pa dang / phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched dang 'brel ba'i phyi'i skye mched dbang po'i gnas rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched dbang po'i gnas su gyur pa rnams te sems can gyi grongs su gtogs pa dang / phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The external sense-spheres which are related to the internal sense-spheres are the sense-spheres of the eyes, etc. , and the sense-spheres of form, etc. , which are related to the sense-spheres of the eyes, etc. , and which are the bases of the sense-faculties.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched gzugs can rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched gzugs can rnams so //
translated: The internal sense-spheres of form of another's stream.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus ni skye mched rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyud rnam par gzhag pa brtsan par byas pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus ni skye mched rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyud rnam par gzhag pa brtsan par byas pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The internal and external bodies are distinguished by way of the distinction of the sense-spheres and the distinction of the streams.

original: / lus la lus kyi rjes su blta bar gang /
analyzed: / lus la lus kyi rjes su blta bar gang /
translated: The contemplation of the body in the body is the contemplation of the body as just a body.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs kyi lus dang / rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus la mnyam pa nyid du blta ba gang ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs kyi lus dang / rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus la mnyam pa nyid du blta ba gang ngo //
translated: It is the contemplation of the body of conceptualized form and the body of natural form as being the same.

original: lus la lus dang 'dra bar blta ba ste /
analyzed: lus la lus dang 'dra bar blta ba ste /
translated: The body is seen as similar to the body.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus mthong ba dang mthun par rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus la nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi lus mthong ba dang mthun par rang bzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus la nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one determines the body of real nature in accordance with the vision of the body of conceptual images.

original: nang gi tshor ba gang /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba gang /
translated: What is internal feeling?

original: nang gi lus la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi lus la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: It is feeling that arises in relation to one's own body.

original: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la dmigs pa dang / rang gi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i skye mched la dmigs pa dang / rang gi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has as its object the sense-fields of eye, etc. and because it arises from one's own abode.

original: phyi'i tshor ba gang /
analyzed: phyi'i tshor ba gang /
translated: What is external feeling?

original: phyi'i lus la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: phyi'i lus la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: It is feeling that arises in relation to the body of another.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang / gzhan gyi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang / gzhan gyi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has as its object form, etc. and because it arises from the abode of another.

original: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba gang /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba gang /
translated: What is internal and external feeling?

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la brten nas byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: It is feeling that arises in relation to one's own and another's body.

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa phyi'i skye mched la dmigs pa dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa phyi'i skye mched la dmigs pa dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has as its object the external sense-fields that are in one's own continuum and because it has as its object the internal sense-fields that are in another's continuum.

original: tshor ba ji lta bar sems la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshor ba ji lta bar sems la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the mind, as it is of sensation.

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ji lta bar tshor ba la sogs pa la tshor ba la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ji lta bar tshor ba la sogs pa la tshor ba la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as there is the contemplation of the body in the body, so there is the contemplation of sensation in sensation, and so on.

original: ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs su rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as it is appropriate in each case.

original: yang bsgom pa ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / rtsol ba dang / spro ba dang / mthun pa dang / phyir nur ba med pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang bsgom pa ni 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / rtsol ba dang / spro ba dang / mthun pa dang / phyir nur ba med pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bag yod pa'o //
translated: Furthermore, cultivation is will, vigor, effort, enthusiasm, tenacity, non-forgetting, introspection, and carefulness.

original: yid la mi byed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'dun pa bsgom mo //üîΩle lo'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por brtson 'grus bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: yid la mi byed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'dun pa bsgom mo // le lo'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por brtson 'grus bsgom pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of will is the antidote to the minor defilement of non-application.üîΩThe cultivation of vigor is the antidote to the minor defilement of laziness.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rtsol ba bsgom mo //
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rtsol ba bsgom mo //
translated: The cultivation of effort is the antidote to the minor defilements of languor and restlessness.

original: sems zhum pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por spro ba bsgom mo //
analyzed: sems zhum pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por spro ba bsgom mo //
translated: The cultivation of enthusiasm is the antidote to the minor defilement of mental slackness.

original: khyad par thob pa'i bya ba la bdag dman @224a * //üîΩpar sems pa'i sgo nas sgyid lug pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par thob pa'i bya ba la bdag dman @224a * // par sems pa'i sgo nas sgyid lug pa'o //
translated: Discouragement is the thought that one is unable to attain the special goal.

original: gnod pas yongs su skyo ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por mthun pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: gnod pas yongs su skyo ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por mthun pa bsgom mo //
translated: The remedy for the mental affliction of being completely discouraged by harm is the cultivation of patience.

original: gnod pa yongs su skyo ba ni sha sbrang dang / sbrang du la sogs pa'i gnod pas nyen pa mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa yongs su skyo ba ni sha sbrang dang / sbrang du la sogs pa'i gnod pas nyen pa mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Being completely discouraged by harm is the inability to tolerate the harm of others, such as being bitten by mosquitoes and gadflies.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por phyir nur ba med par bsgom mo //
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por phyir nur ba med par bsgom mo //
translated: The remedy for the secondary affliction of being satisfied with just a little is the cultivation of the absence of turning back.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs 'di tsam gyis chog pa'o zhes phyir bzlog pa'o //üîΩgdams ngag brjed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por dran pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni gnyen po'i phyogs 'di tsam gyis chog pa'o zhes phyir bzlog pa'o // gdams ngag brjed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por dran pa bsgom mo //
translated: Being satisfied with just a little is turning back, thinking, ‚ÄúThis much is enough for the side of the remedy.‚ÄùüîΩThe remedy for the secondary affliction of forgetting the instruction is the cultivation of mindfulness.

original: ltung ba yid la gcags pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin bsgom mo //
analyzed: ltung ba yid la gcags pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por shes bzhin bsgom mo //
translated: The remedy for the secondary affliction of regretting a downfall is the cultivation of vigilance.

original: ltung ba yid la gcags pa ni /
analyzed: ltung ba yid la gcags pa ni /
translated: Regretting a downfall is

original: 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la shes bzhin med par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la shes bzhin med par spyod pa ste /
translated: He acts without mindfulness in going, coming, etc.

original: sngar bslab pa dang 'gal nas phyis 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bslab pa dang 'gal nas phyis 'gyod pa'o //
translated: He regrets after having transgressed the precepts.

original: brtson pa 'dor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por bag yod pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: brtson pa 'dor ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por bag yod pa bsgom mo //
translated: He cultivates heedfulness as the counteragent to the secondary defilement of abandoning striving.

original: brtson par 'dor ba ni bag chags med pa'i nyes pa dge ba'i phyogs ji ltar brtsams pa la sbyor ba la sogs pa mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson par 'dor ba ni bag chags med pa'i nyes pa dge ba'i phyogs ji ltar brtsams pa la sbyor ba la sogs pa mthar phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandoning striving is the fault of the absence of the instinct for virtue, because one does not complete the application, etc. to the virtuous side, which one has begun.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu gang /
translated: What is the result of cultivation?

original: phyin ci log spong ba dang / bden pa la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log spong ba dang / bden pa la 'jug pa dang / lus la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of the perversions, the entry into the Truths, and the separation from the body, etc.

original: de la phyin ci log spong ba ni go rims bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log spong ba ni go rims bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang bdag tu phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa la mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therein, the abandonment of the perversions is through the applications of mindfulness, respectively, by means of the cultivation of the unpleasant, because of the perversions of taking the impure for pure, the painful for pleasant, the impermanent for permanent, and the insubstantial for substantial.

original: gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever one feels,

original: de ni 'di ltar sdug par shes pa'i phyir dang / gnas dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sdug par shes pa'i phyir dang / gnas dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is recognized as such, and because it is recognized that consciousness changes from moment to moment due to the differences of place, object, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos tsam du zad de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chos tsam du zad de /
translated: The dharmas are merely afflicted and purified,

original: byed pa med par yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa med par yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are recognized as being without an agent.

original: yang 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du bden pa bzhi la 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du bden pa bzhi la 'dug pa ste /
translated: Moreover, their results are the four noble truths in order.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: The mindfulness of the body enters into the truth of suffering,

original: lus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid gnas ngan len gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid gnas ngan len gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body is distinguished by the suffering of the formative forces and by the negative reflex actions.

original: 'di ltar de'i gnyen por gyur pa shin du sbyangs pa'i lus nyid la khyad par can du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i gnyen por gyur pa shin du sbyangs pa'i lus nyid la khyad par can du 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the body is distinguished as the special basis of pliancy, which is the antidote to that.

original: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshor ba dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa 'jug ste /
translated: The mindfulness of feeling enters into the truth of origination,üîΩbecause the truth of origination is distinguished by craving.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba ni phrad pa la sogs par sred pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba ni phrad pa la sogs par sred pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the craving for contact, etc. is the basis of the craving for pleasure, etc.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas @224b ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste /üîΩbdag med cing rnam par shes pa tsam med par 'gyur bar lta ba ni /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag pas @224b ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste / bdag med cing rnam par shes pa tsam med par 'gyur bar lta ba ni /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the mind leads to the truth of cessation,üîΩbecause the view that the non-existence of the self and the mere non-existence of consciousness is liberation

original: bdag chad par dogs pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag chad par dogs pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: terrifies one who fears the annihilation of the self.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: The application of mindfulness to the dharmas leads to the truth of the path,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos spang ba dang / gnyen po'i chos la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos spang ba dang / gnyen po'i chos la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis for the elimination of dharmas that are adverse and for the realization of dharmas that are remedies.

original: yang de dag gi 'bras bu ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dang bral bar go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang de dag gi 'bras bu ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang / chos dang bral bar go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, their results should be understood as the separation from body, sensation, mind, and dharmas, respectively,

original: de dag bsgoms pas lus la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pas lus la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by cultivating those, one is separated from the negative reflex actions of the body, etc.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa gang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi dmigs pa gang /
translated: What is the object of the right efforts?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The unfavorable and the counteragent, whether arisen or not arisen.

original: dang po'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa ste /
analyzed: dang po'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa ste /
translated: The first has for its object the unfavorable that has arisen,

original: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in order to abandon the unfavorable, the nonvirtuous, that has arisen.üîΩThe second has for its object the unfavorable that has not arisen,

original: gnyis pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa dang / gsum pa'i gnyen po ma skyes pa dang / bzhi pa yis ni gnyen po skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa dang / gsum pa'i gnyen po ma skyes pa dang / bzhi pa yis ni gnyen po skyes pa ste /
translated: the third has for its object the nonarising of the counteragent, and the fourth has for its object the arising of the counteragent.

original: ji ltar mdo sde las bsdus pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde las bsdus pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the four right efforts as they are summarized in the S≈´tra.

original: ngo bo nyid gang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang /
translated: What is their nature?

original: brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus so //
translated: It is vigor.üîΩWhat is their proximate cause?üîΩIt is the thought and thought-concomitants associated with vigor.üîΩWhat is their cultivation?üîΩIt is the production of will, the effort, the vigor, the mind, and the thought of those who are cultivating the right efforts.

original: grogs gang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: grogs gang / de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: What is their function?üîΩIt is the abandonment of the unfavorable that has already arisen, the prevention of the unfavorable that has not yet arisen, the production of the favorable that has not yet arisen, and the development of the favorable that has already arisen.

original: bsgom pa gang /üîΩgang 'dun pa skyed do //
analyzed: bsgom pa gang / gang 'dun pa skyed do //
translated: What is their manifestation?üîΩIt is the four right efforts.üîΩWhat is their excellence?

original: 'bad do // brtson 'grus rtsom mo //

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus bsgom pa gnas dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus bsgom pa gnas dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: zhi gnas dang / rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa la brtson 'grus rtsom mo //

analyzed: byid ba dang rgod pa sel ba yang brtson 'grus nyid de /

analyzed: 'di ltar de'i 'og tu sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa smos so //

analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pa gnyen po thob med pa 'ba' zhig bsgom pa de'i tshe 'bad pa zhes brjod do //

analyzed: gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba 'byung ba de bsal ba'i phyir /

analyzed: dga' bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa rnams kyis ni sems 'bar bar byed pa dang / nye bar nyon mongs pa rgod par byed pa na /

analyzed: nang du sdug pa'i sgo nas sems 'dzin pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes brjod do //

analyzed: @225a * // de'i phyir bying ba dang rgod pa bsal ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the means of removing laxity and excitation,

analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa smos so //
translated: immediately after that, he mentions ‚Äúfirmly holding the mind‚Äù and ‚Äúfirmly placing the mind.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu gang /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang /

analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par nyams pa dang / gnyen po thob pa dang / 'phel ba'o //
translated: The complete destruction of all adverse elements, the attainment of the counteragent, and the increase of that counteragent.

original: de la yang dag par spong ba dang po dang gnyis pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par nyams pa ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag par spong ba dang po dang gnyis pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par nyams pa ste /

analyzed: 'bras bu de gnyis kyi ji ltar mthun mthun du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa rnams nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: gsum pa ni gnyen po thob pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyen po thob pa ste /

analyzed: des dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bzhin pa ni gnyen po thob pa 'phel ba ste /

analyzed: des dge ba'i chos skyes pa rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin grub pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //

original: ngo bo nyid gang /

original: ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin to //

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang /

analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gang /

analyzed: tshe gzhan la des sems kyi sa bon yongs su brtas pa'i phyir /

analyzed: rang gi ngang gis ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su mthun par gyur nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o //

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang /

analyzed: yang 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang /

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang /
